Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Ocean City, MD.”
Reviews.Author: babbsie
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th year staying at the Hilton Suites and we would not stay anywhere else in Ocean City, MD. The hotel is spotless and all of our contacts with staff have been positive. The suites are clean and comfortable with magnificent ocean views from the bedroom as well as the balcony. The balcony is clean and furnished with a glass table and 2 chairs. Housekeeping is done in a very timely fashion daily. I brought Clorox wipes just to freshen up the kitchen, but they were not necessary! The pools are clean and the children's lovely private water park is sparkling clean and well staffed with diligent lifeguards! There are plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas at both the adult pool and the kiddie water park and fresh towels are available at the pools. The adult outside pool has a swim- up bar and servers are available at both pools for food and drinks. The beach is clean and well cared for. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is that the more formal restaurant is not very good, but with all of the choices in the area it didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Oceanfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jooheaThroop
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we have stayed at this hotel and we can't wait to go back again. It is the perfect place for families to stay, especially if you have children! The Hilton has a beautiful location that gives you the perfect oceanfront experience. The hotel offers two outdoor heated pools, one meant for adults that includes a swim up pool bar and is next to the sandwich and burger stand. Prices are not cheap but are what you expect at his type of facility. it also has a fantastic kids pool with water slides and spouting water geysers which the children love. The kids pool is shallow and is about 4 feet at its deepest point. There is also an indoor pool for any rainy days. The hotel also has a restaurant which offers breakfast and dinner as well as a lounge for some evening relaxation. Prices are fairly high during the summer but start to drop after Labor Day which is a great time to visit due to the smaller crowds and more open beaches. The suites offer everything anyone would need. There is a kitchen area with refrigerator, microwave, stove, and all the necessities. There is a living room area with a flatscreen t.v. and a pull out couch that serves as another potential sleeping area. The bedroom offers the most comfortable beds and pillows anywhere. It also has a flatscreen t.v. and a balcony that offers the most beautiful views of the Atlantic Ocean. I would highly recommend the Hilton to anyone looking for a nice stay in beautiful Ocean City, Maryland!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Kim8888
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 2 children 17 months and 3.5 yrs old just returned from a post labor day vacation. We had a fantastic time. The suites are perfect for families we had breakfast and lunch in our room most days. The staff we came in contact with in every location of the hotel were fantastic. Everyone was very polite and welcoming. I really have no complaints at all. I would advise to get the best bargain go just before or after peak season for rates that are 50% less. While I do love this hotel, I will not return for $500+ a night. I will be back however next year the week of labor day! The pool is the best around for small children. Our kids had such a great time! The water slides and shallow depths made for hours and hours of fun. Our first night there, to my horror, we returned from the boardwalk and looked outside and found that the pool had been emptied! OMG, this could have ruined our vacation. I called the front desk and they assured me that the pool will be fun and warmed for the kids in the morning. I was shocked to find that the pool really was full and the heat was going all day long. They kept the heat on for the kids to use the pool all week long, very impressive. The indoor pool could have been a bit warmer. We did use the indoor pool the day we had rain. It seemed they did run a hose with hot water to the pool but it wasn't really helping. The food is excellent in the restaurants and at the pool. The drinks are fantastic, happy hour prices are $3 for any beers and the wait staff was always nearby. We can not wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel although somewhat overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sam g
Reviews.Content: We come here for a few nights around Labor Day for the last 4-5 years. Excellent location only a few blocks from the Boardwalk, close enough so you could walk if you want to but far enough that there is no noise. Plenty of places within walking distance to buy take out breakfast or lunch including all your fast food chains. Although it has great rooms, very good service, very nice pools I still think rooms rates around Labor day are grossly overpriced but because we are member of the Hilton club and get at least some of the nights as part of rewards program the cost ends up to be reasonable. The one issue I have with the hotel is it’s grossly overpriced restaurants. They are not very good and prices are absurdly high even for OC.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn good”
Reviews.Author: SilverandBlackAttack
Reviews.Content: Only reason this doesn't get 5 is because our check-in experience was sub-par and beds weren't great. I am a Diamond member, called in advance to ensure room was all set for late arrival. Upon arrival, was checked into 208. Too low for a good view, and balcony of larger suite next door totally encroached on our privacy. Asked to be moved, front desk said they'd check w Manager and call me back (it's late). No phone call, went to front desk to ask again and bumped into Manager, who was helpful and moved us to 906, much better. I know property was sold out, but why wasn't I placed in the better room from the start, saving us the 1.5 hour hassle? Should be automatic for Diamond members. Also, no amenities provided in either room. Don't forget the amenities!!!!!!! Rest of stay was pleasant and uneventful aside from the Queen beds sagging, which had my wife and I rolling into one another. Time to replace them!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RidgewoodTravelers
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a great place to spend a long weekend as we just did over Labor Day. The rooms were spacious enough. We had a standard oceanview suite. You enter to a LR with pullout sofa, dresser/TV and small table with 4 chairs, go through a galley kitchen with a full bath with jacuzzi tub into a BR with 2 queens and sliders to a balcony overlooking the beach. We had 2 adults and 3 teens/preteens and faired well with the amount of space for 4 nights. Beds were super comfy.The suite is cleaned daily but most days it was late in the day when we were coming back from the beach so it wasn't ready for us to shower but they were quick about finishing up. There are 2 outdoor pools. One for adults and families with a swim up bar, and one for families and smaller children with sprinklers and a small water slide. The outdoor pools close at dusk. There is a very good size indoor pool as well and that is open until midnight. There is a game room for the kids and a restaurant and bar. It's a big hotel so the pools were pretty crowded. The hotel is right on the beach so you go from the lobby down some steps to the sand. There is an OC lifeguard station right at the hotel in season. The beach was clean and well kept. Note: When the wind was blowing from the east, there were hardly any bugs. Apparently when the wind blows from the west, there are tons of flies on the beach. We had 2 days like this and they were nasty and bit us all until we had to leave the beach late in the day. I don't think this is the norm but bring strong bug spray to be safe if you plan on being at the beach. Ocean City is definitely a coin operated town and there isn't much to do that doesn't cost. We ate at a few local places and the checks were about 25% higher than I typically pay for the same meals locally or on the FL coast where we spend a lot of time. The boardwalk was very busy but not terribly noisy so it was tolerable. It's good to take a walk and see the sights at night. Our favorite thing we did was pack a lunch, bathing suits and towels and headed to Assateague Island. The wild ponies were right there on the beach with us and it was very cool. Most of the staff at the Hilton except for the front desk and bellmen seemed to be seasonal staff mostly eastern European women. I learned that they come and work for the summer and send $$ home. As noble as that is and maybe they were all worn out because it was the end of the summer, but most seemed to be phoning it in and not really into their jobs. This is not what I typically see at Hilton properties. I was staying the weekend on HiltonHonors points not cash so it didn't pain me as much. All in all I would recommend the hotel for anyone who wants to go to OC. The beach is beautiful the rooms are nice, but manage your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay. I enjoyed it for the most part.”
Reviews.Author: PocomokeMdWalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our Honeymoon and had a good time. I always enjoyed OC, Md and this time was no acception. The room had a living area, kitchen, bedroom with jacuzzi, and bathroom. Everything was great. We arrived around 11pm-ish and i tried ordering a bottle of wine to celebrate but was met with resistance from the staff who said the kitchen was closed and there was nothing they could do. So it's because of that i can't give them perfect reviews. I know they have certain protocol they have to follow and there habds were tied but i still thought for this occasion an exception could have been made. It was out honeymoon for goodness sakes lol. Anyway, we really did have a nice clean room and room service was great after check-in night and Ocean City was a great time also. So yea, i would recommend this place to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel not worth the money and staff was incredibly rude.”
Reviews.Author: Kcibrone
Reviews.Content: We come to Ocean City every year and decided to try the Hilton because the majority of the reviews were decent. This was the worst mistake we could have made. The people who left the good reviews must not have very high standards. I will start off saying the lobby of the hotel was nice but that is the only good thing I can say. We got to our room and the room was filthy. The bed duvets had stains all over them as well as the sheets. It looked like they hadn't been washed in months. We then checked the bed and found evidence of bed bugs to include eggs. They moved us to another room and the supervisor of housekeeping was waiting for us and told us that they were going to remake the beds becuase she herself found that those sheets were unacceptable. The mattreses looked ok in that room so we agreed to stay. After wasting two hours of changing rooms and having them reclean we decided to just have dinner in the hotel at 32the Palms. The food was disgusting and wait staff was rude and never even brought refills we asked for. My two yr old daughter got a grilled cheese and it was like a brick. Ridiculous! When we got back to our room we went to get a bath and found that none of the jets in the tub worked. Then we went out to the balcony and found that it was infested with ants so they had to send maintenance to spray out there at 10 at night. After all of that we decided to just check out and go to another hotel the next morning. At first they were hesistant about letting us cancel the remainder of our trip without charging us, I could not believe that. After arguing the managers response was well it appears we don't meet your expectations so you can leave. They were so rude about everything. I have never been treated so badly at a hotel. I am truly appauled by this especially because it is a Hilton and the price they charge. Even the pools were not kept clean, there were dead bugs and sand everywhere. If just once they would have apologized and offered to make the situation right I would have no problem staying at another Hilton in the future, but they did not. I would not ever return to this hotel and now no other Hilton eithetr because if this is how they train their staff to treat people then no thank you. Please be aware of this hotel, it is definitely not what you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: billymack
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff, and great location.. Very clean, great view from all rooms, and walking distance from boardwalk, and across the street from awesome waterpark for kids.... Hotel right on the beach, and easy to bring all your kids beach stuff from your car to beach, so you never have to take it back to the room. Movies by the pool,activities for kids, and a pool bar,this is a fun place and great for families.

Reviews.Title: “this is the place to be in OC”
Reviews.Author: jasonHSyosset
Reviews.Content: every room has full ocean view. the hotel has easy beach access. plenty of parking free of charge. the staff are courteous and quick to respond. plenty of room on the beach to make your spot. 3 pools and there are also kid activities onsite

Reviews.Title: “Best in OC”
Reviews.Author: Rickny9
Reviews.Content: Excellent property and outstanding staff. Kristen, the front desk mgr is the most customer service oriented hotel personel i've ever experienced. She goes so far above and beyond I truly can't express how much. We've vacationed here every year, 3rd wk of aug., for the past five years and the property never fails to satisfy. Extremely family friendly, not a quiet place, but perfect for kids of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Loving the beautiful ocean view at Hilton Ocean City Suites!”
Reviews.Author: CrownPoint
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to families with children. We were there in the 3rd week of August and we saw kids, kids and more kids. It is good to be aware of that fact as I would not call the atmosphere "peaceful: As a middle aged couple and having raised our children(so we do love children) we should have read the previous reviews and may have changed our hotel selection to get a more "getaway experience". Having said that, the hotel is very nice. The rooms are very clean with pretty decor. The big sliding glass door in the bedroom with 2 awesome queen beds overlooks a gorgeous ocean view. We were only given the choice of floor 2 or 4 and we picked 4 so we would be higher. We would have preferred even higher as you seem so close to the pool, music and ALL the activity and noise that goes with that. Every need we had was promptly met. Example, our room had not been clean yet by 3:00 PM, we called down to the front desk courteously and someone was sent up within 5 mins. We needed a cot one evening, made the courteous call and received a cot promptly. Continental breakfast - we were offered it but were confused as to where we could get our food, drinks, etc. Maybe the staff could have been a bit more clear. Not sure where the fresh fruit I heard about from previous reviewers was. Laundry- was complimentary, no quarters needed, and was an absolute wonderful perk. 2 washers and 2 dryers per floo. Ordering a movie - was outrageous @ 16.99 for 1. It was something we normally wouldn't do but it was a rainy day and we had a few hours to kill. Wish the prices were more competitive. Overall it was such a nice place and would recommend this hotel for a great experience and I wish you a wonderful vacation at Ocean City Hilton,

Reviews.Title: “This has been our 4th annual visit and we are loving it”
Reviews.Author: PhilAlexander
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers the right kind of activities that suit our family with two young children. The rooms are well appointed with two separate rooms a decent size kitchen and large bathroom with a jacuzzi. I heard from other guests about various problems they encountered but our stays have been spared any headaches with this year being maybe somewhat of an exception. Nevertheless, I rate it five stars for everything that it has to offer. Excellently spaced rooms, three pools, access to a very large beach, a gorgeous view from any floor above the first level, many free kids activities from arts and crafts to cooking classes and daily movie nights, concierge services, a really decent poolside food service (that could stay open a little longer) and Coffeshop (with some Starbucks products). The staff is overall very courteous and helpful. Is it perfect? No, but what on earth is perfect. The high cost of a room is not that unreasonable if you consider the two two room with two queen beds, a queen pull-out sleeper sofa and plenty of room for kids air mattresses or a hotel-provided crib. We book every year at least 8 months ahead to not run into any booking issues. I would have plenty more to say about the logistics of getting these large rooms ready for customers trying to check in earlier then 3 PM while allowing other to stay later than 11:00 AM at the same time keeping the rooms to a standard of cleanliness that is necessary. Needless to say, there is lefty of room to complain if you have a hotel full of Hilton Diamond and Gold members who play their membership level trump card quite frequently. I love this place and would not consider staying anywhere else while in OC. I consider it a home away from home. A few ways to improve would be to train staff in the following: - No bellman bs stories necessary if you don't want to share your carts at 8:30 PM. I doubt that 2 of 3 carts have flat tires. The bellmen are mostly very senior, so train the rookies in proper conduct. Keeps the tips flowing in the long-run. - I should not have my floor neighbor open my room door with his key. What was that all about? I call my own customers personally for something less important. - If customers voice concern about some clearly offensive hotel guests who need to show their white hoodie confederate flag pride shirtless (not making this up), a call from the hotel manager would be OK to calm down some nerves. This is America and freedom of speech is key and people can ink whatever they please. At least you asked for a cover up. - You need to figure out a way to get the rooms serviced while working around your other constraints and guest personal schedules. Why not just ask a guest what works for them during their stay? Just some thoughts to your great place even better.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Todnick
Reviews.Content: My husband and two teenage children spent a little under a week at the Hilton Suites. By far the best thing about the hotel is the location. It sits directly on the beach with great views of the ocean from the room balcony and access from the first and ground floors. It appears to be a private beach for hotel guests only; and, although it does fill up, there was always a spot to put down towels or beach chairs and be fairly close to the water. There are two chair and umbrella rental kiosks down at the beach for those wanting to spend the whole day. Also, the hotel is located quite close to a number of shops and restaurants and is within a half-mile or so of the beginning of the bordwalk. We walked down and took the tram for $3.00 a piece (each way) down to where all the action is further down....very convenient. The suite itself is a small living room area with a pullout couch, a galley kitchen, large bathroom with two sinks, and a large bedroom with a balcony overlooking the pools and beach area. The living room is small and dark because of the way the room is situated with the windows at the back toward the beach. The pullout couch was not comfortable and my son ended up sleeping directly on the couch. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom had decent toiletries and plenty of towels. Service was good. My one complaint is that the entire property, which is fairly new, seems a bit worn already. The pool had a constant film of sand in it from people coming in from the beach. It never seemed to be fully cleaned out. The bar area down by the beach was grimy and our table was not cleaned when we sat down (only plates and drink cups were removed). The carpet and walls were a bit stained in the room. The whole place seemed like it was in need of a good cleaning and paint job. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay. The area is quite built up so lots to do, especially for the kids and the beach is gorgeous. We would recommend for a short family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandy M
Reviews.Content: Not only was this a great place to visit but the hotel is the best in ocean city. We had four teenagers with us and all were entertained by the beautiful beach and the wonderful pools Hilton had to offer. Our room was spacious enough for the boys and the master bedroom had the balcony with a view of the ocean. It is pricey but worth every penny when you consider having a full kitchen. It is about five blocks from the boardwalk, well within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Full Service Beach Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: thelevinefamily
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed ourselves at this hotel. The rooms are like larger Embassy Suites one-bedroom units with a full kitchen. We were able to fit 4 teens into the living room area by using the queen size sofa bed and two air mattresses. The guys were fine with it. My wife and I enjoyed the large bedroom and the awesome oceanview terrace. While the terrace isn't huge, given the view, who cares. It's a pleasure to find a hotel of the caliber in Ocean City. We had a great time at the beach, which was incredibly clean. The water quality was outstanding. On several occasions we were entertained by passing schools of dolphins frolicking very nearby by. The hotel also has an indoor pool, as well as two outdoor pools, one of which is for kids. For families with young children, the kid's pool is wonderful, and there seemed to be a lot of activities at the hotel for little kids. But the other pool was relatively quiet, except when one of the hotel bands was playing (a little too loudly). The staff was great. The concierges were very helpful, and the restaurant was pretty good. I would like to see a better quality gym at the hotel. If you're looking for a laid back but quality hotel, this is a good fit. If you want a quiet, secluded space, this is not for you, nor is this a party hotel. We are already excited to be booking for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: coramdeo_10036
Reviews.Content: OK- I generally like places I go to since I spend so much time reading the opinions of all you guys who contribute to tripadvisor. But there are good reasons I'm giving them 1 star. My family and I occupied 4 rooms on the fifth floor of this property between August 9-12. The property is pretty nice, and it is on the beach. However, when you're paying about $600 per night per room- I guess you have certain expectations around the little things. I just don't feel like they lived up to this. But the most disturbing thing is the following- as soon as we got home, my wife realized that she left a couple dresses and some of my clothing in the closet of our room. I told her not to worry- the hotel will surely mail them back to us and probably free of charge. I called them on Sunday, and I am writing this review on Wednesday evening. While this episode has not concluded, I am about 99.99% sure that someone in housekeeping took our clothing. To be fair, everything is still "under investigation". This is a relatively simple matter though at this point, and they either believe me and my family or they think we're lying. I'll update once this situation is resolved- but dealing with them the past 4 days has been very difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: mk14617
Reviews.Content: We had a mini-vacation here. This hotel is almost perfect. Suites are generously sized, and ours had a superb view of the ocean. Full and functional kitchen, glorious new bed, two flat-screen TV's, wonderful shower and therapeutic jacuzzi. Plus super service (cookies and sparkling water during an evening visit), great breakfast, free parking, much more. Since I always try to find SOME room for improvement somewhere, here's one quibble: the two TV's do not get either MASN or MASN2, which meant that we couldn't watch either the Washington Nationals or the Baltimore Orioles -- so the hotel should rethink its cable or satellite contract. But that's all I can find that was less than 100% perfect. Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Beach time”
Reviews.Author: Bill056
Reviews.Content: The hotel is kept very clean for being right on the beach. There is two pools outside and one inside. Lots of families and kids. The beach is very clean. There is no executive lounge for Gold or Platium card holders. But they give you discounts in the restaurants. There is plenty of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh...Atlantic”
Reviews.Author: nykknak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Ocean City from May 10-12. We're Hilton Honors customers, so we expected nothing but the best. We arrived at the Hilton and were promptly checked in. The room was gorgeous. Everything was meticulously clean, so we were very excited about being there. The view was AWESOME!!! We were on the top floor and since it was off season, the entire city was rather quiet. We had 2 complimentary vouchers for the breakfast buffet Friday morning. When we got to the restaurant, 32 Palms, we were informed that there was no buffet that morning. We were then told that our vouchers were worth $15. We were displeased, but we had to eat, so we ordered breakfast. My husband found hair on his steak. We called the waitress over and she apologized profusely. She went to get her manager. The manager didn't come out at all. The waitress then took the steak off of the bill. As she was leaving she informed us that her tip wasn't included in the bill. I was a little irritate by this time, so hearing her campaign for a tip wasn't exactly what I needed at the moment. We paid the bill and went immediately to the service counter to let the Manager know what had taken place. My husband then asked that the package price be adjusted to reflect the fact that we had to pay for breakfast. We were assured that it would be rectified. We went sightseeing and shopping and had a great time for the remainder of our trip. We went to check out and the bill hadn't been adjusted. We then had to wait for the manager to be contacted and our story confirmed. We were then offered 1000 reward points. We were unsatisfied with the level of service in this hotel--and very surprised since we LOVE Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: MomofHandH
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved every part of this hotel, well, other than the price. The location is fantastic - you can walk to restaurants, amusement park, boardwalk, beer store, anywhere! The hotel is beautiful - spotless common areas. They have tons of parking - we parked underground and left beach gear in the car, which was steps from the beach. The pools are fantastic - it's a perfect water park for kids. The 2nd pool has a swim up bar. We had lunch by the pool, which was delicious. Our room was huge and extremely well appointed. The ocean front patio was large and lad a table and 4 chairs. The linens on the bed were divine! Air conditioning worked perfectly. The kitchen has all full size appliances, soaps, dishes, coffee - really well appointed. The living area was large, and the bathroom was huge with a whirlpool tub and rain shower. Great amenities in the bathroom. The price is about $200/night too high in high season, but we split the room with another family. I travel a TON and I really loved this property.

Reviews.Title: “first time in ocean city”
Reviews.Author: dojsnowin
Reviews.Content: Lived in Maryland for 20 years, never visited Ocean City. had heard that everything was old, as far as lodging. but, this was a very nice, clean hotel. they hire alot of exchange students. but, they were extremely nice and fast. could not check in until 3:00pm and the room was not ready until 3:11PM. But check out was 11:00am and they were waiting at my door at 11:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Nice rooms and outdoor pool”
Reviews.Author: Painthome
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much - we are a family with young kids. The large outdoor pool was wonderful. It was large with a slide designed for older kids and one for toddler age children. The pool was deep enough to keep older kids happy and low enough on one side for toddler age as well. There also is a second outdoor pool for adults and much older kids as well as an indoor pool. There was enough parking at the hotel and the restaurant on site was good for quick meals for the kids so we weren't only living on fast food takeout. Our room was nice with a kitchen area, livinmg/TV room area, spa bathtub which my kids loved, and 2 queen beds in a separate bedroom. All of the rooms are oceanview with balconies with a table and chairs. The laundry room was not busy and they offered laundry supplies at the front desk. The staff there was very nice - my husband commented to the front desk about an issue with the screen door and 5 minutes later there was a knock on the door with a repair person to fix it. The hotel is oceanfront so it was just a short walk from the first floor of the hotel to the beach. Its location is away from the arcades and shops on the boardwalk area which worked out well for us having young kids. WE will definitely stay here again if we visit Ocean city. It was pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than Holiday Inn Suites”
Reviews.Author: zambony
Reviews.Content: After staying in a dirty room in Holiday Inn last year, we decided to try Hilton. The room size (of regular room) and swimming pools are similar and comparable. The differences are cleanliness and service. (I realized cleanliness issues at Holiday Inn were prevailing...) We stayed in a terrace room, which was fabulous. It has outside Jacuzzi and nice views, well worth spending extra 100 dollars. Then, we moved to a poolside room, which was convenient as our little one likes swimming pool much more than beach. You have to call hotel to get these kinds of specialty rooms . The con is their main restaurant. Service is good, but food is not. Ristorante Antipasti would be a nice alternative for those who do not want to drive. For breakfast, we went to The Pirate's Den locating in front of the hotel for three of our four breakfast. (And we ate left overs at the day of departure.)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Rev_Dennis
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before, and going back again in August. Very very nice. Large comfortable clean rooms and premises. They have 2 room suites that you have to ask for. Over the top. Balconies right on the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: mpierry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel last year and it was amazing. We stayed in a one of the suite rooms with 2 other couples and had a blast. Plenty of room and full kitchen to use. Great couples vacation!!! The pool bar was great and the pool service was awesome. Would def recommend this place to others and will def come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Top OC hotel for family of 4”
Reviews.Author: gfpoole
Reviews.Content: We have been to Ocean City, MD the last six summers for a weekend getaway. We have had several lodging experiences, but the Hilton is simply the best hotel on the beach in OC and highly recommend it. The suites are spacious with a nice kitchenette and jacuzzi tub/shower. The balcony allows you to enjoy a sandwich and the ocean view. There is ample, free parking for guest vehicles. The Hilton has a great pool for kids with two slides (one for 4 to adult and the other for the 1-3 year olds), whirpool and fountains. Then there is an adult pool for the swimmers and a swim up bar. Of course there also the great beach right in front...we suggest boogie boards! The Hilton has a convenient hose to clean off before heading back upstairs. There is a nice restaurant on site which also offers a filling breakfast buffet. We love the fresh fruit available 24 hours in the lobby. Close enough to the boardwalk without being on top of it and all the noise. We like the location at 32nd. So much is available north and south a short drive or walk away. We do enjoy taking strolls down the boardwalk after a dinner feast. There is so much to enjoy on the boardwalk, including arcades and rides and this year OC had a nice laser and lights show on Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, perfect.”
Reviews.Author: 4JETS
Reviews.Content: This is our third time here as a family and once again it did not disappoint. Staff was great and helpful, we actually let the kids decide where to go this summer and they chose this hotel. I think we will be back again next summer due to the constant good experiences we have here. Come prepared with food and your beach gear and you will never have to leave!

Reviews.Title: “First timer in OC...amazing time.”
Reviews.Author: kwondogg
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in OCMD and traveling with a family of 3 (myself, wife, 18 month old kid), I wanted to stay at a place where I won't be disappointed. I looked at the reviews and found the Hilton to have the best review of all OC hotels. It was a bit pricey, but decided to shell out to make sure we had a good time. The hotel itself is excellent. From bellman to the cleaning crew, the staff is extremely friendly. We had a first floor room by the adult pool side and it was so convenient to go to the pool/beach right out of our balcony. Initially I thought maybe the noise would be too much, but the doors and curtains do a great job of keeping a lot of the noise out. I loved the fact that there is a separate sleeping area (living room). We set up my kid's pack n play there and shut our bedroom door and it was perfect. We were able to watch TV and talk without having to worry about waking him up. The full kitchen is also amazing. Fully stocked and a full fridge. We brought our own breakfast and made them each morning. If you leave your dirty dishes in the sink, the cleaning crew will load them up in the dishwasher and run them for you. The towels are soft, bathroom is clean, the jacuzzi is awesome, and next to our own bed, probably one of the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in. My wife has a back condition (we have a special bed made for her at home) and normally she can't sleep in hotel beds very well, but she actually didn't complain the entire 5 days we spent there. The beach was clean and it was literally a minute walk. The kiddie pool was a HUGE hit with my son who loved every minute of it. I have to admit, the kiddie pool is excellent. All equipment is soft/padding so even if kids fall on it, they don't get hurt as much. It even had a lazy river! We ate out most of the nights but had couple of dinners (including room service) from Palm 32. Food was excellent and so was the service. Starbucks right in the lobby was a huge hit and their lunch place next to the adult pool serves great wraps with a friendly smile. We walked to the boardwalk and it wasn't bad. Probably about 10-15 min walk to the edge and another 10-15 to where the restaurants were. We took the shuttle back, but on a nice day, it's totally doable and not tiring at all. I could go on and on, but basically the price is on the high range side (~$500/night peak months) but if you have a family and looking for great service and amenities, this hotel is worth every penny. Our last day there it rained so we couldn't go to the pool but they had movie and art class for kids and we spent time there coloring and watching Finding Nemo on the big screen. Worth every penny. Will definitely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Third amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: 4kidstolove
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third stay in six years. I held my breath this time thinking for sure this time the hotel would be showing signs of wear and tear. Nope! Just as beautiful as the first time we stepped foot in it six years ago! All rooms are suites. All rooms have an ocean view. All rooms have a jacuzzi bathtub and rain shower head. All rooms have a deck. It truly is beach front. Sadly my kids at 11, 13, 14 and 15 have outgrown the super fun kids pool for the most part. However they have discovered how fun boogie boarding is! Adult (loosely...the do allow kids, just no lifeguard) pool has a swim up bar and live music. Makes it feel like a party every day! Having lunch served to you in your lounge chair. Sigh. Doesn't get much better! The place is spotless! Every time we go, I just can't get over that there is no sand anywhere in the hotel. It is ON the beach. People come in straight from the beach. Super clean I tell you. We love the location on 32nd street. We walk the few blocks to the tram, take it to the end and then shop and eat our way back to the hotel. The staff is amazing. It is obvious they love their jobs! Cody, Martin, Gerard...hoping you are all still there the next time we come! We usually go every other year, but we might not make it that long this time!

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in desperate need of a beach getaway after losing two of our beloved immediate family members in a two-week period. We were able to get great rates and stayed in an oceanfront suite. After reading the online reviews, I learned that the 8th or 9th floor was best to steer clear of the noise from the outdoor patios and decks (pools and pool bar.) We had an issue after arriving, but the hotel made good on it. Our room was lovely, the balcony was spectacular, and to top it off, God gave us a BRILLIANT harvest moon that was literally hanging over the ocean directly in front of our balcony. It was breathtaking! The only complaint is that the indoor pool and towels were so dirty that we could not use them. The room itself was gorgeous. The location of the hotel is perfection! There is a deli directly across Coastal Highway, so you can get supplies for sandwiches and to cook meals in your suite. Noise was not an issue until a family moved in above us and apparently had some very unruly children who were stomping and we could hear it through the floor. Otherwise, it had been perfectly quiet. ONLY COMPLAINT - POOL WAS FILTHY!

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place we will stay in Ocean City!”
Reviews.Author: smsinger98
Reviews.Content: This hotel never disappoints! This was our 4th time staying and probably our best room yet. We decided to pay a little more and try a corner suite. Totally worth it! The whirlpool was great, the views from any where in the suite were spectacular. Everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great views - Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1LetsGoBuffalo1
Reviews.Content: We came here during Spring Break, so it was off season, and we got awesome prices on the suites. The staff was very good at putting our three rooms together, and we were near the top floor (WHAT A VIEW!!!) A bit off the boardwalk, but a nice walk to get there. Did not take advantage of the pool since it was a tad chilly, and the other pool had not yet opened for the year. For the price we paid, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Amy L
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our second visit to the Hilton Suites, and we had another terrific time. The staff is friendly and more than accommodating, and clearly enjoy their work. The suites are spacious, and it's wonderful being able to cook in your room if you really just want to stay in and rest. The beach is gorgeous, and the pools are big and there are always plenty of places to sit, and plenty of clean towels. When we unpacked we realized we left behind a sweatshirt belonging to our teenage son. The hotel staff found it and sent it back Priority Mail at their expense, along with a hair accessory of mine I didn't even know I'd misplaced. The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars was the live music at the outside pool. It was okay, but we didn't want to listen to it every day.

Reviews.Title: “The best place in OC on the beach for families a little pricey in season but for a family who wants/needs some privacy well wort”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here EVERY year since it has opened twice we have gone twice in the summer As stated above best place on the beach for families best rooms I have seen ( as good as in Walt Disney Worlds best) The ONLY major downside of the hotel is the Wifi service it's TERIBBLE. I had my iPhone act as a hot spot for my wife's laptop, kids streaming audio, ipad( you get the drift. I would have been up a creek do to speak I called to complain and they said they would TRY and reset the router. Just one???? They need multiple for each floor my only major complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with some faults”
Reviews.Author: jobeeone_1972
Reviews.Content: Pros: The Hilton is definitely one of the nicest hotels in Ocean City and ALL rooms are Oceanfront. The rooms are big and the balcony is nice and private. The pool overlooks the ocean and there are a lot of lounge chairs if you can get one, I will comment on the cons of the hotel in a moment. The swim up bar is definitely a plus and the duo that played was good. The location is great. You aren't on the boardwalk, but yet only 2 blocks or so from it, where you can jump on the trolley for a couple of bucks. Cons: I had mentioned before that there are a lot of chairs by the pool, well be warned, people put towels on them very early. I watched people do it at 730am. They will "claim" all the chairs by the railing which over looks the ocean. I sat next to 4 chairs that had towels on them from 11am-3pm and the people who put them on the chairs NEVER even sat in them. I think there should be a stronger policy that no claiming of chairs for more than an hour is acceptable. Especially when the chairs haven't even been touched. Please enforce a rule that there should not be children by the swim up bar. I watched kids splash water in to peoples 9$ drinks. Luckily not mine. There's a great kiddie pool area with a waterslide. Seriously folks, the kids don't need to be by the bar. The other issue I had, was breakfast. It wasn't very good and pretty darn expensive. 14$ for eggs and bacon is ridiculous, especially when your beverage is served in a plastic cup. There are many other options for breakfast. Unless it's included, skip the Hilton's. Also, I ate by myself the one morning and I was the only person in the restaurant. A table of 8 (screaming kids included) were sat directly next to me. WHY? The whole place was empty. Luckily I was leaving at that point. Overall, this is a nice hotel. It's very clean and modern, but definitely not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “"Best place to stay in Ocean City"”
Reviews.Author: Simone H
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was absolutely beauitful; our room was ocean front with a beautiful view of the ocean, room was very clean, services were fantastic and the food was amazing. Pool area was great live music, movie night and plenty of activities for younger children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel--A Little Rough Around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: TazDevil30
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel multiple times. This was the first time we stayed with my twin toddlers so I have a new appreciation for the family friendliness of this hotel. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: * suites have full kitchens with a good amount of pots and pans and a full fridge * the suites have a sofa bed in the living room in addition to the bedroom. you can close the bedroom door for privacy from the kids. * the kids pool is amazing with slides, a lazy river etc * beachfront location--walk right onto the beach. There is always space on the beach since the hotel is not right in front of the boardwalk * adult pool has a swim up bar * kids under 5 eat for free at breakfast if you order an adult buffet (which is $20) * bed is very comfy * bathroom is spacious with a family size whirlpool tub * there is sporadic turn down service where they offer new towels and toiletries * the hotel is super clean, they are constantly mopping elevators for sandy wet feet * indoor pool is nice and a good option when the kids have been out in the sun too long Cons: * they sometimes forget to turn up for turn down service * towel service at the pool--they run out and don't replenish fast enough * the hotel is 5 long blocks (7-10 min walk) from the boardwalk. To go the length of the boardwalk from the hotel, you are walking almost 2.5 miles (guess it's a good way to get some exercise). * parking is limited and you may end up at the off lot across the street Overall this is a great family hotel. It's pricey in high season but the rooms are spacious and it's a great place for kids. They do need more housekeeping staff as our room was cleaned very late in the day despite requests to do it earlier and we didnt' get turn down service every night even when we requested it.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Time in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: BigMacII
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 3 young) boys stayed for 5 days over the July 4th Holiday. Based on review and appearance, the Hilton is the best hotel in the Ocean City area (4 diamonds AAA). The suites contained a jacuzzi tub, ocean front balcony, 3 pools, and direct access to the beach. It is 4 blocks beyond the boardwalk. You are provided with one parking spot and HH gold members are provided with free continental beakfast. The room has a living room with pull out sofa, balcony, full kitchen and jacuzzi tub. Also, there are two 40 in flat screen TVs with DVD players. The service was very good with the exception of one day where the room was not serviced adequately. I was also not offered an upgrade and the room requestedwas not offered or the room request in the reservation acknowledged. I would recommend staying as the quality was there and the distance from NY, DC, and Baltimore is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Ocean City...”
Reviews.Author: Azgators
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is by far the nicest hotel in ocean city, your other choices really aren't anything to even select from. Its maybe two star places then this nice 4 star hotel. There is a new Hampton being built but its not on the ocean and beach side. The Hilton is shockingly expensive, We've stayed in Ritz Carltons, Intercontinentals, Westins across the world and have only once paid more for a room....ugh. That aside its a really nice place with ample service. The Rooms: Are HUGE! You walk into a living room with a pull out couch and a table and chairs. Past that is a galley kitchen with almost full size appliances and fully stocked with everything you need. Next to that is a very large bathroom with dual sinks and a deep large soaking jetted tub with rain shower. (watch your step in and out of the tub, its tall) Next is the bedroom, we had a king bed that made the room feel very large. Bed was soft yet comfortable. Other travelers pics on here are true to what our room looked like. Room was well kept, it should be, the hotel is not that old. The bummer is that you can't leave the door open to the balcony and have any part of the air unit working, not even the fan on to move air around. We like to sleep at night with the sound of the ocean waves and have the benefit of some cool air over us, oh well. The towels and robes are SUPER soft, very much enjoyed having them. Amenities: There are three pools. Wow. An adult pool, although officially I don't think they kick kids out. It has a swim up bar and another bar in the area. We had a different band playing daily in that area which is ok, not great since they weren't very good, but the idea is nice. The other option is a kids play area with slides and tons of fun things for them. Thirdly there was an indoor pool which was warm and chlorine smelly as usual. The pool towels are a shame. I suppose most people bring their own beach towels since most people visiting drive in from a few hours drive. We came with carry-ons only for a week stay from Phoenix, so, they sucked. Location: On the beach with ample parking for people staying, either covered or uncovered. Nice beach out front. The boardwalk is probably a half mile to the south, so if that is important to you look elsewhere. Easy to find the hotel anytime since all you have to do is look up, its the tallest hotel around. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, and the same cheesy stores every tenth of a mile so no reason to drive everywhere. Hints: -Ask for a high room on the side of the adult pool. It gets really noisy on the kid pool side very early in the morning (we found out the hard way). -The coke machines on each floor are a deal, $1 for a 20oz, not bad and convenient. We didn't have any security issues, or problems with staff, we didn't really care when they came to make up our room since we were not in it very much. Maids do have to clean the rooms where people are checking out first you know, so that when you arrive early at 1 and expect that your room is ready hours earlier then the posted check in time, it actually is ready. Sorry to hear others had troubles. This was my first trip to Ocean City, not really my style, more of a east coasters paradise I guess. I prefer Hawaii, cheaper hotels, cheaper flights, and oh yeah, its Hawaii. But a friends wedding beckoned, so the Hilton was our salvation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean City Property”
Reviews.Author: Aardvark1223
Reviews.Content: We had only one night to stay in Ocean City and chose this property. Although it was fairly expensive comparatively, it was worth every dollar. The room was spacious, clean, quite and comfortable. The property itself is clean and stylish and the location on the beach and near the boardwalk can't be beat. And the bathroom is simply fantastic. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Security”
Reviews.Author: 2187fmlr
Reviews.Content: Beware! Exterior doors require no door/guest cards in order for them to open. The main desk is located on the 2nd floor and anyone can easily make their way to the upper floors simply by entering the 1st floor elevators....

Reviews.Title: “Superb View and Clean”
Reviews.Author: ND4health
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a delight. Everyone that works there has a smile and is neatly dressed. The rooms have a full kitchen which makes family travel easy. We are gluten free and have to bring our own food on vacation. This made it easy, plus we had oceanfront dining every meal courtesy of our own balcony. You don't have to worry about prying eyes as the balcony is completely private from the neighbors. I will recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely he back.

Reviews.Title: “Our recent two day stay”
Reviews.Author: Opusone1
Reviews.Content: During our recent two day stay we concluded that this hotel is average for several reasons. Especially for the price we paid. We paid $499.00 per night. First, housekeeping does not freshen the room until after 3:00 p.m.. Even if the front desk says that they do the rooms anytime between 9:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m., our experience was after 3:00 p.m. only after we asked that the room be freshened. Second, we struggled with our entry door and its key. We could not get the door to unlock after we had the keys replaced. We showed our problem to a maintenance person on happened to be on our floor and he agreed that the internal battery needed to be replaced. He stated to us that he would arrange to have someone look at it. We decided to inform the front desk as well as a backup request. Well as you can imagine, it was never fixed. We would stand outside of our room for several minutes before we could get the door to open. Third, some may think the rain shower in the oversized bathtub is wonderful. Well they will change their mind once they use it. The majority of the nozzles are clogged so water barely comes out. My wife and i struggled rinse our hair or body after soaping up. While we are shower issue, the tub is too high to step into. For my wife who is 5'4", she struggled to step into the tub. In my opinion, one should be very careful to not slip. Other then the three items above, our experience was just okay. Lisa at the front desk is not the sharpest tool in the shed. She seemed to struggle with everything we asked her to do for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great balcony view”
Reviews.Author: MaurmcNewyork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at this great resort. We had a suite on the 12th floor, total privacy on the spacious balcony, Lots of space in the rooms. The pool did get crowded in the afternoon and there were plenty of chair hogs who put towels on the chairs at 8am and did not come to the pool until 1 pm. The jacuzzi tub and the shower are all one unit and we found the tub very slippery, that is our only real complaint. Continental breakfast was fine, Front desk staff very helpful, I asked where the pool towels were Early our first morning and the front staff person brought towels out to us at at the pool. gym open 24 hours, pool food/ drink service great

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but some of the staff can be friendlier”
Reviews.Author: Jessie46835
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and had a good location. But no continental breakfast and restaurant on location very pricey! Concierge nowhere to be found whenever I needed to ask a question. I also found hotel had a strange setup with very small outdoor pool. For the price, I expected better! And...Front desk not so friendly! When we got there,there were so many people on waiting list to check in, even though it was 2:30PM. We had to wait until the standard 3PM check in and got a room, but so many others had to wait longer like it was a normal thing! I was not too impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a 10”
Reviews.Author: Barnegat_Travelor
Reviews.Content: This hotel almost earned a 10. If they offered my under 16 child free breakfast and also offered free bottled water I would have given them a perfect score. As a diamond member those are perks I have come to love. My wife and I sent the week there for the Fireman's convention. The staff was great the beach and pool also very nice. The rooms are much larger then a normal Hilton. That is why we selected it. However not having free .25 cent bottled water kind of disappointed me. My daughter does not eat much in the AM so she just asked us to bring her up a bagel. I offered to purchase her breakfast put she wanted to sleep in. Smart kid.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandi W
Reviews.Content: I live in Virginia and have spent many a days in Ocean City and this is BY FAR the best time I have had!! I would more than highly recommend staying at the Hilton! The staff is GREAT and the swim up pool bar is great with great bartenders! The only draw back would be the price, they are expensive, but you get more than you expect, even for the price. I don't know that I could afford to stay there again, but I sure will try!! You actually feel like you are at a resort and not just Ocean City. And lets not forget the food, whether its at the restuarant or the poolside/room service; its awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Change”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel06
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. Our room had a huge bathroom which included a jacuzzi tub. The best part of the experience was sitting on the balcony listening to the waves splashing on the seashore. I was pleased with the attractiveness and the cleanliness of our accomodations. We were checked in quickly and graciously by the staff. No waiting! The buffet breakfast in the restaurant was very good. I particularly enjoyed the fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Suze412
Reviews.Content: Although a bit pricey, having a suite with a kitchen makes up for it. The views are amazing, and the kids pool is great too. It is not on the boardwalk, which for us was a plus. Check in was easy, and the person helping us was very nice. Only complaint was that the two girls that I spoke with on the guest services line were rude and their tone of voice suggested that they were doing me some great favor by allowing us to check out an hour late (the leaking pipes kept me up, which I pointed out.). It was a weekday and there was an issue with the room, so this should not have been a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed: awesome location/features but resting on its laurels”
Reviews.Author: plpesquire
Reviews.Content: June 2012 was our 4th stay at this hotel (past visits October 2009 or 2010, June 2011, and September 2011). No doubt the location is fantastic - beach and pool options (indoor & 2 outdoor). The rooms have great amenities. Full kitchen with fridge, 4-burner stove/oven, microwave, dishwasher, and dishes/utensils - but bring your own kitchen knife and cutting board because these are lacking or not useful. (Given the reviews of the hotel food, we bring breakfast and lunch, eat in the room or at the pool/on the beach, and save our bucks for dinner since dining options are dodgy anyway - Liquid Assets is a rare treasure). Bathroom is spacious (though the deep whirlpool tubs are a challenge - you could throw your back out bathing a child and getting in and out is best done gingerly and soberly). There's an exercise room and business center (probably underused). That said, I noticed increasing signs of neglect - hall floors not vacuumed for days; black oily hand (not just finger) print on bathroom door; no robes in the rooms anymore (this was a perk that I really enjoyed - now, you have to call down to the front desk and housekeeping will bring one for you...not sure how long that will last); and, inconsistent housekeeping (missing soap one day; missing dishwasher detergent the next - and front desk said housekeeping would drop some off which didn't happen - and so on, all despite the tip $ I left since I get that housekeeping is a thankless task). Perhaps petty, but given the cost, excellence should be expected. Some parting tips: Rooms ending in 1 to 10 are on the kids' pool side of the hotel, which can be loud. My husband could hear a wee screamer with the slider closed on the 6th floor (which met with some disbelief from the front desk) - ask for a higher room or stay on the opposite side of the hotel. As the sun goes behind the hotel, the pools are completely shaded by about 3:30 and the beach by about 5:00 or 5:30, which can be good or bad - just be prepared. King beds are few - book early or call to see if any are available; the queen beds were so soft that I would roll toward my husband or he feared rolling off. Yes, I'll return because I love the location and convenience of all the amenities, but I'll keep staying during the shoulder/off seasons to get a better bang for the buck and may stay less often. (FYI, our September 2011 stay was in a king corner suite - so decadent; this September planning to stay in a terrace suite with hot tub - can't wait...unless I decide to put the budget toward a trip to Vegas instead - unfortunately this stay left me wondering.)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: hrmomx2
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Hilton after a three night stay with our two children. We've stayed here at least three or four times since they opened. The suites are well sized and we really love the large ocean front balcony. We also appreciated the topper that they put over the mattress on the sofabed. It made it much more comfortable for my kids to sleep on. The two oceanfront pools are great. They also have a large indoor pool and a nice game room. We split our time between the pools and the beach. Honestly, you don't need to leave the hotel for much. We had lunch poolside and then walked down to the boardwalk one night. It's an easy walk to the end of the boardwalk (less than 10 minutes) and then you can catch the tram if you don't want to continue walking. Alll of the staff were very friendly and attentive. I called several times for extra pillows and towels and they brought them right up. I also called to have someone come fix the squeaky door to the bedroom and again the maintenance staff came up within 10 minutes to take care of it. I noticed that someone in an earlier review mentioned slow housekeeping staff and having to wait until late in the day to have their room cleaned. I prefer an early cleaning so I can use the room later in the day, therefore each morning I simply called the front desk and requested a morning cleaning. The staff was very accomodating and my room was cleaned by noon. Quite honestly, that is the type of service one would expect when paying top dollar for a hotel room and I feel that I got it at the HIlton. There were just a few negatives that I think the management is probably aware of at this point, but I want to mention them. As nice at the property is, the hotel rooms are getting to the point that they need some refurbishment. Some of the furniture in the room was dinged up quite a bit from several years of use and the beds were much too soft. I think it's time that the mattresses be replaced because they are past their prime. The table on the balcony also had a broken table top. I also agree with other reviewers that the shower/tub is difficult to get in and out of because the sides are so high. I could do without the tub (which I never use in hotels) and go with a nice shower. I think that most people who stay here know that it is a pricey property and are willing to pay the price if the amenities and condition of the property are there to support it. The Hilton remains our top choice (and that of many of our friends) in Ocean City. Hopefully, Hilton will continue to maintain and upgrade the property as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City's Best but...”
Reviews.Author: GhLez
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from May 31. It was Ravens Beach Week and I was a little apprehensive thinking it would be noisy but it was great. The hotel is a couple miles or so away from the Boardwalk and right on the beach. The pools and lazy river were amazing. Service and food by the pool was fab - the drinks were not as good. We were on the 12th floor and the views were magnificent. The room was spacious and the separate living area was a bonus. The room was clean but you could tell it needed some TLC. The bathroom was also quite clean but my goodness was the tub ever so deep! Not do great for kids or the height-challenged. And I wasn't impressed with the shower head- you could only shower by standing directly beneath it. I didn't give it 5 stars because housekeeping just ruined it. She was the slowest cleaner on record so far. Rooms were not cleaned even at 3pm in the afternoon. She didnt replenish supplies and even though I asked constantly that the sheets be changed she never did. The room was clean though when she got through with it. Overall good stay. Front desk staff friendly. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “FRONT DESK rudeness/ ROOM NOT AVAILABLE, BILLING ERRORS”
Reviews.Author: paula c
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at HILTON Suites Ocean City in May 2012. I saw the ratings and based on rave reviews seen for Hilton Suite. This was my first stay here and my last. At check in my room was not available. Not when you paid first night rate already. I was told to wait until after 3:00 PM. Finally i got in after i went to another Front desk clerk. Then comes the billing problems. I received a phone call and an email again for billing errors . I talked with Vikki Johnson by email and Mr. Tony Miller, Director of Revenue Management by phone. Mr. Miller not only displayed same arrogance and rudeness, but demanded the billing issue be reconciled without proper customer courtesy. I had told Vikki i should be compensated for this type of treatment and instead it was made worse. The best part of stay was the bellmen and maid service. They were top notch and friendly. Never again!!! HILTON SUITES OC. I will stay elsewhere. 4 STAR service was NOT displayed. Thanks for making my high rating of HILTON SUITES Ocean City fall. No one should be treated in this business in this manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Marc F
Reviews.Content: Our stay was not perfect, but it was great. The hotel rooms are clean and comfortable. The suites are perfect for families with babies. The crib was in the room waiting for us when we checked in late, but room service closes at 11 - so don't arrive hungry at night. The restaurant in the hotel is ok - nothing great. And I don't recommend the breakfast buffet. The rooms have a refrigerator and stove so you're better off making a shopping run to the Food Lion nearby and taking care of breakfast (and perhaps other meals) on your own. Despite that, I still love this hotel and we'd return again. The location is great - just a few blocks from the boardwalk. Singles and couples without kids may prefer to stay on the boardwalk, but we found the walk there pleasant and quick - about 10 minutes max. We loved this hotel mostly for the convenience of bringing our 16 month old boy, who immediately made friends in the kiddy pool - he didn't want to leave. We'll go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay overall, a couple of complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ravenboy
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this property and first in the summer "high" season. Thankfully I stayed here on a points stay and didn't pay the $350+ per night current rate. The suites are really nice.. Separate living room, bed room and a sizeable bathroom with jacuzzi type tub and shower and dual sink.. Plenty of room when you have two who need a lot of mirror time in the bathroom. The kitchen is a great perk. Full sized fridge, full size oven with 4 burners, microwave, appliances and pots/pans, etc.. I do have a couple minor complaints about this particular stay though. First off, the cleaning service is terribly slow. When I take the family on a beach type vacation in the summer, we like to hang at the pool and beach all day, then come in between 4 PM and 5 PM to shower up and figure out where we are heading for dinner. Both nights this weekend we went up between 4 and 5 and the room still wasnt clean. I had to walk down and interrupt the cleaning service and ask her for fresh towels. I find this unnaceptable for a major hotel chain in a prime location like this. How hard is it to get rooms clean and towels refreshed by early afternoon? Secondly, the WiFi is non-existant in a lot of areas, especially the bedroom. I gave up on trying to check my email about halfway through this stay due to the lousy WiFi reception. I know it's free, but I guess you get what you pay for in some cases. Finally, the parking here is a mess. This weekend was the Ocean City airshow, so of course people go out of there way to park as close to the beach as possible. the Hilton has free parking and doesn't do much in the way of policing their garage and main parking lot. I heard someone at the desk complaining and the staff said to her, "there's nothing we can do, you have to find a spot on the street somewhere." That's just unacceptable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice Room Floorplan”
Reviews.Author: Dee B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at HS in Ocean City or a one night mid week get away. It is an awesome location. The rooms are spacious and great for families that do not have or do not care to utilize a beach house. A full kitchen with stove, fidge and dishwasher makes it a nice extended stay location. Starting to show some wear in the common areas and is definitely a resort town sort of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Norris T
Reviews.Content: Although a review date of 11/11 is shown, we stay here two to three times in the off season every year. In the Fall, Winter and Spring, this is a gem of a place to go without the mob scenes on Coastal Highway in the Summer. The suite rates are very attractive, and the suites themselves are fully--and I do meanfully--equipped. Full size appliances, gas range, fridge, dishwasher and plentiful cookware and dishware, including wine glasses. The property has a terrific heated pool, workout room and all suites have direct oceanfront views. The corner suites are glassed in on three sides and you can view the ocean, bay, and downtown OC. The jacuzzis in the interior suites are in the bathroom, but in the corner suites are in the bedroom. The restaurant, 32 Palm, serves an excellent breakfast and there is a Starbuck's in the lobby for other breakfast items. There's no lunch service, but dinner is very well done and quite to Hilton standards. Room service is available and that's nice to have sometimes. Rooms are always clean and well taken care of. The towels are fluffy and soft and there are terry robes in the closet. The hotel personnel to a person are courteous, helpful, and very committed to the guests' stay. We've spent many nights here over the years and found it delightful. In season room rates are pricey, but off season rates are very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family resort”
Reviews.Author: jessmscibetta
Reviews.Content: We just went with our 1 year old and 3 year old and we could not have had a better time. The kid pool was great for them. Also had a live cover band and a pool side bar for us! Everything about this hotel was great, we liked it even better that is was not on the boardwalk since we have small children. The boardwalk was only a four block walk which wasnt a big deal. It felt like a vacation not just a day at the boardwalk in NJ. Room service was great and staff was polite. Even the other guests were in a good mood we felt because of the hotel atmosphere or from the hotel having a Starbucks in the lobby. Get a corner room it's worth the money and the peace and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: Terry S
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is absolutely the best place to stay in OC. Oceanfront suites, balcony, kitchen with full size oven and fridge, comfortable beds (a must for me), jacuzzi in room,maid service every day. They go out of their way to be helpful and make sure your trip is top notch. One downside, the jacuzzi tub is nice but if you have issues climbing in and out, it's hard to use even for a shower. We asked for a bath mat for inside the tub and that helped a lot. Our room wasn't ready when we got there at 4:30 but it took only a couple of minutes to get it. As Hilton Honors members, we checked out an hour later, too. We even got to see dolphins this time from our balcony. Another great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, nice rooms, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ifleye
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms on Hilton.com about a month out, and were able to get a decent government rate. When we checked in, we wanted to use our HH points for the last night & the helpful girl @ the desk said they just released more rooms for use with points & to call HH to book. Ended up being a bit of a hassle, but Debbie @ the front desk was SUPER friendly & helpful & made it happen. Room was good size, and enjoyed a nice view of the ocean from the 4th floor. Every balcony has a table with 4 chairs which is nice. It was also nice having a door dividing the bedroom from the kitchen, bathroom, and livingroom---kiddos could easily sleep while we could watch TV in the other room. Wifi works pretty well in the room, however the signal was not so good out in the pool area. My only complaint about the room is that someone on a nearby floor was smoking & you could smell it through the air coming out of the air conditioner---no clue on where it was coming from. We also liked keeping the sliding glass door open to hear the waves, that is until someone from a neighboring balcony started smoking & forced us to close the door. The way the balconys are set up, its impossible to find out who is smoking. So annoying. I called the front desk to ask if the smoking floor was on 3, but she said it was on the 6th floor & quickly offered to have housekeeping bring up some febreeze. I think they here that complaint often. Pools were all nice. Indoor pool was always pretty empty, even one afternoon when it was raining. On the weekends, the pool waitresses do a good job of taking drink orders. Oh, they also have live music everyday @ the adults pool. The girl/guy that sings on Saturdays this summer are NOT good. Well, the guy is alright, but the girl needs to find another way to make money on the weekend. In fact, I think she was actually making people want to leave the pool area. We also enjoyed the location of the hotel. Close enough to the boardwalk, but far enough away to be quiet. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone with young ones that want a quiter hotel that others in OC.

Reviews.Title: “On top of the town”
Reviews.Author: RevDrRobert
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Excellent room that had a fantastic view. Great rate mid-week. Only complaint was noisy kids in room above but they went to bed about 10pm. Plan to come here whenever possible!

Reviews.Title: “Best in OC!”
Reviews.Author: Philonous_XXI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Suites Ocean City for 3 days and nights and absolutely loved it. Our ocean front suite was very specious, with a jacuzzi in the bedroom and a great view of the ocean. This hotel must be one of the finest in Ocean City, MD. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “no maid service.....shower is a joke”
Reviews.Author: pete s
Reviews.Content: The shower heads are like washing with a squirt gun.....we could not get maid service for three days.......the cart for the maid would sit in the hallway but no maid service....ever....food stinks....prices high too high for the lack of service.........it says free wifi.........only it never works...they omit that part.........we will not be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice,very quiet,best pools in O.C.”
Reviews.Author: OCFanMaryland
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel,despite it being our number 2 place in O.C. This hotel offers a quiet,more "vacation" feel,definitely more laid back. It is on the quiet end of the city and this offers a completely different experience. They do have LodgeNet which comes in handy for rainy,lazy days. If I were planning a trip during a period of possible bad weather,this would be my first choice as there is enough to do inside for a day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: joy1
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here recently with 2 children ages 2 and 4. Upon arriving, we were greeted warmly by the bellman who was very helpful in orienting us to the hotel and assistance with our luggage. (I would have to say that the bell staff are excellent, overall.) Front desk staff, however, are a different story. No warm greeting, no acknowledgement of Hilton Honors status, no "enjoy your stay." I thought I had arrived at the wrong hotel. All rooms are oceanfront which is a big plus, and are comfortable and extremely clean. The furniture and carpet are worn from lots of use, I am sure. Again, rooms are comfortably furnished with nice bedding but not worthy of a 4-star rating. This is typical beach-front hotel property. We were fortunate that the weather cooperated and the children's pool was open. It was quite nice with two lifeguards, water features and well-behaved children. The beach is beautiful and well-groomed. The greatest feature of the hotel is the oceanfront location and the ability to take the children to the beach and back to the room easily when naps are needed (both for the adults and children). Housekeeping service was probably the biggest disappointment of our stay. Minimal cleaning was provided-i.e. no wet mopping of dirty kitchen or bathroom floors, no changing of dirty linens (even though a note was left to make sure to change the linens, they just ignored it and re-made the bed). On the second day, we had to call three times to request that housekeeping staff clean our room over a 1/2 day period. When she arrived with a surly attitude, I mentioned the need to change the dirty linens and mop the dirty floor (and provided a tip). Unfortunately, when we returned later in the day, the dirty linens were not changed and she just re-made the bed, but floor was mopped. I decided not to pursue further given the negative impact it was having on our visit and the uncaring attitude of front desk/guest services personnel. Overall, we had never been to Ocean City before and it was a pleasant surprise in terms of its family-oriented atmosphere and cleanliness. We chose this hotel because of its ratings on Tripadvisor and AAA. It is probably one of the better hotels in the area but is lacking in front desk customer service and professionalism as a Hilton brand, in addition to minimal housekeeping services. Since we stayed here during mid-week and off-season, we secured a reasonable rate. However, I don't think I would pay the asking price for in-season rates. This hotel is just an "o.k." beachfront property, very clean, but nothing special and certainly not even close to luxurious or upscale.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: vandpstewart
Reviews.Content: We took our 2 grandchildren here (3 and 6) and had a really terrific time. Ocean view, kitchen, sofa bed for the kids...I just can't express how much fun we had. You are only 4 blocks from the 28th street where you can hit the boardwalk for a great run. You can walk right out to the beach. Pool was on the shallow side which was great for the kids. Great location. We will definitely return when we go back to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Made a freezing winter beach trip fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda M
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted to get away on a beach trip to Ocean City - even though it was January and bitterly cold. Arriving, we found almost the whole place deserted and eerily empty (which is to be expected). After a rather humorous adventure trying a few other hotels in the area that were a bit dark and gave us the feeling we were in a ghost town, we walked into the Hilton and were greeted by a golden staircase, light pouring in from the huge windows overlooking the ocean, and a friendly warm staff. We enjoyed the room with a beautiful view of the ocean. We even saw whales from the deck! What made our stay most memorable was the huge two person whirlpool tub. Although the jets didn't work for some reason, we decided not to change rooms and still enjoyed a hot soak which was very relaxing. I'm sure this hotel is great in the summer, but too expensive for our budget. A winter time trip allowed us to enjoy the room at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Classygyrl08
Reviews.Content: Only one complaint...we requested a room with a King Size bed, but ended up getting two queens instead. Other than that...the hotel was amazing....we had a gorgeous ocean view, and the room was fantastic. The plush robes, ultra comfortable bed & pillows made my stay super enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the nicest Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Goin2dabeach
