Reviews.Content: We have stayed here quite a few times and it has always been nice. We typically go during the off season because it's much less expensive and less crowded. We have always been pleased with the accommodations. The rooms are large and have a full kitchen. This stay the maid service somehow missed us but there were plenty of towels and we picked up coffee from the front desk so it wasn't such a big deal as we were only there for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: justme028
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February. The weather was nice so we were able to go on the balcony and open the doors. Friendly staff. Dining was ok, certainly not one of Hilton's finest. Rooms and hotel very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Ocean City does not miss a beat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hazel1956
Reviews.Content: Had the pure pleasure of spending a few nights at the Hilton Suites, Ocean City, MD. This hotel is one of the nicest Hiltons we have ever stayed in. Stayed in king suite/ov on the 8th floor. The weather was unseasonally warm, so we were able to leave sliding door open (screen closed) to hear the ocean at night. Watched sunrise from our balcony in the morning. Everything was so clean and fresh smelling. The bed, linens, numerous pillows on the bed and the bathrobes were wonderful. The jacuzzi was a nice surprise as was the rainfall showerhead. The kitchen area had everything you would need to prepare meals. LR/DR had sleep sofa/table chairs and flat screen tv. The staff were very nice. Indoor/outdoor pool were beautiful and the ocean is a step away. Oh btw Starbucks in the lobby was the best. Frap and the beach...what more could you ask for? This location is worth every penny and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: AbbysMom417
Reviews.Content: We found this gem the year it opened, in fact we were the first ones to stay in our room. Loved it ever since. We've stayed in the corner suites and also the terrace suite. We like both. We prefer the shower in corner suite, a walk-in, versus the tub-style in the terrace suite, but the small porch you get on the terrace suite is great. The terrace suite has a hot tub outside on the porch, where the corner suite has a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. This is a great place for families to stay. Separate bedroom, dining/living room with fold out sofa & tv, and a small kitchen with full-size fridge. The cleaning staff does a great job, considering all the sand people bring back with them. Our room is always clean. Nearby is a couple of mini-golf places, a good seafood place, a Mickey-D's, and a small amusement-style park for the younger kids. The boardwalk isn't that far away, either. What we like the most is that this place is for families. There's a pool for the kids, a pool for mom & dad, and the beach right there. Not to mention the Starbucks in the lobby. Staff has always been nothing but nice to us. It is on the pricey side, but everyone should treat themselves once in awhile. You won't be disappointed here, I know we haven't been. In fact, we have our reservations for this year made.

Reviews.Title: “Minitrip to Hilton Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: Spendo
Reviews.Content: Just love this hotel, ocean front in Ocean City, MD - Rooms are suites with beautiful views of the beach and ocean. Rooms have living room with dining table, full kitchen, bedroom with balcony, bathroom is wonderful (spa tub). Indoor pool for use when outside pools are not open. Two eateries right on sight. The staff is very friendly and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Shopping0704
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a place full of mostly small motels. The staff was welcoming, the prices good, and the rooms very nice. They were by far the cleanest I have seen in a long time, and we stay at very upscale places usually. The weather was horrible, but we still could open the door to the balcony and hear the ocean, if not see it due to fog. And the beds are so very comfy! The pool is beautiful, the business center is up to date, and they even have free laundry. I was very impressed with this place, everything was pretty and the people were so nice. We had breakfast at 32 palm and it was very good too. Little pricey for breakfast, but worth it. Will definitely be back. Oh, one mention, we had no idea but this isn't by the boardwalk. We had to drive down a bit to get there and then walk it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheEasternShoreBoop
Reviews.Content: This place is first class. The customer service is top notch. The view is just wonderful even from the 3rd floor. We requested the lowest floor because of having family members with disablities. The bathroom is very large. It has a full kitchen. You walk into the livingroom first then thru the kitchen / Bathroom that leads into the bedroom area. The balcony is very large with a table and four chairs. I think the room is very expensive, but sometimes you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: joeybagz312
Reviews.Content: Went back to the Hilton Suites and we love it here in the off season. It is a bit too pricey in season for us. We went st. Patrick's day weekend. Weather was foggy and weird, but didn't stop us from having fun. This is the first time in all the times we've stayed that we tried the restaurant 32 palm - my salad was great and kids liked the chicken tenders, fries and pizza. Bar service is very convenient. Fruit in lobby is great. Small arcade, but fun. Fitness center is nice. Indoor pool is wonderful. Ocean and beach access, great! The room is always so nice. We love the beds and sheets. If I were to be nit picky, I would say there is a humming in the walls sometimes when the neighbors run water I suppose. We also rented a movie and it started and was a different movie! We called down to ask them to take it off our bill, they said they would, but then the next morning, it was not off of our bill. The bellmen are very nice, top notch. Female bartender was awesome, male bartender had an attitude it seemed. Overall, we will stay here time and time again because we love the location and the nicely appointed rooms. It's a special place for us with lots of fun memories. We also enjoyed the "hangover special" option = for $50 you could stay til 6 on sunday, or $99 for the night. We couldn't use it as we had to get home, but another weekend we would have really enjoyed this deal.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Lovely, Spacious, Spotless”
Reviews.Author: CherylH930
Reviews.Content: My friend was in desperate need of a low-key get-away at the beach, so I went straight to Tripadvisor to give her a hand. This hotel was rated # 1, and had great rates off-season, so with her permission, I booked 5 nights for her in the cheapest rooms, the poolside suites. You always wonder if a place will actually be as described, but it was better! (And I am looking for cleanliness probably most of all, along with an overall "feel" of the place, a warmth and welcome from the get-go.) From the smiling, attentive staff at the front desk, who happily whisked out a toothbrush and toothpaste when asked, to the tiny touches here and there--fine tea in the room, private balcony with the ocean waves lapping down below, towels galore, silky shampoo and sweet soap, dreamy beds (for a short'ish person), shower head mounted in the ceiling--(a giant could take a shower in there without bending over)--it was simplicity and luxury without pomp or pretension. Since I had driven my friend and we had arrived late, I stayed over for the night, returning home early the next morning. I left feeling refreshed, rested, and like I had had a real vacation myself. It really was lovely in every way. Oh, and by the way, don't miss the fact that every single room is smoke-free, a real plus in my book all the way!

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: a36redbaron
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hilton properties all over the world and this is one of the best we have stayed at. We upgraded a little for a corner, ocean-front suite and had absolutely wonderful accomodations, including a great view of Ocean City's magnificent beach. The suite had a great sitting area and the mini-kitchen was well equipped with everything you would need for a longer stay. There was even a jacuzi for relaxing after a day of driving. The bed was a king and very comfortable. Normally, I am not a fan of the check-in staff but they could not have been nicer. In fact, every staff member we encountered was absolutely fantastic and it shows in how well maintained this property is. Perfect from top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Courthalecki6
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, very organized. Super comfy beds. Love the balcony too !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great off season beach getaway”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Murrays
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 3rd wedding anniversary somewhere near the beach so we picked Ocean City,MD. This hotel was very clean and quiet a plus during the off season. All the suites face the ocean which is superb. The service was on target and the room service from the hotel's restaurant was very tasty. The only thing that I thought was a little strange is that the shower was inside the whirlpool tub which means you have to step in pretty high to get in. But that wasn't a spoiler for our stay there. The king size bed was soooo comfortable and to wake up to see the ocean waves was very serene. Also there is a starbucks kiosk in the lobby which was very convenient. I recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a reasonably priced off season getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: SLeder
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend at this hotel for President's Day Weekend. What a great weekend we had! You can't beat the off-season rates - that's for sure. The employees of the hotel were extremely nice and very helpful. My husband forgot his toiletries case at home, and the gentleman at the front desk gave him several complementary items to get him through the first night. The suite was very comfortable, and more importantly, very clean. I was impressed with the quality of the kitchen supplies and would not have hesitated to use them had our stay been longer. My daughter really enjoyed the jetted tub. Even though it is February, It was so nice to wake up to the sight of the beautfil ocean. When we booked the room, we requested extra towels and pillows. They were there upon our arrival. The pool area looked very nice, although we didn't swim because it was filled with younger children at the time. And, we didn't eat at the hotel restaurant because at first glance the prices for breakfast seemed expensive -- that is until we went to a local restaurant and spent $58 for breakfast. In hindsight, it would have been more economical to eat at the hotel and the atmosphere would have been 100 times better than were we ate. But, the restaurant looked very nice. I agree with another person who posted that this is the best hotel in Ocean City, We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “great getaway off season!”
Reviews.Author: StacyScottyAlan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the President's Day weekend. They have an indoor pool which is open. The hot tubs are outside, and are not available in the winter. There is a large balcony. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The restaurant in the hotel has good food. The rooms are very nice! The rates are still kind of high, but it is a very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Winter Getaway Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Joe60811
Reviews.Content: Great suite for great price. Wonderful Ocean view. All hotel folks very friendly and accomodating. and when you luck out with great weather it's even better.

Reviews.Title: “Best oc hotel”
Reviews.Author: justus3621
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in ocean city md. We go here in the off season for my daughter loves the indoor pool. Even though we own a place in west oc we are going to come here in the summer too because it has such grand amenities. Great family place.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay in the Off-Season”
Reviews.Author: ValriB
Reviews.Content: Ocean City MD in the off-season is definitely different (& cheaper). We chose the Hilton Suites, due to its location, as well as the fact that I could earn extra Hilton Points. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon, & the bellhop and front desk (located a floor above ground level) were very friendly and efficient. I had requested (& received) a King Bed on a high floor away from the elevator. The room was a good size, with a kitchen area, living room/dining area, & the bedroom, which overlooked the ocean. There was a decent size balcony (which we didn't use due to the time of year (January). The room was clean, well appointed, & had the extra linens which were requested. The bathroom was a good size, with a jetted tub, double sink, & had a good selection of toiletries. We explored the hotel, which has a game area for kids, & a nice pool and hot tub. The bed & bedding were very comfortable. When we woke in the morning, the room felt rather cool - it turned out the heat wasn't working properly. We reported it to the front desk, & it was fixed after our return in the afternoon. There are many restaurants & attractions within walking distance; however, most of these were closed because of the time of year. The hotel, staff, and location are great, & I would definitely stay here again! Just a note - the parking immediately around the hotel is a bit tight, although there is a lot across the street. I suspect that during the summer parking may be a bit difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: brlmom
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Hilton for few days the week before Thanksgiving, due to a reasonable promotional rate. The lobby was lovely, as was the room. We especially loved the ocean view and decent sized patio. The room was very nicely appointed, and the bathroom was fabulous. Great shower, double sink, jacuzzi tub-loved it. The kitchen area seemed to have everything one would need to prepare meals-right down to a blender! Having the two televisions with DVD players was a great bonus for a family. The hotel staff was great. My in-laws stayed in another room in which the bathroom sink was clogged and not draining. A quick call to the desk and about 10 minutes total later, the sink was fixed. We had a major car issue on day one of our trip, and the staff was very helpful in finding us phone numbers for car repair shops and car rental agencies. We didn't eat in the restaurant or use the indoor pool during our stay, but it looked nice enough. Unfortunately, due to miserable rainy and cold weather, we didn't use the beach either, but it looked like a nice stretch. The Starbucks cart in the lobby was a plus as well. All in all, we were very satisfied with both the quality, cleanliness, and overall experience of this stay. So much so that we have already booked a trip for the Spring! The only issue I have with this hotel is the ridiculous room price during the summer season. That being said, all hotels are ridiculous during the summer in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Off Season Get Away Spot”
Reviews.Author: jfox112074
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is one of the nicest properties in Ocean City. The off season rates make a weekend getaway very doable. My husband and I took my 8 yr old daughter and her friend and they had a blast in the indoor pool. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed with full size fridge, microwave and oven. While many things are closed in January, however indoor mini-golf is available as is the indoor "Playland" Arcade at the Inlet. Plenty to enjoy for an overnight break.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location, excellent service, solid Hilton”
Reviews.Author: JasonG14
Reviews.Content: First it is important to say that the location of this hotel is ideal. It is right on the beach- not close to the beach but right there. Every room has an ocean view with a large balcony. The service was similarly excellent. The front desk staff was helpful and polite and provided very good local recommendations for our weekend getaway. As a Diamond member I've stayed at Hiltons everywhere. What this hotel is NOT is a luxury property. The rooms are large- family style suites, with two rooms and kitchens..but the fit and finish is Hampton Inn level. To be fair- the bed was extremely comfortable and the jetted tub and rain shower were very nice. Do not expect top or even mid level Hilton luxury rooms, expect clean and functional. In particular this hotel would be great for a family staying for a beach vacation, with the large fridge, complete dish set, oven, dishwasher, microwave, even a dishwasher- not to mention fold out couch and second flat screen TV in the living room. There is a well equipped and clean fitness room and an indoor pool as well. We had lunch in the restaurant and the staff was lovely although the food was only fair and expensive. The strength of this hotel is the great location and staff. The rooms aren't bad, they are pretty good, just functional rather than luxurious. Eat elsewhere and focus on the lovely beach and terrific helpful staff and you will really enjoy this hotel. Just don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest hotel in Ocean City with spectacular ocean views!”
Reviews.Author: Twig0319
Reviews.Content: I have visited Ocean City numerous times over the years staying in condos and hotels bayside to ocean front. I had the good fortune to receive a weekend stay at the Hilton for a Christmas present. We took advantage of this gift by staying this past MLK weekend at the hotel. We arrived approximately 7:00p on Friday evening and proceeded to the front desk on the first floor. Check in was fast and efficient. Kristian was pleasant and helpful. Our request for a room on a high floor was honored. As we entered our room on the 11th floor we understood why this hotel receives such high marks. The front living area was clean and orderly including a large dining table and 32 in. TV. The kitchen is fully equipped with a full size fridge, oven, microwave, dishwasher and utensils… The bedroom was large (we had 2 queens) with a dresser a reasonably sized closet with plenty of hangers, and 32 in. HD TV. The bathroom has double sinks a large tub with rain shower. The entire room was well decorated. All appliances worked and there were no complaints or problems with the room. The absolute best part is the balcony! Nothing compares to a balcony overlooking the beach and ocean. We could hear noise/voices in the hallway but the room seemed adequately soundproofed as we could not hear the same when we were in the room. The hallways are wide and bright. There was a full laundry room on the floor. The hotel has many amenities that are not available during winter months – the outdoor pools as an example. However, the indoor pool is large and clean, there is a comfortable lounge/bar and full service restaurant open year round. The workout room was sufficiently equipped. The hotel is situated close to several restaurants and bars. The hotel is pricey but worth every penny. We hope to be back for our Summer vacation

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: dlp58
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times and it's always a good experience. Comparing it to other similar beachfront hotels in Ocean City, the Hilton stands out. The service is always friendly and efficient, the rooms are always clean and in good repair and the restaurant (32Palm) is one of the better ones that I've eaten at in Ocean City. It's a very good option for high season, but a particularly great option when travelling to Ocean City in the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: 1foodude
Reviews.Content: I wish there was a rank between average and very good because this is where the Hilton would rank. Okay, for Ocean City this place is the Four Seasons, it would be good anywhere else. Ocean CIty has never been about the upscale experience, it is all about family fun and the beach. It is the nicest hotel in Ocean City which you should take with a grain of salt if you are not from the East Coast. In Ocean City you are lucky if your room is clean and your shower is not clogged with sand. As such, this is a nice clean hotel and my kids love the outdoor pool and slides. It is a nice lobby and they have a cafe that serves Starbucks, so a plus there. It is in a good location and right on the beach, so another plus. If you don't have a beach house or a go to condo that you stay in every year, then this is a great alternative for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jenjar2
Reviews.Content: Suite was very clean. View was phenomenal. Stayed 2 nights between Christmas and New Year's. Not a lot of restaurants open but enough to have some good choices. Would definitely go back, especially with the inexpensive holiday rate.

Reviews.Title: “Right to be No 1”
Reviews.Author: Ericj
Reviews.Content: Great view. Comfortable beds. Furniture a little cheap feeling. Good value. Pleasant help. Good stay. Cant ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: corb2430
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here before Christmas and had a fantastic experience. The hotel is still pretty new so the rooms were sparkling clean... and huge. The balcony was a nice size as well. The staff was so friendly and always professional. The bay views from the elevator hallways were stunning. I am not sure what it is like during the high season, but during the winter a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “$$$$ Expensive, but so worth it.”
Reviews.Author: PIttsburghTraveler02
Reviews.Content: The Ocean City Hilton is one of the most expensive hotels in Ocean City. It is an all suite hotel, which even for the Hilton brand is one of their top tiers. Ocean City's hotel quality is not set at a very high standard, with many hotels and motels never recieving major renovations since their opening in the 70's or 80's. This bing one of the nicer Hilton's in the company along with Ocean City having such low standards makes this one of I would say the top 3 hotels in all of Ocean City. This hotel is right along with top resorts that I have stayed at in Aruba. Your bathroom in the room will be amazing. Double sink, Whirlpool 2 person tub, and waterfall showerhead. The kitchen was fully equipped with everything that you need, and it was all in great condition. I have stayed in hotels in Ocean City that I would not touch their pots and pans, etc because they were in such bad shape. I did my laundry before going home - it was free! (I hate taking drty clothes home) The swim up pool bar spectular and the best part is that they have seperate area for kids and adults. My suggestion is to save up your Hilton points to stay even one night if you can or stay here in the off season if you are looking to beat the price. This hotel deserves an award from Hilton it could have been a Conrad or Ritz!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tcoster
Reviews.Content: We took our 11 month old daughter to OC for the Winterfest of Lights which was wonderful. We got a great rate booking online. Everything about the hotel was great- the staff, service, room and room cleanliness. The indoor pool was great. We did not eat at the resturant so I cannot review that. We will definately return to the Hilton. I'm not sure if I can afford the summer rates but off season rates are great! We stayed at Princess Royal about 1 month ago and would not recommend that hotel- much nicer stay at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the offseason”
Reviews.Author: Bibbseat55
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend getaway. What can you say, certainly the nicest property in Ocean City. The room was clean, spacious, and just felt luxurious and nice. The only "complaint" was the water pressure in the rain shower, but then again, it's a huge jacuzzi tub with a rain shower so who cares if it takes an extra minute to rinse off because of softer water pressure! Indoor pool was very well heated and large, staff was so friendly, and I'm glad we booked this place while we could afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Off Season Deal!”
Reviews.Author: smh212
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here off season while attending conferences in OC in the past - The weekday rates are comparable to many "budget' hotels - but you get a wonderful ocean front suite... The entire family stayed during the thanksgiving holiday while visiting relatives in the area - As usual, the pricing was great - AAA rate + hilton honors guests get breakfast vouchers... Past visits would have all been 5 stars, this time, lowered to four stars due to lack of cleanliness in and around the pool - (probably just short staffed over the holidays - but the water needed to be changed too!) We'll be back - maybe even in-season...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Elbmag
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Suites Thanksgiving weekend. It is a really nice hotel and the room was great. We had an oceanview room with a king bed and I thought the bed was comfortable and the room was very nice. The jacuzzi tub is advertised as "comfortably fitting 2 adults"...not so much and we aren't overly large. It also has a "rain shower" shower head...I thought I'd like that but found that it isn't particularly useful for actually showering. Overall the Hilton is very nice but I'm not sure it is worth what we paid per night. There are other comparable hotels that would be a little less pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Family of four had a real "suite" overnight!”
Reviews.Author: Andy Q
Reviews.Content: My wife, two young children, and I, just did an overnight at this property. We knew that this was the off-season in O.C. ... so no real surprise there. However, we were very surprised to find how nice and clean this Hilton was. Our 10th floor suite, complete with kitchen, and an amazing ocean view, was awsome. It had all the amenities that one would expect in a first class hotel.....really! O.C. has plenty of restaurants in town and a clean boardwalk. Our only complaint was that there appeared to be "too much chlorine in the indoor pool". The kid's eyes were irritated after swimming. Aside from that, I would highly recommend this place for a family trip....even in the off-season! AQ L.I. N.Y.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean front location excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: appetitetogo
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here and I would recommend it to everyone. Spacious, comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A real ''suite'' deal”
Reviews.Author: stevediorio1960
Reviews.Content: I often travel with my grown daughter(24 years old)and have to pay for two rooms,so that she has her privacy..It is always nice when I can find a real suite,with a separate bedroom.This hotel was perfect for her and I.We were able to spend the whole day(s) exploring the eastern shore,and at the end of the day she had the king bedroom(direct oceanfront)while I slept on the pull-out sofa in the living room.Also,a fully functional kitchen,and bathroom separate the 2 rooms.We got a great rate,however,we were quite aware that it was only because it was midweek,and off season(which we prefer anyway).In season rates are mind-boggling. We did not eat at this hotel,but the indoor pool was wonderful.Remember,you can use the kitchen if you prefer to save a few dollars. Our experience was extremely positive.Everyone we came in contact with was very polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in OC”
Reviews.Author: huberdarling
Reviews.Content: Wanted a nice weekend away during off season, and we got it! Room is georgeous, view is incredible, house cleaning was a little lacking, but considering that it is off season, not terrible. Easy to see why this is #1 in OC!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: MB4L
Reviews.Content: Absolutey amazing. The room the view and the price was unbelievable. We felt like we were on an island and not right here on the eastcoast in maryland. Hilton, you rock!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hilton with Convenient Suites”
Reviews.Author: EJG4
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member so stay in a lot of different Hilton properties. This one is great. The hotel is very clean and up to date. Great location on the beach. Nice gym. Suites are an excellent set up where you walk into a living room, through a full kitchen and into a bedroom with a balcony overlooking the beach. I was there in the offseason so it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, view and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: salsrug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with another couple for our 10 year college reunion. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room, the tub, the view and the bed. I thought the room was great. We used the fitness center and thought that the pool was nice. The staff was pleasant. We misplaced my husband's sunglasses. They were very quick to get us in touch with the correct person. Great place to stay. Considering staying in the summer because of the awesome pool setup.

Reviews.Title: “Little chilly, but nice”
Reviews.Author: ExHospitalityPro
Reviews.Content: Made a one night trip in September with friends. Arrived early and was allowed to check in early since family in our assigned room checked out early. Enjoy a nice day at the beach, the pool, and workout area. The purpose of the trip was to take friends for all you can eat snowcrabs at either Bonfire or Embers. After looking at both, they chose Embers. Enjoyed donuts at the major understaffed local donut shop - they had one person working when we walked in and the wait was 30 minutes. Offseason rate was a nice $149.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (bad breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: KatSimons
Reviews.Content: I am just reviewing the hotel as a 5 and will write a separate review of their restaurant. My husband and I usually stay at Courtyard by Marriott because he has a bad back and the Courtyards (if renovated in the past 2-4 years) have decent beds that do not aggravate him. We go to the ocean annually at the end of October to celebrate our anniversary and we decided to visit O.C. this trip as my daughter is very pregnant and it is the closest drive in case we needed to be with her sooner than expected. So, we made a reservation at Courtyard a while back. Courtyard's rate for Fri & Sat night was (is) $199.00 + taxes, then, on weeknights other than Friday, $149.00. About three weeks ago a friend mentioned check Hilton for off-season, so we did and were pleasantly surprised to find the rate was $144/00/night all through the week. We contacted them and were able to make a reservation for a 2 Queen suite (i is ALL suites)...we were a little apprehensive about the beds but they seemed to be rated as comfortable. Additionally, this is the #1 rated hotel in O.C. here on TripAdvisor. I was delighted to read that there was a basic full kitchen and jetted bathtub, too. Service was excellent throughout our stay - bell service was pleasant coining and going; front desk staff were polite and courteous (and welcoming)). There is a concierge with good advice (by room phone or lobby desk). The kitchen is equipped with nice basic dishware. I broke a mug making coffee (oh - best in-room coffee to make - caff & decaf - ever) and called for housekeeping and a young lady arrived virtually immediately and cleaned very thoroughly and had a great attitude. Although all he king bed suites were taken, the hotel was not full and they accommodated our upon-arrival request to be near the elevator (my husband can walk but not far at times and weather was very cold so he was stiff & sore). There was a full fridge, microwave, blender, dishwasher, 4-cup coffee-maker and electric stove/oven. There were some wine glasses and a wine opener! We brought ours but nice to know for next time.; It's equipped for a family stay...we used the coffeemaker and microwave and fridge (we had leftovers at two restaurants and happy to have a fridge to keep them in nicely. They provide quality shampoo, conditioner, soaps, (body massage bar & facial), shower caps, etc. The shower is within the jetted bath (large) and is overhead (comes don like rain). There is a double sink (love that) and all as sparkling clean. Lots of thick towels,plus two thck robes in top of the closet should you need them, etc. The balcony is large than average and a nice round patio table with 4 decent patio chairs fits nicely on it. In nice weather it would be a lovely place to at breakfast - the sun rises directly in front of the shore, so I did get up two mornings to photograph the sunrise and drank coffee out there ... There is a small living room upon entry and it has a nice LG TV (32" or little more?) as does the bedroom. The wi-fi (free) is strong ... The beds are lovely; firm with some bounce - about equivalent to the ones we like at Courtyard, so we slept excellently. The only thing bad I have to say is the breakfast we tried one morning was so awful (and they handled that so we did not pay for it) and I do not hold that against them as far as rating them on the hotel accommodations - there are quite a few decent breakfast places, so that was not a big deal in the end....stay here, especially off-season, and eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Off-season Winner”
Reviews.Author: Decklid18
Reviews.Content: After futzing with various hotel booking sites, I asked a friend for a recommendation for our Ocean City stay. He immediately replied Hilton Suites Oceanfront. I thank him. Our room had two queens, full kitchen, living/dining area, big bathroom with tub-for-two and an oceanfront balcony. The furnishings were a bit dated, but still quite comfortable. Nice flat screen TVs in front & back rooms. Location is great, just North of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent off season spot”
Reviews.Author: DCMcG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night, mid week, with my husband in October. He was travelling for work, I was along for fun. This hotel was so great, I'm hoping his work brings him here more often! Everything you need is provided. Starting with the room - we were in an oceanfront suite with two queen beds. There is ample space to spread out in the room, the kitchen is well stocked, and the bathroom is huge, and includes a jacuzzi tub. You can hear the waves from the balcony. The hotel has a large indoor pool, two (at least) restaurants, a fitness center, and a game room. All of these were above average, both in size and quality. The outdoor pool looked awesome, but was sadly closed for the season. The hotel is located on 33rd street, down the road from the convention center. It is about a mile north of the end of the boardwalk. There are many restaurants and shops within walking distance. Even in the off season we found a great place to walk to for dinner, and a short drive for lunch. We ordered room service breakfast at the hotel, which was average. Parking is free, although could get a bit crowded looking for an open spot. Service at the desk and throughout the hotel was above average. This Hilton is wonderful, especially if you can get an off season rate! Don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just beware of the first floor”
Reviews.Author: hg2000
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hilton Suites Oceanfront since the year they opened and love it - the suites are spacious, the pools are great and overall service is very good. We will stay again for sure. Our original first floor room had a recurring noise - we began timing it - every 20 minutes - something from the pipes or HVAC. We were told it was the laundry, then told it was the "chiller" which shouldn't have been on given the outside temperature... but it persisted. The hotel was sold out that first night so we could not be moved - and had a very restless night. We did get moved the next day by noon which was great - and no more noise. The staff were accommodating, but no apology was made by management. Overall, our stay was very good and we were appreciative of the move the 2nd day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: Klepley
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel with a great room and great service. The indoor pool is fantastic in the winter, and the beach extremely nice well. The only drawback is you are about 5 blocks from the boardwalk, so those who have walking problems may need some other way to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: dede7280
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 2 nights at the end of September. We had not been to Ocean City, MD in years and the last time we stayed the Hilton was just being built. The Hilton is by far the best Hotel in the area. The hotel is very clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. They have several elevators, so you didn't have to wait long. Staff was available at the main doors to offer assistance with bags or directions. Our room had a sitting area when you first walked in, a full kitchen with full sized appliances, a large bathroom with a corner jacuzzi tub and rainfall shower head ,then the bedroom. All the rooms are oceanfront, we stayed in the Terrace suite which has a private hot tub over looking the ocean....AMAZING at night! The suite also has 2 lounge chairs for sunbathing and a patio set, all on a very spacious balcony. We had a great time and loved our stay, next time we return we WILL stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive.”
Reviews.Author: 4JETS
Reviews.Content: Impressive Hilton right on the ocean. Great pools for the kids, my two daughters age 4 and 5 keep asking when we are going back. A little bit off the boardwalk but that was a plus for us, a bit quieter. Looking to go back in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great Experience”
Reviews.Author: pushup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Ocean City for 2 nights at the end of August. This was our 4th stay here and it was as enjoyable as always. Each summer we spend 2 nights at the Hilton after spending a week in a condo. It's a nice way to turn a 7 day vacation into a 10 day one, and as nice as the condo we stay at may be, it's not the same as staying in a nice hotel with all the amenities that a hotel can offer. This time we were upgraded to a King Corner Suite. I had alwasys thought that all the rooms were the same, but the king corner suite was amazing and much bigger than the regular suite. We had plenty of room for a roll away bed along with the pull out sofa in the living room. My kids do not like to share a bed so this was great. The full kitchen is really nice as you have the option of making breakfast and lunch in the room if you want. The kitchens have a pretty respectable offering of appliances, pots and pans, plates, etc. We choose to go out for dinners, but if a family wanted to eat in, that would be easy to do. As always, the service was great from the front desk staff and the bellhops to the servers and bartenders at the pool. Everybody is always so friendly and accomodating and really do make the guests feel like they are on vacation. This year my kids did not want to participate in the arts and crafts program or watch the movie as they preferred to stay on the beach, but we have taken advantage of these in the past, and when they were younger, it was a great "kid free" break for us. Another really great service that the Hilton provides is changing rooms for use on the day of checkout. Not only are guests allowed to use the facilities on their day of checkout, but they are given access keys to a changing room with showers, which makes staying and enjoying your last day to the fullest so nice; something that is very important on a beach trip. Overall, great oceanfront suites, great pools, great service, great mid town location, the Hilton continues to be a place my whole family looks forward to going to.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: jgtiii
Reviews.Content: For our first ever trip to OC, we decided to try the Hilton based on prior Tripadvisor reviews. We tried off season to minimize the crowds, but regardless of season, this hotel cannot be beat. Splendid oceanfront suite accommodations with extremely friendly, courteous, and helpful staff. Location is ideal just outside of, but close enough to, the boardwalk area and midway on the stretch of OC restaurants, shops, etc. Wonderful views of the ocean from your balcony, easy beach access, and incredibly spacious and comfortable. Can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just bad timing”
Reviews.Author: 40ishrm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great but we stayed during a weekend when there was a car show. Since it was offseason, we were expecting less crowds and more relaxation. But because of the car show, it was crowded and noisy with cars racing their engines and bumper to bumper traffic. Again not good timing for our family vacation. Now for the hotel. We stayed in a corner suite on the second floor. If staying at this hotel, request a room higher than the 4th floor so that you can have a better view. Our room was over the pool bar which was closed for the season but we had an obstructed ocean view. The room was spacious and had everything we needed. Our room was clean but the carpet in the common areas like outside the elevator needed a good shampoo. The indoor pool was huge and the kids loved it. It was too cold to use the outdoor pool; the kiddie pool was actually closed for the season. Staff was very friendly. Debbie checked us in and out with a great attitude. Nicole, reservation manager, was accomodating to a request that I made. Overall staff was superb. Jacuzzi tub did not work properly but we really didn't mind so I even forgot to report the problem when we checked out. Just from driving into Ocean City, this Hilton outshined all the rest. Didnt eat at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Traveltron5000
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with breathtaking views. The rooms are spacious, clean, and full of nice little surprises. Hilton pulled out all the stops on this one. Peter Thomas Roth toiletries, jacuzzi tub, fabulously plush robes, towels, and linens. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Ocean City But Won't Be Last!”
Reviews.Author: Bev1954
Reviews.Content: We wanted a beach vacation, with a room right on the beach, and we got it! Our suite is perfect. We love that we can get up every morning, open our curtains and watch the sunrise. Some mornings the temperature is cool, but it is October after all! We have been sitting on the balcony sipping coffee and watching the sun come up all week. It's perfect! I like using the full kitchen. We have some special dietary needs and having use of the kitchen works well for these needs. Plus we save a ton of money eating in. Restaurant food gets a tad boring after a while. I have used the Fitness Room each day, then my husband and I have gone swimming in the indoor pool for an hour or so. It's been very nice! The weather is beautiful, but we are not brave enough to swim outdoors. It's been warm enough, though, to sit on the balcony and read each day. I also love the Jacuzzi tub! This place really is perfect for us and we plan to come back next October. My husband booked the suite a month in advance of our trip and we saved a HUGE amount of money - enough money that we can extend for a few days. We will be here 12 days by the time we check out. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: DrRiff
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in OC at the Hilton on the "romance package.". The suite was roomy and it was so pleasant to sit on our private deck and eat the chocolate covered strawberries provided and the room service breakfast. Only recommendation is to skip the sparkling wine and bring your own because what they provided was pretty awful. Otherwise a perfect weekend away from home.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - From start to finish”
Reviews.Author: JVerdon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Suites Ocean City Oceanfront September 10, 2011 through September 17, 2011. Everyone and every amenity was top shelf. The persons who took care of our room were dynamite. I told them our first morning that my husband and I get up and out early and like to come back to the room early in the day. Our room was immaculate each and every morning. They were exceptional. The fact that the hotel offers washers and dryers FREE.....and they give you Tide and Downy at the front desk for free.....I was in heaven. I hate dirty cloths. This is a big HUGE plus to parents with kids and anybody else that stays there. To me it means, you don't have to bring that many cloths with you! We are Hilton Honor members and we used our points for this stay. WE WILL BE BACK NEXT SEPTEMBER.....another huge plus....the Hotel gave us 14 green coupon cards worth $9.00 each. You could use them anyway you wanted. We used it in the Restaurant for dinner, for breakfast, at the Starbucks kiosk and at the Pool. The Restaurant offered 1/2 price bottles of wine. The servers and bartenders were terrific. The food in the restaurant is really good. They had pototo pancakes to die for. Even the sandwiches at the pool were very good HILTON quality. Oh, and the muffins for breakfast are the biggest and best muffins I have ever had. I can not wait to go back there again next September. I want to thank the entire staff for making this yet another incredible Hilton Vacation..Janet and Nick Giella

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my honeymoon in 9/2008 and again 6/2010. This place is great, the rooms are so spacious with a kitchen, a sitting area with x box and two flat screen tv. Plus a DVD player which came in handy for the rainy days. I also loved how it is right on the beach. The pool bar is awesome and the kiddy pool is so fun...the only complaint I have is the indoor pool is always cold...The Palm restaurant is nice as well with a great breakfast and the front desk staff is pretty nice...depends on who you get. Parking is free and the hotel is just lovely. I will definitively be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tap41
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Suites was very nice, We had a girlfriends weekend, and enjoyed it. We arrived Friday around 11:00 am, and to my suprise was able to go ahead and check in, despite the reviews stating that early check-in was not an option, the staff was very friendly. We were on the 4th floor, and that was perfect for us. We were disappointed that the trolley doesnt run past Labor Day, however there is a bus that runs every half hour 2 blocks away. only for the boardwalk..It would have been nice if the Hilton could provide bus runs, as there is a casino within 5 miles, The adult pool has a swim up bar, and that was awesome. We also enjoyed the hot tub at the kids pool, although, it closed at 7pm. It would have been nice for the adults to be able to enjoy the hot tub, after an evening of shopping the boardwalk. The beach was wonderful. very easy to get to and from. Will definelty come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: monkeypants08205
Reviews.Content: My wife & I bicycled to O.C. And stayed in a terrace suite. Very nice! The staff was great. All the amenities we're "Hilton quality". Two small issues, the sliding door leading to the balcony on 1215 needs repair and the hotel needs to ensure that guests can still rent chairs and umbrellas after labor day.

Reviews.Title: “It's the way to go in OC! Best OC trip ever staying here!”
Reviews.Author: SueSamek
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is a very nice place to stay. The beds were so comfortable, no one wanted to get up in the morning :) The gym was very nice. The pools (all three) and the hot tub were fantastic! The restaurant and bar and grill were the best! The service was perfect! Couldn't ask for anything more! Well worth the $$s. We ordered food trays to be in the room when we arrived and they were very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: well-traveled32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been wanting to try this hotel, but it was always out of our price range. I found a AAA rate during the off season that we could afford, so I decided to surprise my husband and booked this hotel. It was everything I had hoped it would be. All the suites are oceanfront and have many amenities. There was a full living room area with sleeper sofa, a full kitchen with granite counter tops and full size appliances (even a dishwasher), very comfortable beds and a bathroom with granite counter tops and a jacuzzi tub. There are also 2 outdoor pools. One is an adult pool with a swim up bar, and a kid pool with a slide. There is also a hot tub in this area. They also have an indoor pool, but we didn't use it because the weather was too nice not to be outside. And the location of the hotel is great as well. You are literally steps away from the ocean. And the staff was very attentive. They were always greeting us when we came in and pushing the elevator buttons for us. I felt very pampered during our stay at the Hilton, and we hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: VSfromNJ
Reviews.Content: Our experience was great!. The staff was very helpful and kind. All rooms have ocean view. Our room was on the 10 th floor, overlooking the ocean. Family of six can comftably stay.....2 queen beds in the bedroom and there was a pullout sofa in the living room. Both rooms had flat screen tv with dvd. One of our dvd player didnt work but other one was just fine for the kids. We enjoy breakfast on the balcony with starbuck right in the lobby wss great!  room was well cleaned everyday.   They have kids activity...sent our kid for 1 hr while we enjoyed drinks in the pool area with live band! They have great kids pool and they also have indoor pool. They provide free beach towels, which is nice too.  One problem we had which was not resolved during stay wss poor internet WiFi in the room. I couldnt use my iPad. They offered ethernet cable but that was of no use to me. IPad worked quite fine in lobby areas.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, upscale, great location”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy_O353
Reviews.Content: This is a well- maintained upscale hotel that leaves no details out. When you walk up the stairs into the main lobby you can immediately see the ocean. A few steps out the door is a fantastic pool area- to the left, an adult pool with swim-up pool bar and steel drums playing (weekends). To the right, a mini water park, complete with two slides, fountains, etc perfect for the kids but with waitress bar/food service. All suite rooms with full living area, kitchen, huge bath and bedroom, and balcony with table/chairs. Super clean room except for carpeting that left socks dirty (only complaint). Slightly expensive but well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, otherwise pretty expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: largebarn
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good hotel, right on the beach. The kids loved the children's pool, and the indoor pool when it rained was nice. We used the kitchen for a few meals, and everything worked, though feels a little dated. I didn't really care for Ocean City, but if I went again I would stay here. However, only with Hilton points, as the $500 per night seems ridiculous for this place. $400 must be for the location as I have stayed at many nicer Hilton properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that Lived Up to All The Great Trip Advisor Reviews”
Reviews.Author: QueensMarine
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Hilton in Ocean City and it was great. I read many reviews before going here and this place definitley was as good as many people have said. The rooms were very clean and the beds were some of the best I have ever slept in at a hotel. The only complaint I would have is that the wireless internet signal was a little weak and did not work on the balcony from my tenth floor room. I took the advice of many reviewers and stayed above the 6th floor because I had a baby and was worried about noise. This was a good choice especially since we left the balcony door open all day and the noise from the pool could be loud. At night we could here the ocean waves which was very relaxing. All the rooms face the ocean at this place. What impressed me most was how soundproof the room was. Even the balcony doors were very soundproof once closed. I used the gym at this place and it was adequate with an extensive dumbell set, two benches, physio and medicine balls and a varitey of Cardio equipment to include three treadmills, two eliptical machines and a stationary bike. All the cardio equipment had personal screens to watch TV, just bring a set of headphones as it appears they only have two in the gym. The three pools were also great. The kiddie pool gets crowded quickly. I saw one parent from my balcony walk to the pool by herself at 8am, place 8 items on 8 chairs and walked away. People do this as chairs run out and they have nowhere to sit when they come to the pool. This is annoying but understandable when you are traveling with small kids but taking 8 chairs and leaving seemed wrong. This hotel is expensive but if money is not a problem it is the way to go. We went here as we had an infant and it was right on the beach with a full kitchen. It was convineient and if the baby was a problem or needed to be changed by my wife or myself we could simply walk back to the room while leaving the rest of the family at the beach. I saw one poster complain about the distance to the beach and the long staircase that leads to the beach. This person must be either really out of shape or elderly as the stair case is not as bad as they describe. It could be difficult if you have a few small kids and many things to carry but this could be solved by taking the elevator to the ground floor and taking the sidewalk around the block to the beach, avoiding all staircases. Another poster described a bellhop named Val who was very friendly and helpful. We met him on our arrival and I noticed his nametag. This guy lived up to the bill and was very friendly and actually played with and talked to my kids whenever he saw us. I told him about tripadvisor and the post which he later read, He was so happy about it and thanked me the next day for telling him about it. This place also had kids activities to include movies, magicians and cooking classed to name a few. They were mostly geared to kids ages 5 to 11 years old. Will try to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “perfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: CollinsFamily0531
Reviews.Content: We came in the day after Hurricane Irene and everything was perfect. the room and beach lived up to all the positive reviews , I did see some negative reviews about the rooms being old and dirty but our room seemed brand new and spotless(maybe we got lucky??), although I felt the beds could have been a little more comfortable. We have a 15 and 4 year old and both enjoyed every minute, the kids pool was perfect for my 4 yr old and the beach/adult pool was perfect for the 15 yr old. also the location to the amusement park and miniature golf was great, there was a little hike to the board walk but not bad at all. when we come back to OC , we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: CrazyEd_11
Reviews.Content: My family has a 7, 5 and 3 old kids. Everyone enjoyed the kids pool and the real close access to the beach. Parents were secure with the overall safety and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Ldmny
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for kids. All ages. 3 pools. Located right on the beach. Had to evacuate due to hurricane a day earlier. Hilton gave us coupons for 4 nights free at any other hotels anytime. Best hotel in ocean city!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosieposie515
Reviews.Content: Everything was extremely clean. The beds were very very comfortable. We had a great ocean view from the balcony and they even provided outside chairs and a table for the room. We had a small issue with our hot water not working but the maintenance guy was very nice and they offered to move us to a different room. The hotel was great and I highly recommend it… Ocean City itself was a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisfigz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an abreviated (thanks to Hurricane Irene) trip to the Hilton in OC. Planned to stay 5 nights but only made 4 but they are refunding the unused points. This was our second trip here (family of 3 with 7 year old). Redeemed points for the stay so I really cannot comment on the value vs room rate. As a gold member we received $90 in vouchers to be used anywhere - pool bar, starbucks, restaurant - a nice perk. I agree with all the previous positive comments, but if you are reading this, you should be aware of what this hotel is and is not.... During the peak summer, this is not a quiet honeymoon spot or a relaxing getaway from the kids. It is a loud, running, jumping, spinning circus of a place with kids, who may or may not be supervised, everywhere. The lifeguards and hotel staff do thier best to keep order, but a sandy, wet kid running through the lobby is the fault of the parent. Then again I saw plenty of adults doing that as well. At night things do quiet down as pools close early. If you are looking for a nice quiet stay, wait til the kids go back to school. Having a 7 year old,we are used to this so it was no big deal. We found the location to be perfect - about a 4 block walk to the end of the boardwalk where you can jump on the tram - (keep in mind all the rides and games on the boardwalk are about 35 blocks away). All of the staff we interacted with were helpful and friendly. A previous review mentioned that Val helped with the bags. He helped me also and would have packed my car for me if I let him. For us this is the only place we would stay in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel--Don't Expect 5-Start Touches”
Reviews.Author: TazDevil30
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for the past 5 years every summer (2-3 times per summer). Pros: * the rooms are big. The bedroom has a door and is seperated from the living room by a hallway which includes the kitchen and bathroom. the living room has a sofa bed. so, kids can sleep in the living room and use the bathroom and kitchen without diturbing parents in the bedroom. * TV and DVD in bedroom and living room so parents and children can watch different programming and bring DVD's from home (they also have a lending library for free). * the ocean view is fantastic!! * the beach is very quiet right infront. We are there long weekends and you can always find a spot infront of this hotel * the pools are great--one kid pool and one adult pool with swim up bar * indoor pool for rainy days * bathroom has huge jacuzi (perfect for 2) Cons: *it's a little far to walk to the boardwalk. It's a good 10 minute walk to the end of the boardwalk and it takes about an hour to walk from the end of the boardwalk to the begning which is where most of the action is. * don't expect turndown service even though they claim they offer it, it's erratic. We experienced this in May and July when we stayed 5 nights each. We asked for it each night and got it about 2 nights. * very stingy with toiletries. We dont' usually bring shampoo and soap and they are pretty conservative about how much to give. We end up always having to ask for more. * don't show up early. your room wont' be ready. * breakfast is expensive and ok. The $30 buffet would be great at $15-20.

Reviews.Title: “This will be your new home in Ocean City, I promise you will love it.”
Reviews.Author: summerr106
Reviews.Content: You will be welcomed by their friendly and helpful bell staff upon your arrival. Please use their services. Ask for Val, he is a great guy. They give helpful advice about the area since they are local residents and work study students who come back each year. We have been coming here since they opened and every year we see the same people on staff. That really tells you something about the hotel when they retain their help for long periods of time. Check in is fast and easy, the rooms are wonderful and appointed beautifully. Full size range, refrigerator, and dish washer. Not that you will cook in very often, but they are nice to have. The cleaning staff is first rate. The rooms are clean well stocked and if you need anything just ask, they will provide you with anything they can. Ask to meet Joe and Vince to help with restaurant reservations. They know all the places to go for entertainment and great food. It is within walking distance to the Boardwalk, amusement park, small grocery store, great deli and just about anything you need. I love the fact that we park the car and dont have to move it the entire time we are there. Oh yeah, 2 sparkling clean pools and yes, it is right on the beach. Have a great time, you will really love it here.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ittybittyxx
Reviews.Content: my mom had to bribe me and my sis and a friend to drive her down to ocean city from nyc, she said it would be a nice hotel ((shes said that in the past and we have stayed at motel 6 lol)) but i was beyond surprised, apparently shes a hilton member and got the night free, and our room was not your ordinary 2 bed, simple bathroom.... this was bigger then my small ny apt. we had a room on the 17th floor, the view was amazing, even though it wasnt yet beach weather it made it even better since no one was on the beach ruining the great view. when you walked in, there was a living room and it was very spacious and the couch pulls out if want to sleep more people ((its actually pretty comfy if you just sleep on it as is :) )) next came the FULL kitchen, and insanely large bathroom. the bathroom i felt like i just wanted to chill out in there and watch tv, but alas that was the only thing the bathroom didnt have. next comes the bedroom, we had 2 huge beds they looked like queens not your avg double hotel beds. and omg, it was so comfortable. just open the balcony in the early morn for the nice breeze and fall away into the pillow. we used the pool and that was interesting it was a mix of salt and chlorine which we didnt expect and the foam kinda urks you but hey pool vs no pool and pool always wins. and we also used the laundry room, all the soap you can get right from the front desk even at 1 am like we did :) if i ever go back to ocean city i will def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice time but the hotel is in need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey G
Reviews.Content: Visited the Hilton Suites on a family vacation for 5 nights. We have been there at least 5 times in the past 3 years and always have a nice time. This time was no different. However; the hotel did have some issues this time around. The rooms were not as clean as they have been over the past years. The screen door going out to the patio was leaning on the side of the patio wall when we arrived. I was able to snap it back into place. The room overall seemed like it was not as clean as it has been in past stays. Went to breakfast a couple of times and although the staff was really trying; they just could not get it together. Very disorganized, but friendly. It rained on one of the days and the kids wanted to go to the indoor pool. What a mistake. The pool was not very clean. There were hairballs on the side of the pool and it really did not look well maintained. Kind of gross. Fitness center, pool and beach were quite nice. Last but not least the majority of the housekeeping and wait staff were from Russia. They were fine. However I really have a tough time with the hotel bringing on staff from other countries when we have unemployment over 9%. This is not a political forum, but it did have an impact on my stay, so I did want to mention it.

Reviews.Title: “First class property and facilities, Service was not a priority.”
Reviews.Author: matthewedward
Reviews.Content: As for the facilities here you are not going to do any better then the Hilton Suites. Great place to take kids with awesome pools. My trouble is with the service. They hire a lot of kids, college age and early twenty-somethings. They did not seem highly trained nor concerned about a faltering service. From delays at check in, no pool towels and extended closings of the fitness center for cleaning, this was not a smooth operating machine. Still, this property is better than most in OC though that is not a difficult task. As for the price, forget about it. A ridiculous $505 per night however they were selling out at that rate so I guess you get what people are willing to pay. Great location with a mini mart and liquor store close by. Decent crab house 2 blocks away and a bus top for either direction very close also. Plenty of parking on site at no charge which is also a plus. Highly recommended hotel but not the service you would be accustom too as a Hilton Honors member.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comforable beds”
Reviews.Author: donjol
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for 2 reasons; first that it was a suite hotel and our friend could stay with us for a couple nights and also for the excellent value. The room was very nice with a fridge and micrwave and wet bar area. There were 2 large flat screen TVs ( would have been happier if we got more channels and the remotes worked better) I was surprised that we only had a couple of channels, it's Chicago. As a honors member we received free wifi access only it didn't work all the time and went out during online sessions. Also it was difficult to use with smart phones.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for a beachfront stay”
Reviews.Author: nuclearsun
Reviews.Content: Top performing Hilton all the way. I'm a diamond and enjoy the perks and treatment I recieve for my loyalty, this property and staff ensure your stay is perfect. Great front staff, excellent location and well kept facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st Trip to Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: GMarisol
Reviews.Content: My family just came back from our 1st trip to Ocean City - mom, dad, 3 and 6 year old. Hilton was expensive, but had great amenities. Can't beat ocean front hotel with ocean view - could leave the windows to your private balcony open to hear the ocean waves throughout the day. Free parking underneath or adjacent to hotel - so once parked, just had to walk a few feet to the beach! It rained a few times when we were there - but the Hilton provided indoor activities twice a day for children 5 and up - crafts, cooking, movies - you just needed to sign up in time. Also had an indoor pool. Our favorite pools, weather permitting, were the outdoor pools - the kids pool and the (non-kids) pool - the pools were one floor above the ground & you could set up the hotels lounge chairs for beach views. I would recommend bringing a cooler and some food from home (or from along the way) to cook with (except for the times you wish to splurge on some seafood) - the hilton has a good kitchen - full side fridge, range - microwave & pots/pans, utensils (and dishwasher!). Wish sofa bed were more comfortable - next time will likely get 2 Queens (instead of one King) so the kids can have a nice best to rest on. Kids LOVED the beach & we were only a short distance from boardwalk (which didn't seem that great for small kids anyhow - except for the playground sets on the beach) - and also we were across the street from an amusement park that my kids had a blast on at night. We'll save up, but will return again!

Reviews.Title: “A long and difficult walk to the beach”
Reviews.Author: iluvztravel
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely, but to get to the beach, you either have to walk down two very long flights of stairs or take the elevator down one floor and walk through the garage. Then you get to walk across mounds of sand (dunes?) until finally you reach the relatively level beach that you can more readily walk on. It is ridiculous that a hotel of this caliber does not have a wooden walkway or some kind of pathway from the stairs (or garage if you came that way) to the more level beach. I'm a pretty fit mom, but it truly was a chore to get to the beach. I doubt that we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a ok beach town”
Reviews.Author: love-those-beaches
Reviews.Content: We usually stay @ Myrtle Beach, but we stayed 2 nights using Q3 certs to drop off our child at a camp in Md, didn't do enough research & neglected to request the corner suites early for the outdoor jacuzzi, but they still gave us an upper floor w/2 Queen beds. We loved their showers/jacuzzi, and they even had 'massage soaps'. Kitchen well stocked w/pots and utensils. Free laundry & detergent was a bonus! Breakfast vouchers were given for us & our 2 kids. Ate dinner at the restaurant one night-it was 'empty' except for a couple of celebrations, it was ok, abit pricey for the quality, but the staff were all very good. The 2 pools (adult w/swim up bar & kids' slides) were separated by a walkway, both gated w/attendants to check wristband (black rubber bands w/Hilton Suites stamped), then you had to walk down a flight of stairs to get to the beach. Used the large heated indoor pool when it POURED for 2 hours, it has a window to the bar to order drinks! Beach was lit up at night and the oceanfront balcony was very comfortable w/2 chairs & regular height glass table. Newspapers delivered weekdays. What a life, drinking your AM coffee, reading the papers by the ocean in your PJ's! Took the public bus to the tip of the boardwalk, then one short block to the boardwalk. Saw entertainment along the way, eateries and lil shops. Ripleys is on the boardwalk. Beach volleyball & soccor matches, beautiful sand scultures and playgrounds were on the sand. As we were walking back at night, saw rowdier crowds come out, with police at every other block. While on the streets, saw many teens running around barefoot. Not as family friendly as I would have liked. Hotel is across 2 blocks to the Amusement & water park if one desired. Lots of local restaurants in the area, but they all look aged. Conclusion: We loved the hotel & its amenities but would not pay $500+/night for this particular location. It was nice to visit OC, Md for 2-3 days, but for a week-long vacation, we will stick to MB/NMB, there is just more to do and greater variety of restaurants and housing choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: mhd114
Reviews.Content: My five years old boy loves the baby pool and my daughters (ages 10 and 7) love the other pools (adult and indoor) were the reason we stayed at Hilton this summer during the 2nd half of our vacation.  And they weren't disappointed.  I couldn't get them to go to the beach.  The pool side chairs are hard to find because people seem to reserve them early as mentioned before by other reviewers. The room is equipped adequate with basic kitchen tool to prepare a meal, which we fully utilized. The TV screen could be a little bigger for the price was charged nightly, however.  I've been spoiled with 40 to 55" at home.  A 27" seemed a little small for my eyes. The hotel provides free continental breakfast, which is an insult to middle class since you can't pick you own donuts.  The server will get it for you.  The hot breakfast buffet can be had for about $10 (with coupon provided when checked in). I'm not sure if I would want to pay $500 a night for this though. Maybe if I want to spoil my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mustang6811
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, treated like a king from start to finish. Highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL ever”
Reviews.Author: vacationbunny
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL IS EXCELLENT. FRIENDLY staff, great location, beautiful views. They provide changing room if you want to stay after check out or early check in. Activity pool for kids really neat, other outside pool has swim up bar. POOL DECK overlooks ocean, today they had a 2 man band in the afternoon. Overall just a very classy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We Finally Found Our Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheResearcher7
Reviews.Content: This is the 6th hotel we've tried in OC. The others were OK (1 was horrible!) but The Hilton will be our hotel from now on. The room was spacious, new, clean, beautiful. ! The pools were great, staff was friendly, parking good. And there was a Starbucks in the lobby. Need I say more? If you want luxury enough to make your whole trip better, stay at The Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Hotel In OC MD”
Reviews.Author: smack25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two sons (4 and 2 years old) just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at this Hilton Suites and for the third year in a row the people and property exceeded our expectations. The rooms and staff and property all exceeded our expectations and the entire family is excited for our next visit in 2012. We were able to check in a little early on Friday (about 1:00pm the frontdesk called my cell while I was enjoying the pool to tell me our room was ready) which was a great surprise. From Friday thru Monday we enjoyed every minute either poolside or beach side. Due to the easy access to the changing areas after checking out at about 11:00 on Monday we stayed a little longer to enjoy the facilities and showered up afterwards before our drive home. As an added bonus this year since we are Hilton Gold members we received $54 worth of credit vouchers to use anywhere we wanted in the facility. This is the perfect place to bring young kids and if you possible a Nanny so you can sneak out for a few hours of adult time at night.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hilton Oceanfront property 2 hours from DC”
Reviews.Author: Chaledou
Reviews.Content: Some time ago my wife and I went on a quest for great locations to go on weekends driving from Washington DC, preferably with the Hilton chain where I am a Diamond member. Hilton pretty much manages only two luxury oceanfront properties close to DC, the other one being in Virginia Beach (a much longer drive), and the HSOC is by far the best. I have never seen the Hilton Suites concept anywhere else but in Ocean City, and it is very convincing step up from what you get at an Embassy Suites. Amenities include a full kitchen and a suite where you can very comfortably entertain for 6 or more, including a dining room table. Our bathroom included an impressive jacuzi which was quite wonderful. The bedroom was charming, the poster-perfect picture of what a beach hotel room should be, with pastel colors, vacation-themed pictures, quality furniture and very comfortable bedding. Everything in the room expressed the owners' desire to provide quality products so you can in turn have an exceptional time in Ocean City. And of course, the best part: the view from a balcony the same length as the room itself. The balcony included a well-made table with glass top and four chairs, as well as a separation from the balconies next to you for total privacy. Cooking breakfast in the well-appointed kitchen and enjoy it while watching the endless ocean and listening to the waves was worth the price of the trip, and brought us to a state of relaxation that never departed us for the duration of the weekend. Staff was very friendly and unpretentious, and we felt that they went the extra mile in appreciation for our loyalty to the Hilton chain. This was truly a luxurious weekend in a city that is in my opinion the best beach town near DC - along with Rehoboth Beach - for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Awesome Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: momofrose
Reviews.Content: This place was GREAT - the pools are amazing. There are many kids activities every day- the beach is beautiful. The suites are gorgeous - our view was amazing!! Everything is walking distance - grocery store, liquor store, crab shack etc - if you want to do the boardwalk - you can walk to the beginning but I recommend taking the shuttle to the other end - it is WAAAY too long to talk and that is where the "action" is. The staff was pleasant and VERY accomodating. The food was decent and not badly priced considering. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in OC”
Reviews.Author: Pixburgh
Reviews.Content: I can't brag enough about this place. The layout is awesome, staff was great, all of the amenities were first class. It was totally worth burning my Honors points :)

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamily3Ohio
Reviews.Content: Everything at the Hilton was wonderful! Our suite was spotless and we loved our ocean view! The elevators, fitness area, indoor and outdoor pool areas were spotless as well. The staff was courteous and helpful. The location was also great. Short walk to Jolly Rogers Amusement park and many restaurants, souvenier shops, etc. We didn't drive anywhere once we got there. We pretty much spent all of our time at the pools and on the beach....relaxing and enjoying the beauty of Ocean City. We'll definitely return and would most definitely recommend the Hilton! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Went above our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Traveln_Momma
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hilton Suites based on all the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. We had never been to O.C. before so we really didn't know where to stay, and I was a little hesitant to rent a house not knowing the location. Our experience was wonderful. The staff was courteous and helpful. Our room was on the top floor, overlooking the ocean. We had 2 queen beds in the bedroom area and there was a pullout sofa in the living room area, so both kids had their own beds-no fighting! The bathroom was large with granite counters, double sinks, and a whirlpool tub with a overhead 'rain" shower head. Great toiletries and fluffy towels restocked daily. My husband and I were able to enjoy breakfast on the balcony while the kids slept. (Starbucks in the lobby and a full kitchen in the room allowed us to enjoy some good coffee and our own breakfast while we read the paper). Our room was spotless each day. There were some days the room was cleaned later in the afternoon, but the housekeeper left a note for us at the start of our stay explaining that she takes care of rooms for check-in first, then comes to occupied rooms. She was very kind to work around our being in the room. The hotel has 3 pools: one indoor, and 2 outdoor. We didn't spend any time there because we could literally walk out of the lobby to the beach. Lots of families were staying there and on the beach-made for really enjoyable days. The hotel is about 5 blocks from the end of the boardwalk. We decided to walk the boardwalk the first night. It is about 5 miles rounds trip and most of the 'action" is at the other end. There is a tram that goes along the boardwalk. After that first night, we spoke to the concierge and we drove down to park closer to the other end. Not alot of night life around the hotel, but that was OK for us; we were looking for more of a family atmosphere. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but watch out for noise on first floor”
Reviews.Author: SaintLouisTraveller
