Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights, using Hilton points. This is a lovely place, a bit of an oasis in crowded Ocean City. The location is a few blocks north of the boardwalk, a quieter part of town away from the hustle and bustle. However, we were placed on the first floor (this is the assigned room location if you are using points) and there is a noise problem. Many times during the night (seemed to follow a regular pattern), we would hear a rather loud, high-pitched groaning noise that would last for several seconds-- enough to wake people up, although two of our three children slept through it. The maintenance guy told us this noise was from the "chillers" (related to the a/c) and nothing could be done except change rooms (he said the noise was only a problem on the "adult pool" side where we were). Even though I am a gold member and regularly asked the front desk, evidently due to the peak season, upgrades were not generally available. (The other problem with the first floor is there is only a limited view of the ocean). They did offer me lunch vouchers for the last day to help make up for the noisy location, but we would have much preferred a quiet room. So, especially as a Hilton gold member, I was at the end of the day somewhat unsatisfied with the experience. The other problem I'll mention is that the wireless connectivity (both in the lobby and room) was spotty and weak.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite OC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chelle695
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying this is by far the best hotel in all of Ocean City! I have stayed here over a dozen times in the past couple years. I am very picky about where I stay and it must be clean. This hotel is absolutely clean and very nice. The rooms are great. The hotel is all suites so you have a living room and dining table, kitchen, large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub/shower and double sinks, separate bedroom with a great balcony. Beds are very comfortable and has two large TVs and DVD players. All rooms have balconies right on the ocean. It has two pools, one with a play area with water slides and a lazy river for kids and the other pool has a swim up bar and oceanfront bar/restaurant. The pool area does get very crowded during peak season. There is also a very nice, large indoor pool for colder months. IT is close to the boardwalk. They have a great hospitality room if you arrive before checkin or wish to enjoy the beach/pool area after you have checked out that has showers, toilets and clean towels. I have been going to Ocean city since I was a child and have stayed at many many hotels and this one is by far the nicest! My only complaint about this hotel is the air conditioning. The room temperature does not go below 65 degrees and for most people that is cold enough but my fiance has a medical condition that he has to have it colder. During several stays the management was able to come up and override the temperature and make it cooler but after those couple of times we were told they are not able to do that and actually got quite nasty about it. Also, between late June and early September the rates are extremely high! I just recently checked for a weeknight stay in August and it was over $500 a night! The hotel is nice but not worth $500 a night! But then again all Ocean City hotels are highly priced during the summer months, even motels I wouldnt make my dog stay in so I am sure they are just keeping up with OC rates. In summary, I would highly recommend this hotel if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Hotel In Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: NYC-4lover
Reviews.Content: Traveled with husband, early teen daughter and one of her friends. The suites are wonderful, with a lovely bedroom, with balcony overlooking the ocean. The kitchen is between the bedroom & living area, that has a pullout sofa, that was very comfortable for our teens. Watching the sunrise every morning was a highlight and fabulous way to begin our day. The hotel is set up so that the teens are safe swimming, going to gaming room and meeting newly made friends in the evenings. The staff was outstanding and always there with a smile. We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NYConnieL
Reviews.Content: Even if it was 100 degrees we had a great time. Very clean and friendly. Because it was so hot it did not hurt that there was a pool bar. We were on the 6th floor overlooking the pools and the ocean. We saw dolphins jumping out in the ocean. Really enjoyed the full kitchen. There is a little deli/grocery right outside the door and a good breakfast place right across the street. Oh and by the way the bed and pillows are to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: billsinaz
Reviews.Content: This all suites, all ocean front property is perfect for a family getaway. Plenty of room to set up for the week and the kitchenette is a nice way to save a little money on meals (although we didn't use it). Parking was easy, location is away from the bustle of the boardwalk, but close enough. Great pools and beach access. Loved the balcony setup to just sit and listen to the waves. Only issue is price. Granted we went in high season, but it is a very expensive property. Thankfully, we cashed in some Hilton points for our 3 night stay. Overall, great property,

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hilton in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: bwimom
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for an overnight at the Hilton in Ocean City and wished we could have stayed longer. This is definitely the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at in OC and we have stayed in quite a few. We used Hilton points (50,000/night) which is really high, and I understand it is very pricey if you are paying cash, but the hotel has so many great amenities. I am not sure I would pay over $300/night for any hotel in Ocean City, but if I was going to, this would be the hotel I would pick. The hotel has two great pools, a bar and swim-up bar, really nice changing rooms that are available to you before your room is ready and after you check out, Starbucks in the lobby and a nice restaurant which we saw but did not eat in. It is located about 4 blocks from the top of the boardwalk in a nice quiet area. We stayed in a standard ocean front suite which had a living room area with a sofa bed then a little kitchen area and a door into a bedroom with two queen beds. The bathroom was very nice with a big jacuzzi bathtub. The bedroom area opens to an ocean front balcony. Our room was over the "adult" pool area. There are not enough lounge chairs for everyone in the hotel, so people tend to go out early and put towels on chairs to save them. This is pretty obnoxious, but we found ourselves doing it because we wouldn't have gotten a lounge chair by the pool otherwise. Most of the chairs are gone by 10AM, then they clear out as the day moves on. We really liked having the waitress service at the pool area. We were able to order lunch and drinks throughout the day without leaving the pool. As expected at a hotel, they were a little pricey, but not too expensive (Pina Colada $8, Hot Dog and Fries $7, Salad $10). Overall, the amenities and the location make the hotel great. I would definitely stay here again (with HHonors Points).

Reviews.Title: “High Price....But If You Use the Ammenties It Will Be Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: CJTRAVEL0709
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip with our 2yo and 4yo for a long Father's Day weekend with the grandparents. It was peak season prices and our first trip to Ocean City. It is very family oriented and there was lots of activities for the kids. Unfortunately it rained half our stay there but we were able to spend first two sunny days between the beach that was conveniently in front of our hotel and the pirate pool with slides that my boys loved! That was one of our best part of the stay to have the kids enjoy the pool so much! It was definitely better than paying the price of a water park. We were able to cook quick lunches and have breakfast with the nice kitchen suite (which saved us money - we only ate out one night for dinner)! Every day we ate our meals on the balcony overlooking the beach (that was priceless). The suites for the money is a little small but the beds were very comfortable. They are also very modern in design with granite counter tops in the spacious bathroom where the boys loved taking a bath in the deep spa jacuzzi after the beach and pool. Housekeeping did come late always after 3pm to clean up but did nice job to leave fresh towels. And don't forget to ask about their FREE laundry room (detergent available for free at the front desk) that was very nice and convenient! Overall, we would come back again....but I would definitely have to wait for a discounted price or come on off season.

Reviews.Title: “I spent how much??!!”
Reviews.Author: angellibra81
Reviews.Content: I have never felt so ripped off. Free parking was the best thing about my stay. I understand check-in is at 3pm, but arriving at 11 I expected for my room to be ready quicker than 2:30! We were able to use amenities while a bell hop held our luggage. Pool is not big! Great beach location but umbrellas and chairs are not supplied so get ready to spend 30 bucks for two people if you don't have your own. Incredibly family friendly. Great location for kids with amusement parks and mini golfing all around. Good restaurants are in West Ocean City which is a 10 min drive away. Boardwalk is about a 20 block walk. If you drive, be willing to spend to park in a lot or walk 3 blocks. Beware of wet floors in hallways and elevators. Almost fell a few times. Maid service didn't clean our rooms once and when I finally caught her in the AM and asked if she could take care of it while I went to the beach she said sure. I came back at 3pm and it still wasn't done! A spider was crawling behind my bed and the dust behind the nightstand and carpet was wild. I'm not picky, but for the amount I paid I expected top-notch, quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, location great if looking for quieter area, expensive but suites/ammenities worth it.”
Reviews.Author: MCZAR1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights over a weekend. I liked the location because it is just north of the boardwalk so away form the busy boardwalk scene. Staff is very frindely. Room was ready right at 3PM but there are places to change and swim if you want. The suite is superb and very spacious. We had two rooms on the same floor since they do not have adjoining rooms. This was not a big deal. The kitchen is great and comes with all the necessary utensils, pots, pans and even a cork screw. Bathroom is large, with combination shower/tub and whirlpool. There are 2 TVs so one can watch TV in the living room area while some one else can be assleep in the bedroom. Bed mattress are a little soft so that took a night to get used to esp on my back. There are 2 outdoor pools, one for children and one for adults. there is also an indoor pool open until mignight.. There is a nice outdoor bar/lounge area but unfortunately is only open until around 5:30PM even in the summer time. The indoor bar/longe is nice but very quiet. We had breakfast in the hotel restaraunt called 32 palm. You have option of ordering from the menu or going with the buffet for $18.95 . I liked the buffet but interestingly it did not include tea or coffee which was extra. This makes no sense to me and should be changed. We did eat dinner in the restaraunt and it was just average food with average service so I would not recommend it as their are better restaraunts in Ocean City. Acroos the street from the hotel is an amusement park and also a few minature golf courses within 2-3 bloocks. There are also activities for children at the hotel but they generally last much less than the posted times. My summary is that the hotel is superb, with very spacious suites all facing the ocean and with balconies. Access to the ocean is great since they are right next to the beach. I like the location, away from the busy boardwalk. It is expensive but in my opinion worth the price. All of the staff was very personable,outoging and friendly. Defintely good for families. There are several parking lots which guest can use for free including one that is a covered garage that is behind the fornt of the hotel. It fills up quickly since only one level and it seems everyone wants to park there. I would definitely return there for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price: Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: EllKell
Reviews.Content: The suite was fantastic: Bedroom with large TV, soft sheets, wonderful view of the ocean, beach and two pools below. Furnishings seemed new. Controllable thermostat. Equipped kitchen with blender, toaster, wine opener, dishwasher detergent, sponges, everything you need. Triangular jacuzzi tub comfy for two: used bubblebath. Two sinks. Living room with fan, dining table, sofa, big flat screen TV. Maid service twice daily: tip them. Good food in restaurant except for brunch (tasteless, poor quality food costs $10 over the breakfast coupon you get), friendly bartenders. One outdoor pool with kids' activities: fountains, long slide, running river with no tubes, tepid jacuzzi. Other outdoor pool billed as adult is NOT adult: Kids in pool. Pool bar drinks splashed with pool water by ball-throwing tikes. The beautiful atrium indoor pool is perfect for lap swimming. Rent chaise lounges and umbrellas on the beach or bring your own gear. Parking is close to the beach. The boardwalk is 5 blocks away. We enjoyed Fager's Island at 59th St on the bay: fun, indoor and outdoor restaurant/bars with pier, sunset, sand and palm trees, great staff, wonderful food, upscale crowd. Not cheap, but this is a luxury vaca, right?

Reviews.Title: “Another awesome trip at the hilton”
Reviews.Author: Marylandmama
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best hotel in Ocean City-- but very expensive during peak periods. Fortunately as a hilton gold member I got two free nights, so that was great. Pool is family friendly, beach is right there, jolly rogers amusement park, seacrets, and a bunch of other stuff closeby. Great housekeeping, comfy suites, good service. Another winner of a stay at the Hilton Ocean City Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: JAML65
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at the Ocean City Hilton Hotel. It is by far the priciest of the hotels along the beach front strip. It cost my family $500/night not including taxes. The view from the room is tremendous, but I was dismayed by the frayed furniture throughout the hotel room and the hotel as well. The game room sucked - a tiny room with about 10 games for the kids - half of which were broken. I would think that a hotel that got 4 stars and is supposed to be fairly new would look better. The staff was all young and not at all polished and the food at the brunch was awful - not even close to being 4 star food. Luckily we only ate at the hotel restaurant once so we did not suffer too much. The location is wonderful with a Jolly Rogers theme park right across the street - boardwalk is just a few blocks from the hotel, but you must know that the really active part of the boardwalk is a good 30 blocks down. It's a pleasant walk and we were able to do it even with two kids in tow. All in all I would give Hilton 2 1/2 stars, but not 4 - no way. The pool needed work, the food was awful and the staff, even though nice enough, were not 4 star polished. I just expect more for $500 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keys_on_the_Brain
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel HH points a week prior to our trip so I didn't research like I normaly would have. When we arrived it was one pleasant suprise after another. The room was large with a full kitchen that had everything you would need including a blender. The bath had a jetted tub big enough for two. An balcony with an ocean view and a table with comfotable seating for four perfect for enjoing a quiet meal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: SFMMaryland
Reviews.Content: We were surprised when we saw our suite. It was clean, bright, and large. The oceanfront terrace is wonderful. The shower was amazing...We had such a good time that we extended our stay. Every employee we came in contact with was polite, friendly, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL / GHOST TOWN AFTER 5 PM”
Reviews.Author: Donna9246
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the staff are extreamly pleasant. The rooms are clean but appear larger in the photos. The pool bar was great for afternoon drinks in the pool. There are waiters to take your drink and food orders by the pool and they were all very nice. Overall, the stay was great. I would like to mention that the pool bar/outside restaurant close at 5PM. Therefore, it becomes a ghost town. Everyone leaves and you are own your own to find entertainment for the evening. It was very disappointing not to have the bar open and to be able to hang out at the hotel a little longer. We could never return with our teenagers because they enjoy staying at the Golden Sands in Ocean City. There they have a large deck with shops, icecream, arcade, etc., and the tiki bar stays open for food and drinks while enjoying the outdoors into later hours of the evening. One other thing .... there are no carts available for you to carry your suitcases, food, etc to your room. You must use concierge/bellman service. Only the bellman is permitted to use the carts. Some like that but we prefer to do this ourselves. So, it was very inconvenient to make 3-4 trips to and from the car for check-in and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: T0ughbutfair
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing family vacation here the first week of June. Location and view are unbelievable. Staff was very courteous and helpful. The kids pool was the highlight of our stay. We have a 1 yr old and 3 yr old and they were very entertained. It worked out well that we came prior to the end of the school year, so the bigger kids weren't in the kid pool. The room was spacious. Bathroom was beautiful. Kitchen could use an update, but functioned perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok .. not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: AK1234Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: Wanted to take our 3 year old swimming as he had loads of fun with his new floaties a couple of months back when we were visiting Thailand. Saw pictures of the pool on Hilton's website and figured it looked pretty decent and was worth a shot, especially since the Hotel seemed to be sold out on almost every weekend and it was listed as the top most category 7 on Hilton's site . Booked the weekend of June 16 (Fri and Sat night). Stayed here using Hilton award certificates that I got for free as a promotion in Q4 2010 when I was on company travel so glad I didn't burn up my precious Hilton points as a Category 7 is 50K points a night. I know pictures always look more appealing but this was actually quite disappointing for a Category 7. I know it's right on the beach and in a popular town (even though it's about 30 blocks from the heart of the boardwalk), but a Category 7 rating for the Hotel itself is quite flattering (a 5 would be more appropriate) especially when you compare to the Hilton's of Hawaii (Waikoloa or Honolulu) that are of the same rating. Guess though all oceanfront properties have been upgraded to this category, but parts of the hotel should reflect the quality too. So here's the scoop Check-in -------------- - The girl that checked me in (maybe she was new) didn't really know how to handle my award reservation and called over the manager when I handed over my printed reward certificates. - Manager was actually quite nice. Didn't get an upgrade to a King suite (got two beds - was told they were Queen, but think they were fulls) but did get a room away from the elevator - One good thing as a Diamond member was that they gave all the perks - usually some hotels either give you bonus points or breakfast coupons or a room upgrade, but manager told me that they give all (since this was a reward stay I just wanted the breakfast). - Hotel has free internet which is a nice added benefit. Usually hotels like to stick you with a wifi charge, but thought this was decent though not sure how many people bring their laptops to Ocean City (but it is neat if you have an iPhone or similar smart phone that you can use) - Free water (a nice big Pellegrino) bottle along with a couple of small packets of Milano cookies comes to your room with the nightly turn down service Hotel pools ---------------- - There are actually three pools (a outdoor kiddie pool, an outdoor adult pool and an indoor family pool). The outdoor pools are actually on the 2nd floor (or 1st floor if you account for a ground floor which there is at the hotel, i.e. not at street level). Guessing this is to alleviate any risk of flooding and damage to the property since it's right on the beach. - Only went to the outdoor kiddie pool, but the adult pool has a swim up bar (nothing spectacular in terms of design/layout but just a lowered bar that is on the edge of one side of a rectangular pool). - The two outdoor pools are separated by a walkway that runs through and has stairs going down to the beach (there is a rudimentary hose there to wash yourself off before you come back up). There is also a rectangular hot tub on the far side of the kiddie pool. - Only the kiddie pool has somewhat of an imaginative design to it. There are also some fake palm trees to add some color but easy to make out they're fake since the tops are black. - There are two slides in the kiddie pool - a short one for the little ones and a bigger kind of curved "L" shaped white slide. The small side is nice for toddlers and while the bigger slide is more fun it probably needs to be upgraded as it looks a bit old and kind of sticks out (would be nicer if they had some hardscaping instead of just sticking out a piece of plastic tubing over the pool). - So while the kiddie pool has some design, it is usually always crowded since most people staying here bring their families. - Also there is a bit of a current going in a clockwise direction at the right end of the pool so if you have a little one be careful or you might find them getting pulled away towards the exit of the big slide! - My rating of the kiddie pool was 6/10. Basic enough but nothing special. Hotel Rooms ------------------- - Good thing about the rooms is that they are all suites with a separate albeit small living room with a couch and chair, a coffee table, a small round dining table and a separate TV, so it's big enough for a family of 4. - I expected the bedroom to be a bit bigger, but the other good thing about the rooms is that they are they are all ocean facing with a decent sized private balcony with a small round table and chairs overlooking the pool area . - Room includes a fully equipped kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, cooking range and dishware with pots and silverware if you're bringing food or get takeout - Bathroom is quite decent with two separate sinks and I believe they all have a jacuzzi which was fun for our 3 year old when it rained on one of the mornings. Wierd thing is that it is a jucuzzi/shower so you stand in the triangular jacuzzi if you need to take a shower which is firmly fixed to the ceiling and not very powerful (or warm) in my opinion - the hot/cold lever takes a little fiddling to get the temparature you need but I lost my patience and settled for what it would give me. Wierd thing is that it is a jucuzzi/shower so you stand in the triangular jacuzzi if you need to take a shower which is firmly fixed to the ceiling and not very powerful (or warm) in my opinion - the hot/cold lever takes a little fiddling to get the temparature you need but I lost my patience and settled for what it would give me. Restaurant ---------------- - Possibly one of the most disorganized hotel restaurants (esp for a Cat 7) that I've been to (only went for breakfast). - Used our free breakfast coupons (which was for continental breakfast worth $9 - i.e. breads, pastries, cereal), but upgraded to the full hot breakfast on the 1st day for an additional $10. Spread is standard and there is a made to order Omlette station with a lady that has her tip plate blatantly right out in front with likely some of her own cash - Beware though this restaurant has some really funny policies with regards to the breakfast to try to nickle and dime you. Apparently, if you get the full buffet ($20 if you're paying full price), juice is included but coffee/tea is not included (you have to pay for that separately)!!! But if you get the continental breakfast, which we did the 2nd day, it includes coffee/tea but not juice or fruit (again you have to pay for those separately), which I declined since I was irked - They also have a bunch of foreign summer students working at the hotel restaurant and not professional employees so things were forgotten at times and staff had to be reminded more than once. Not to mention they are not properly organized so half the time they are scurrying around and don't get to your table for a while. - Seriously think the catering/restaurant needs an overhaul .. might just have to put a call into Hilton (but don't think anything will happen since this location is a franchisee) Check-out -------------- - Check out is at 11am, though hotels have a tendency of pushing the checkout time up in busy places such as this, even if they're not full. Even so they really give you an extra hour (i.e. until 12) to give people enough time to checkout (was told they keys would work until 12). - So when asked for a late checkout they politely turned down due to the above reason that they are full (which I think was the standard response even though I could tell they were not). - However the plus is that they let you use the facilities, including the pool after you check out and was offered the use of a common changing room/shower on their main floor (which actually looked quite decent even though we didn't get to use it due to the weather and instead headed out to the boardwalk) - Other good thing is that parking at the hotel is free. Was a pleasant surprise given how crowded OC gets. In addition to the outdoor parking lot surrounding the hotel, they have a single storey covered garage at the back (both of which get full by late evening), and in fact even have an additional overflow uncovered lot across the street solely for hotel guests. All in all the experience was ok. Only reason we came was for the pool for our little one, that it was a 3 hour drive from where we live in Jersey, and I had some free stay certificates. Likely won't stay here in the near future unless I get some certificates again (if I had to use points or cash would rather find a bargain airfare to Florida and go camp at the Embassy Suites Deerfield Beach that has a better feel to it even if it does only have one outdoor pool)!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sladerer
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Father's Day weekend. Original reservation made with points for Sat/Sun night, then added a separate Friday night reservation at the standard room rate when it became available. The manager arranged for the stay to be in one room prior to our arrival, so all that was needed was get new keys - no room switch required. It would have been nice to be contacted about this as Friday night was in an accessible room and our Sat/Sun reservation was not, but the intent and consideration was appreciated. The hotel was clean, bright and well maintained. Two outdoor pools between the lobby and the beach were very clean. The hot tub could have been a little warmer but it was a cooler/overcast day and it would have been nice if the pool bar had reopened after the rain stopped. The kids enjoyed the game room. The lobby was very open with a coffee/danish stand. All staff we interacted with were professional and friendly. I do have one safety concern as we were let into the room without needing to provide ID either at the desk or at the room. This includes a valet who happened to be in the hall one time and someone at the front desk on a different occasion (long story on why this was needed). The room itself was clean, well maintained and nice appointed. The balcony looked over the beach/ocean with a nice table and chair set, the kitchen was small but had everything we needed, and the bathroom was spacious (it was an accessible room). My only room complaint is a general pet peeve of mine - I'm quite tired of checking into hotels that advertise two queen beds and finding them smaller than standard queens, the infamous "hotel" queen. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels and slept in everything from a single to a cal king - please don't call these beds Queens. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would consider staying there again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: DierdraH
Reviews.Content: I love love this hotel!! Everything about it! The staff was friendly, the room was clean, magnificent view! We ate lunch out at the little bar area beside the pool for lunch one day, the food was not very good nor were the drinks we ordered, but other than that, it was a wonderful stay and I cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in OC, but not overly impressed.”
Reviews.Author: hollyandbitsy
Reviews.Content: My husband grew up vacationing at OC but I had never been. Looking at the pictures online it appears to be a glamorous, well-appointed island with extravagant hotels and pools. WRONG. This is a run down, (think 1950's in it's prime) place, filled, and i mean FILLED with 16-18 year olds. Without exaggerating, I'd guess that 70%-80% of the crowd is 18 or under. We are in our early 30's and felt like senior citizens. With that said, after driving around and walking around, we found that the Hilton is certainly the nicest and cleanest 'looking' hotel. The rooms are good sized with everything you need (if you don't see it, ask. they have laundry detergent and the more costly items at the front desk for free upon request). I would not say the staff is helpful or interested in their jobs. The majority of the staff at Manana Mode (pool bar), front desk, and bell service, are under 21 and are just looking for summer employment. They are here for socializing and enjoying the sun, while getting paid, of course! Do not expect a full-service, high class facility like the ones in the islands or NYC. This is just a place to stay to see some sand and waves with cleanliness and serenity (opposed to the boardwalk) and the price seems to be very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: 409KarenH
Reviews.Content: The staff go out of there way to make your stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed frequent guest”
Reviews.Author: hawkmp
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short. 3 calls to front desk to get my requests upon arrival which finally arrived 9pm. High floor request stopped at 4th floor. Room was clean but looked beat up and unpleasant (aged, in need of renovation). Cold pools and when I called from children's pool while my 3 yr old shivered, girl that answered the phone yelled out "which one" and hung up on me after she said engineering will look into it. Beds were still comfortable, houskeeping and bell staff was friendly. Bar staff and waitresses ignored me (except for bartender at the adult swim up pool bar) We are giving the holiday inn on 17th a try on our next trip in June. Sad to say Hilton oc fell below our expectations this time.

Reviews.Title: “We've come back for years... but maybe never again!”
Reviews.Author: ngfoundas
Reviews.Content: We have been loyal Hilton customers for years, and have stayed at the Hilton Suites in Ocean City, Md several times... this year, we arrived for a much needed vacation to be faced with disappointment and frustration. We were welcomed in our room by broken glass on the floor. Thirty minutes and two phone calls later, housekeeping was ...sent to vacuum, but I was very put off by the lack of concern or apology from management... Then we were basically kicked out of the pool rather abruptly at 6pm... only to be told by the obviously inexperienced staff that they're not "fully rolled out" for the season. I"m sorry, isn't Memorial Day pretty much the official start of summer? So, wouldn't any respectable hotel be ready to go - all amenities prepared and staffed, at that point? So because I choose to take a vacation early in the summer, I'm treated like a second-class guest? How is it okay that the amenities that draw us to this hotel become unavailable to us with no forewarning? It's very disappointing and I now realize that the love affair we've had for this hotel... well, let's just say the honeymoon is clearly over.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtashley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial day weekend, and while crowded, we thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. Everything was clean and the staff were friendly. Great location, beach out front is nice. Kids loved the pool area. Free parking and internet were nice (albeit the room prices were high). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So thankful for this nice OC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mach77
Reviews.Content: After checking out many places online, we finally booked at the Hilton because we felt we could expect a certain level of quality and cleanliness from a large corporate chain. We were not disappointed! Really nothing bad to say about the hotel. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - Enjoyed the room and balcony”
Reviews.Author: BabsMansfield
Reviews.Content: Just came back after 3 nights at the Hilton. This was our first time and we were quite pleased with the location and rooms. We were on the 6th floor and had a great view of the ocean and pools. Enjoyed sitting on the balcony and looking at the ocean and hearing the waves. We used the kitchen for breakfast. By using the kitchen we weren't rushed to go out and eat breakfast. We used the jacuzzi and pools. My only complaint was the cleaning room service. Coming back from the beach or pool and finding the room not cleaned at 4:30 or 5:00 PM was disappointing when we wanted to take showers and change and not being able to find the maid for clean towels. It was an inconvenient time to wait for the room to be cleaned. This is the only area where the hotel needs improvement. Otherwise, I will probably stay at this hotel again for a mini vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Vikes54
Reviews.Content: We had scheduled a business in Ocean City and Chose the Hilton as my wife is a preferred member of the Hilton family. We were so happy we did. The over sized rooms are great with beautiful views of the beach and pool. We were sad we had to leave because we have so much work to do. The pool areas are great with 3 to choose from. We will plan on coming back to this site for our beach vacation. Oh, our dinner in the restaurant was terrific! The room service menu was nice too!

Reviews.Title: “not so nice the second time”
Reviews.Author: millertime51207
Reviews.Content: my husband and i visited the hilton last year it was soo great we added 2more days! sadly this year, it was awful from the start! the 1st room the put us in was on the 6th floor, when we got off the evel, it smelled like smoke so bad. we ask for NON SMOKING! when we go to the room the chair in the bed room was so stained up i was scared to touch it. the room stunk, the shower wasnt clean, the was sticky stuff on the outside of the fridg, and nside. my husband went down and told them of the problem, they gave us a breakfest vouchers. we was staying at the hotel from may 10-18th. after about an hour they finally moved us to a diff room, this one smelled better, altho the bathroom shwr heads looked like they hadnt been cleaned in some time!, they came up and cleaned them. later i went to get in the shower, and turned the water on only to find that the glass on the shower was so caked with soap scum, i couldnt see out! my husband goes down, and tells them the mang had an attitude, with him, saying the cleaning are there this late at night!, once that was worked out, the mangr gave us lunch vouchers. on the 13th our 7yr old son joined us. we pulled the bed outta the couch so unconftble! it was like i slide into the couch! i made the bed up for my son, there was 2 flat pillows, in the bag of blankets/sheets, my husband went down and ask for 2x pillows, rudely rhe guy said "well did you check in the closet" yes we did, we just need 2x pillows for our son so he dont fall off or in the hole, with a bother voice the guys says ill have someone bring them up. about 10mins later, theres a knock on the door, a guy standn there with 2pillows, hands them to my husband, and walks away! like he was too busy to help us! ok so now i have the 2 pillows but no pillow cases! i gave up askn for help from them! so the pillows sat in the chair never used! we went and bough 2 pillows and cases! i was upset with all the stuff that went wrong from the start! so i sat in the room and emailed the person that came up on the hilton site. this lady called the next morning, my husband talked with her. she too the price down on one of the nites we was there. ok thanks. i wasnt asking for free food, or free stay, i just wanted what we paid for! and service that was friendly! not bothered by us asking for asst. our trip was ruined before it started! with the smelly dirty room. and then the staff just followed! our 1st stay last year was nothing like this! it was great! thats why we went back! next year we will not be going back! for the price of the room, we coulda stayed at home, and not been treated so poorly. we felt very unwanted at the hilton! oh yeah! the cleaning lady, she was great, but it was always late when she got there! one time it was after 5 when she got there! very disappointed!!!! it was a very long 8days!! we was ready to go home before it was time!

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Money in the Off-Season”
Reviews.Author: joePM
Reviews.Content: I travel a fair amount, for work and for pleasure, and if there's one thing I've learned, it's that nothing's ever perfect. What matters is how a hotel deals with those imperfections -- and how you deal with them yourself. This trip was our second to Ocean City, and our second to this Hilton. Last year, we arrived to find the room we requested not available. After a bit of waiting, the on-duty manager went above and beyond to compensate us, not only juggling things so that we could get the room we requested, but also compensating us with free breakfast for the length of our stay. After service like that, the Hilton was atop our list when we returned to OC this year. (We came slightly later this time, to see if we could find the sweet spot where the temps are warm and most businesses are open, but the crowds still haven't arrived. Alas, the first week of May isn't it. The weather was spotty and many establishments were still shuttered. Next time we'll aim for the middle of May. Anyway...) We checked in quickly and found the room -- a Terrace Suite on the top floor of the hotel -- exactly as we'd hoped: clean, available, and with everything apparently in working order. We dashed off to Anthony's on the corner to pick up beer and wine before my wife's parents arrived to join us for the one evening, had an utterly awful meal down by the Inlet (Harrison's Harbor Watch...no thanks) and came back to turn in for the night. That's when we discovered the first problem: The outdoor jacuzzi, which is the main thing that differentiates the Terrace Suites from the standard room, was nonfunctional. I called down to the desk immediately, and they assured us they'd send someone up in the morning to take care of it. (It was late enough that we wouldn't have wanted to wait up for maintenance anyway.) Unfortunately, the next morning we discovered problem number two: The water in our room didn't work. At all. Called down to the desk again and was informed by a very apologetic staff member that a water pump in the building had failed and they were working on it. Within an hour or so the water was back -- the only trouble was, due to the delay in not being able to shower, we had missed the window for breakfast at the in-house restaurant. Now, here's the thing about stuff like this: It happens. No hotel can keep a perfect eye on the functionality of every item in the room, and no hotel can predict something like a pump failure. The important thing is what they do about it. And what they did about it was absolutely perfect. My father-in-law spoke briefly with the manager, who immediately gave us a $70 credit (the difference between the Terrace Suite and the regular room) and gave my in-laws a $50 credit to compensate us all for having missed breakfast. And by the time we came back to our room that afternoon, the hot tub was working perfectly. This is service. And all it took was a polite (that is the key word, though: *polite*) statement of the situation and a reasonable request for compensation. Of course, the best service in the world probably wouldn't have drawn us back if the hotel itself weren't excellent. But it is: The rooms are spotless, the views spectacular. The in-suite kitchens are fully equipped. (Full plateware and servingware, pots and pans, microwave, range, oven, dishwasher, blender, small coffee maker -- though bring your own filters if you want something other than the mediocre house pouches -- wine glasses, cutting board. Pretty much everything. Oh, except ice trays; bring your own or plan to buy or fetch ice.) The location is great if you want to be near -- but not on -- the bustle of the boardwalk. Sure, there could be more quality restaurants and bars in walking distance. Sure, the outdoor furniture could be of better quality. But there's really very little worth complaining about with this fine establishment. One note about rooms, though: Rooms on the 4th floor and below get both light and noise from the pool area; if you're looking forward to gazing at the stars and listening to the waves, ask for a higher floor. Also, the Corner Suites (where we stayed last year) are excellent, but avoid the ones on the north end of the hotel; they look out to an ugly property next door, while the south-facing rooms offer a much nicer view. And finally, about the Terrace Suite itself, I would definitely stay there again. However, be aware that the room itself is no bigger than the regular rooms; you're paying extra for the open terrace that adjoins your balcony -- and the jacuzzi, of course. (Which, in case you're wondering, is screened but not completely private due to points-of-view from the hotel and floors above.) That may not sound like much, but the addition of lounge chairs and sunshine made the room even more comfortable than the Corner Suites. Do note that these rooms also face north, but since they start on the 6th floor (possibly higher), the ugly hotel next door is much less of a problem. Still, I'd recommend asking for as high a floor as you can get. Finally, a few notes about dining options in the immediate area: First, room service: Though all we've had was breakfast, it's been excellent every time -- far above what I've come to expect from room-service breakfast, at a shockingly low $9.50 for the full "American." As mentioned, Anthony's is a great place for beer and wine (found a rare favorite wine of ours there!) and also offers deli sandwiches, deli meats and a fair selection of cheeses if you're looking for something to go with your wines. In the same plaza as Anthony's is OC Wasabi, a small but excellent sushi restaurant. We've dined there twice now and both meals were quite good -- not the best sushi I've ever had, but reasonably priced and quite authentic. South a bit on the main drag is Coins Pub and Mother's Cantina. We found both of these to be satisfying for what they were, but nothing remotely exceptional. Similar sentiments can be said for Happy Jack Pancake House, just a bit south of the above. The pancakes were somewhat above average, but everything else was entirely mediocre. A short drive north is Horizons at the Clarion, which was, in a word, gross. Not the food -- the food was fine...or at least it was after I sent back my inedible hockey puck filet and its accompanying slimy lobster tail. (To be clear and to be fair, the replacements were really quite excellent, and my wife enjoyed most of her meal.) But the place was simply disgustingly dirty, and I'm not the type to normally notice such things. We sat by the window, which should have been a great view over the ocean, but instead I found myself distracted by splatters of what I fervently hope was Alfredo sauce covering a good portion of the floor-to-ceiling window. Ew. One other dining note: Closer to the hotel but still north is Reflections, which is a charmingly over-the-top fine-dining place festooned with brick, brass, and statuary. Expensive, but worth it if you want to have a special night out like they did in the mid-'80s. Great food, solid wine list, and just a great ambiance. And I believe I've gone on for long enough. tl;dr: Hilton good. Location good. Problems bad, solutions good.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent reservations --rude office manager”
Reviews.Author: mruddell1
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights by calling the hotel directly. I needed to adjust the reservation to one night for both rooms and called Hilton's 800 number to make the change. I was told the change was made and the reservation number would remain the same. No follow up confirmation was sent to me. When I arrived at the hotel, I was told I was considered a no show as I did not check in on Friday. I advised the front desk clerk I had changed my reservation to one night for Saturday. The clerk said their system did not show this change. I asked to speak to the manager and explained what happened. She told me unless I could provide "proof" of the change, she could not make any changes as they had a two night minimum. I asked to speak to her corporate office and she handed me a card with an 800 number on it. It took me over an hour to get to the right person--a Ms Celeste Willis--who saw that my reservation should have been changed but was not. She then spent an hour on the phone with the manager of the hotel getting her to credit me back for one night's stay. The manager was rude and did nothing to confirm my story, It took her a very long time to adjust my account. All in all we spent several hours of our vacation handling what was Hilton's mistake. After the manager knew it was their mistake she did not do anything to make things better for me. Offering a free drink in the bar would have been nice or a free coffee at Starbucks in the lobby would have been appropriate. I lost several hours of my vacation time while standing at the front desk waiting for the manager to make the appropriate adjustments to my bill. Suffice it to say I will not stay at the Hilton again. This was our first time stay as we travel quite a bit and had heard good things about the property.

Reviews.Title: “great luxurt hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baltobchgrl
Reviews.Content: Watched the sunrise and the dolphins from the balcony , then watched the surfers and had coffee on the sunny oceanfront balcony sitting at thetable and chairs. Had a wonderful time at this four star hotel. It is super clean, The staff is super friendly. Huge rooms. A sitting room with couch, TV, table and WiFi. A full clean kitche area with dishes and silver ware and full size refrigerator. Separate bedroom with Two double beds, flat screen tv and full size bathroom. I do agree with other postings, the tub is really high because of the jacuzzi tub, which is very nice.Use caution getting in and out of shower. A lighter, magnified mirror in the bathroom :) Crabtree & Evelynn toiletries. Comfortable beds, comfrotable rooms and super clean.Stayed on 4th floor at end. very quiet. The Fitness Center is top of the line and the pool l ooked very nice. Did not use the bar/restaurant. One complaint is the bright pool lights that are on all night, very bright and contribute big time to light pollution.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean Front...”
Reviews.Author: BentonErinMike
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and both times we have been very happy with the hotel. This time the hotel was extremely crowded and we were not able to get any upgrades with our points which was alittle disappointing. The food is very good for a hotel and the prices are pretty close to what you would pay at an off-site eatery. Being right on the beach, free parking and having a fresh basket of fruit to pick from each day are all added bonuses!

Reviews.Title: “Poop in the pool. Overrated just because it's new...”
Reviews.Author: BigSasquatch
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Nice view. But, for this time of year, you would think service would be top notch since they aren't busy. Poop in the pool. You read right. We were in the pool for only an hour when a worker asked everyone to get out as there was poop in the pool. I will post a pic. I know kids do that, but there was no supervision, no one telling the parents there that the babies had to have on swimmies. Kids diving. It's only 4ft. I had my kids with me so it's not like I hate kids.... Then, our room was never cleaned. We walked out at 11am and saw the maid who said we were "next". 6pm they knock on the door! Really? When we are getting ready for dinner? We decided to book the holiday inn suites instead for the rest of our trip. It's identical and cheaper. The staff at holiday inn even said they had the same designer. I heard guests there telling others checking in how nice it was. The clincher? It doesn't matter if you have a Hilton honors club card. It gets you nothing. We didn't get the extra pillows we requested and we were denuded late checkout, even though the Honors site says you get it. Note - we only wanted late checkout of one extra hour to help us transfer over to the holiday inn. Not to "enjoy" this hotel any longer. Stay at the holiday in or rent a condo instead. To bad they ruin a nice hotel with such poor service.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the total package!”
Reviews.Author: Blessed_Lady0519
Reviews.Content: We (husband, 10 year old, 13 year old and me) stayed at the Hilton Ocean City Oceanfront 19 April -21 April. We were told the hotel was 100% booked, but a bellman was waiting in the parking lot to take our luggage, check-in took about 5 minutes and our room was ready when we arrived. We went up and immediately opened the sliding glass door - and we never closed it (while we were in the room of course LOL!)! We slept to the sounds of the waves and listened all day while we were inside. Our girls enjoyed their time on the beach, then came inside and played in the indoor pool, which was warm enough to fight off the chill from the ocean, but not steamy. Then we all went back out to the beach for a nighttime stroll. We ate in the restaurant on site (the cream of crab soup was DIVINE!) for dinner the first night and had enough left over for lunch the next day. We also had breakfast there the next morning. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean and we loved the rainfall shower head. We used the kitchen for snacks and lunch and every utensil we needed was there. We brought the new Harry Potter movie with us and snuggled up and watched that our last night there on the DVD player in the room. Overall, this was a magnificent, relaxing, no-stress experience! We will definitely be back and highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “For the most part, the stay was decent.”
Reviews.Author: RoxanneNY
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fully booked but we were able to get to our room by check-in. Many had to wait and you can see they were annoyed. I hope they were able to check out late since they had to check in late. Anyway, rooms were clean, staff friendly, parking easy, restaurant on site and decent. Used the gym and pool and both met my expectations. My only issue was that my room did not get cleaned until after 5:30pm after I complained. Also, the windows thru-out the hotel was dirty. It was disappointing. On a beautiful day, you had to look thru dirty windows to enjoy the view. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “sad to leave”
Reviews.Author: beach309
Reviews.Content: stayed for spring break with 2 kids. THE PERFECT VACATION ! We hit a few warm days before the rain which made the trip even better. We try to take an early vacation because we cannot afford the peak rates in the summer. This is the only place I will stay. I sleep better than my own home with the waves at night, very relaxing. We left the sliding door open every night. The room is always great.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every single penny”
Reviews.Author: Anechkaa
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel, we relied on Trip Advisor that rated this hotel as #1 in Ocean City, MD and we were not disappointed. From the moment we walked into the lobby and were greeted by the staff we knew we would love it. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was impeccably clean and the view from the balcony was breathtaking. Everything about our Suite was (with a lack of a better word) PERFECT. We also had room service breakfast, it was on a pricy side, but absolutely worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: LN87
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. The front desk was very polite/helpful. The room was spacious and clean. The picutres on the webiste were true to our experience. LOVED the private balcony. We kept the patio door open all night and slept to the sound of the ocean waves--very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Property on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in the off season - almost thought I was the only one at the hotel! The rooms are huge with lots of amenities. Lots of lights too - can't remember staying in a hotel that has so many lights - five switched in the bathroom alone. The restaurant was fantastic. In fact, I had the best Prime Rib I have ever had there. Great breakfast buffet in the morning as well with an omelette station. The inside pool was relaxing and the onsite gym was well equipped. The business center offered computers and printers. Wi-Fi was slow but at least it was free! One thing I didn't care for was the shower/jacuzzi tub in my room - really high sided tub that you have to practically vault over to get in. There are grab bars but if you have any trouble getting in or out of a tub, you should consider asking for an accessible room.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, relaxing stay - wish the stay was longer”
Reviews.Author: ticky v
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. We loved the suites. They were comfortable and practical. When we checked in, we notice a lot of kids (due to a cheerleader competition at the convention center), so we were afraid it might be too loud and messy. We were wrong. Couldn't here a thing when we were inside our room and the hotel was still neat and clean despite the activity. Room service was quick and the food was good. The front desk / guest services was friendly and helpful. Check in/out was a breeze!! Wish it was on the boardwalk, but it was close enough. We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “great ammenities, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: milltown
Reviews.Content: great hotel at weekday rates in winter! heated pool large enough to swim laps, small but well equipped gym. suite was on the 10th flloor...........a bedroom, balcony, kitchen with fridge, dishwasher, micro and fullsize stove and a separate living room, TV in living room and another in the bedroom. One caveat, not much open as far as restaurants in OC in winter, so call ahead if you have a favorite.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: sunflwrst
Reviews.Content: This was a quick weekend getaway since we lived in northern VA and got an off-season rate. The suite was spacious and clean..we stayed on the 12th floor (by request) and took some getting used to..really high up! But the view was phenomenal...the balcony was completely private...we ended up staying an extra day and would have stayed longer if rain had not moved in :( ...walking the beach Boardwalk was nice and good exercise since the hotel was not right next to it--which was fine since we preferred the quiet and privacy. The rates were great since they were gearing up for the summer season...scrubbing out the kiddie pool and the adult pool was still a little cool for that time of year....we drove down to Rehobeth Beach to look around --was glad we stayed in Ocean City. Less crowded too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtk123skl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Beautiful views! The suite set up made it perfect for our young family. The children could nap or go down for bed early, while my wife and I could stay up and enjoy some wine and late night movies! The location right on the beach is fantastic, which is also ideal for a young family with lots of supplies to tote to the beach! The kids (ages 3 and 1.5) loved the kiddie pool and the amusement park nearby. Everything was within walking distance. We could not have been happier and definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ArcheryFamily-NJ
Reviews.Content: Loved our suite -- living room with sofa (sofabed) and chair, round dining table with four chairs, full kitchen, bath with whirlpool tub and double sink, spacious bedroom, balcony with oceanview. Extremely comfortable bed. The only negative - the shower head is in the middle of the ceiling over the tub, which makes it a little awkward trying to rinse off your lower body. Not a bid deal. Would definitely come here again; however, we are here in the off season. The high season rates are extremely high for our pocketbook, so would probably only come back if sharing the room and cost with others. The full kitchen makes it convenient to cook for yourself without eating in restaurants all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite anniversary destination”
Reviews.Author: LeesburgWineLady
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time at this Hilton. The front desk staff are courteous and professional, the service is great. Each time we left and returned the doorman would greet us with a friendly hello. The room was fabulous, this last time we had a corner suite and all I can say is wow. The rooms are always immaculate and the cleaning staff are pleasant. Off season at OC is wonderful and you can have the beach to yourself, very peaceful. This Hilton is our little piece of heaven in winter. Nice to see they have changed the policy to no pets.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised! Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: debinnova
Reviews.Content: We checked in midweek with no reservations and were greeted warmly by Debbie. We wanted a room higher up with a nice view and she gave us a great room on the 12th floor. Unfortunately, we couldn't pick up the wireless internet that high up. We called down to the front desk and Debbie immediately met us and took us to the same room on the 8th floor and internet connection was strong! Great customer service, everything you need - we were only there for one night, but would be great for a longer stay because of the microwave, stove, dishwasher, fridge, etc. Even a bathrobe, jetted tub and two flat screens TV. Steps to the beach, and plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. Even though it was off season, still feel like the rate was a bargain. Definitely plan on going back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nanaof3
Reviews.Content: Being an average traveler this hotel was a real treat for me. I wish we could have stayed longer than two nights.It is an all suite hotel with seperate bedroom,living room, dining area, full kitchen, jacuzzi tub and double sink vanity in the bathroom. It was very spacious with great ameneties. There was a large private oceanfront balcony with full size patio set. The weather was mild for November so we enjoyed the ocean breeze immensely.The bed was the most comfortable I have slept in; includng home. If you can afford it; this is the place to lay your head down in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “I Didn't Want to Leave!!”
Reviews.Author: Savesprinkles1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take advantage of the Hilton's fabulous off-season rates and enjoy a luxurious 3 day weekend. We usually stay at our family shared condo, but decided we wanted to enjoy the amenities that the Hilton has to offer. As we entered the lobby we were very impressed by how clean, and fresh smelling the hotel was. Check- in was quick and easy, and it was wonderful to have a friendly bellman load up and take our luggage to our room. All of the Hilton's rooms are ocean front, and we had a lovely suite on the 10th floor. Our room was spotlessly clean (and I'm very picky). The balcony and our view of the ocean was amazing! The room had a fully equipt kitchen and the bathroom had double sinks and a very nice make-up mirror. It also featured a corner Jacuzzi tub with a rain shower. The tub was large enough for two. The tub could be problematic for some as the sides are rather tall (I'm short!) and would it probably be difficult for an elderly or shorter person to get in and out of. Another problem with the tub is that the bottom of it was rather slippery when using the shower feature. I stood on a towel while showering to prevent slipping. The bedroom area was decorated beautifully and there was a great view of the ocean from the bed. The beds are very warm with both a down pillow-top mattress cover and a down comforter. If you are a person who "runs hot" you might be a litte too warm in bed. The mattresses are of medium firmness and we slept very well. The rooms are also extremely quiet. The hotel was fully booked and we didn't hear noise from anyone all weekend. Because it was the off season, many of the restaurants in Ocean City were closed for the season. Our first night there we ate at The Embers, a buffet-style restaurant. Both of our mornings at the Hilton we ordered room service breakfast. The food was wonderful and the portions were plentiful. Although the hotel was fully booked, I don't think we waited more than 20 minutes for our food. We also had room service for dinner on our second night and it was equally as wonderful. The indoor pool is another nice feature at the hotel. It is fairly large with a nice lounge chair area. There is even a window where you can order drinks from the bar. This hotel is very kid friendly, so there were lots of children in the pool, but they were all very well behaved. The staff at the Hilton is super-friendly and well trained in hospitality. It was truly a fabulous weekend! For first time travelers: The outlets that are just before the south bridge are nice, but rather small. Drive on to Rehoboth to the Tanger Outlets there, if you enjoy outlet shopping. Also, while in Rehoboth eat a Jake's Seafood House. The crabcakes are to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovesLauderdale
Reviews.Content: Arrived early they were able to let me check in extra early, Staff was very nice the Hotel was clean and fresh everywhere I went..

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary retreat”
Reviews.Author: jsmccrtn
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was a great place to celebrate our 2nd anniversary and 1st with our baby son. The all-suite hotel has a great sitting area and kitchenette with full-size fridge. We especiallly like the jacuzzi tub and our ocean front balcony with table and chairs. The only downside to this trip was the Palm 32 onsite restuarant, it was over-priced and did not have the best views. Why they put it on the hotel's bayside with views of the parking lot vs. oceanfront confuses me? Other perks include proximity to the OC boardwalk and the indoor pool and workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway experience”
Reviews.Author: CandybarMom
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here for 5 days, 2 months before our 2nd child is due. The spacious suite, oceanfront balcony, in room jacuzzi and very comfortable king bed were the perfect retreat. The staff was exceptionally courteous - the bellman would even call the elevator for us as he saw us walk in from the parking garage. Excellent location. Well kept indoor pool (outdoor pools were closed for the season). Loved breakfast overlooking the ocean Though we often didn't leave our room til close to noon, it was always waiting clean for us upon our return. Special requests were promptly handled. We have stayed in Hiltons all over the world (our honeymoon was in Rome and Amalfi, Italy and Malta), and once again, we are delighted with our experience. Not necessarily drawn back to Ocean City itself, but would recommend the hotel to anyone coming to the area.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hilton property in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Ravenboy
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I stayed here for a long weekend on a Rewards stay. So it was free, hence my really swell reward! I might be more subjective had I actually paid for this weekend, but hence I didn't have to. I have been a Hilton Diamond member for 5 years and have been hoping to find some time to stay at this place as we are only a couple hours drive away. I like to do most reviews by doing PRO/CON comparisons. But this hotel didn't have much to complain about. Anyway, here goes: PROs Free Parking - You just don't find that at many Hilton brands anymore. I travel a ton for work and Hiltons always charged $10-$25 a night to park (even higher in NYC) Full Kitchen - All suites are set up like Embassy Suites with separate bedroom and living area, however the suites here come with full sized refrigerator, full sized oven and 4-burner range, microwave, toaster, blender, pots, pans, dishes, silverware. Pools/water park - we are here in the fall so pools outside and water park are drained, but they have a huge indoor heated pool which the kids loved hitting each night before bed. Also have full sized beach towel type towels available in the pool area. And did I mention that the bar has a window service at the indoor pool area? Perfect design all the way around. Jet tub/shower - loved the huge jet tub/shower and double sink bathroom. With a family of 4 the huge bathroom makes a difference! Balcony w/table and chairs - how cool is it to have a balcony with table and chairs overlooking the Atlantic. Oceanfront location - no crossing streets and no boardwalk to contend with. The hotel is literally on the beach. Flat screen TV's - not only do they have flatscreens in the br and living area, but they are wall mounted and have the on-demand movie and game channels. Our room also had a DVD player. Next time we will bring DVD's. Guest laundry - big laundry room on every floor and free to guests. Starbucks - yes!! a Starbucks right by the front desk. We brought coffee and filters and used the pot in the room one morning but it was nice to have Starbucks there for an evening latte. CONs Breakfast - breakfast buffet is expensive, and Diamonds are not comped here but then again with a full sized kitchen and all the appliances, we made breakfast ourselves. I can't think of any other cons. Stay here, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Hotel with a Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: CMikeT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife, friend, and 5-year-old son. The room was beautiful with a similar layout to Embassy Suites hotels. We had a view of the ocean that was fantastic. To add to the experience, there was a balcony with a table with room enough to view eat, or just sit and enjoy the view. I am not sure if I would stay here if there were no ocean-view rooms. It may not be worth the price. Pro: There is free and ample parking at the hotel Con: It is a bit of a walk from the boardwalk

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DealDude
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend. The hotel's location is convenient and it is right on the beach. Every suite faces the ocean. The sunrise is breathtaking & the water was still enjoyable. The breakfast spread is good and the restaurant gets fairly busy. Service staff range from outright rude to very caring and all shades in between, however I've travelled extensively and encountered all kinds so it didn't affect me. I was there to enjoy, unwind, and relax and got all that done. On the flip side, they did not accommodate our request for a king bed and gave us a room with two queen size beds. Furthermore, the mattresses needed to be replaced. Again, didn't bother us much but could have led to unhapy customers under different circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again”
Reviews.Author: Paulsgal916
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Hilton in Ocean City, and while the stay was great, some of the front desk people were not the friendliest. Our stay overall was another pleasant experience and would without a doubt stay there again. We had horrible weather the whole 5 days we were there, but it is all good as we were in our favorite vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PWaveJMS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Suites for three days, returned Sept 23rd. Needed some R&R. Loved this hotel. Very relaxing, heated indoor pool, next to bar/lounge. Had an OFront Suite which was very, very nice. Beds were the most comfortable ever. Palm 32 Restaurant served great dinners. Would definitely return. Also, family oriented, but we never heard any noise at night. We have traveled extensively and found this hotel to be a WINNER and only three hrs away from our home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for family with young kids and teens.”
Reviews.Author: nym0m0f4
Reviews.Content: Heated pool all ages, swim up bar, reasonably priced veggie potstickers and crab cake and other food excellent at pool, little kids pool with adult hot tub adjoining, nice gym, complimentary fruit at front desk, tiny gift shop without postcards (has stamps) but $5 kites a must, 2 queens plus pullout a bit tight on space for fam of 6, starbucks in lobby, good housekeeping daily, doesn't allow more than 2 thin blankets for sleep sofa (weird), closet doors don't stay on the track, view really nice, can walk to some eateries, but hit Food Lion on the way down for groceries for fridge, not 7 eleven or other lousy places. Soda/water machines on each floor ONLY $1 bottle, LESS for cans, $1 snacks, laundry on each floor - we never used them, stains on couch, chair and floor yuck, table + 4 chairs on deck, magician and movies certain nights at hotel, noisy all day and night from waves.

Reviews.Title: “Third time a chime - well almost”
Reviews.Author: hank1105
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Hilton in OCMD. We started going to OCMD in 2007 and stayed at the new Hilton back then and was very pleased. While the lobby, hallways, etc., are in good shape, the rooms need a facelift. The room itself hasn't changed at all, which is fine, views are still absolutely amazing and the location is awesome. The problem is the overall maintenance, the rugs have a few stains and runs, the bathroom had some mold in a few spots. Again, nothing crazy, but if you are charging close to $500.00 a night, it should be perfect. The pools were all good, although again, could use some maintenance, paint was chipping in a few areas. It could just been that we came at the end of summer, when in previous years we visited in June. One thing that ticked me off was the lack of supervision on the small slide, so easy for a kid to fall off. Kids were going up the wrong way, pushing on top, surprised no one got hurt. Not really the lifeguards fault, the parents of the kids could care less. Good 6' drop from the top of the slide right onto concrete. We went to the usual places to eat (Dumsers, Thrashers, Fishers). We went again to Sunset Grill, which has always been great. This year we went to a new place called Lizzie's Cafe, around 140th St., awesome food and staff. Overall I would definitely stay at the Hilton again, they just need to realize the hotel isn't new anymore and they need to update it or charge less.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: BusTravelerWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We went here to burn some Hilton points. It's about 6 blocks from the start of the boardwalk; all in all not a bad spot to be. The rooms and baths are updated and clean. If you intend to go to OC MD for vacation, I would recommend the Hilton. All suites are ocean front, two pools, swim-up bar at the adult pool, plenty of parking. The dining is great. (Also, try Fresco's for dinner down on 83rd street - best upscale dinner on the island and great bar area.) In addition to the Hilton, there is a new Marriott Courtyard down a few more blocks directly on the boardwalk. We stopped in and it's very nice, but new hotels usually are.

Reviews.Title: “Had A GREAT Time at the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgreen1
Reviews.Content: The Hilton OC is the best! Since staying here, I have a renewed opinion about staying in OC - As there is now a nice hotel right on the beach that caters to families - particularly with young children. We paid extra for the corner queen suite...Totally worth the extra $$ as we had a ocean front view and a bay side view...AWESOME...the corner suites also have a bit extra space for the kids...Cocktails at the one - mainly adult pool were nice...the kids pool is fun and safe for my 3 year old and even my 11 year old had a blast on the bigger slide. The Hilton is a bit pricey and I was leary of spending so much for an OC property...however, our $$ was well spent...We cannot wait to go again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: arcanax
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Ocean City from NY/Westchester and aside from the horribly long drive down Jersey Trnpike, the rest was great. We rented a suite which had a bedroom, kitchenette area with bathroom and a playroom/TV room with a pull out sofa. The rooms were generous and perfectly fit the 4 of us, and worth the extra bucks since the kids (6 and 3) had room to run around. The best part was the crowd, ocean view and the children/kids pool. The slide was great and my kids went on that slide a total of 19 thousand times. I highly recommend this spot - Ocean City is full of hotels, but I found this one to have a combination of great family crowd, clean rooms/hotel, and proximity to walk to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best way to spend your hard earned Hilton points!”
Reviews.Author: Burlwater
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to spend your Hilton points and give back a little bit to your family for putting up with you being away so much. Our kids were 3 and 6 when we stayed here and they absolutely loved it. They were just about the right age to enjoy the kids pool (with slides etc). Hotel is clean. Rooms are spacious and well equiped for cooking. Service is friendly (mainly Eastern Europe seasonal workers). The Manana bar is really nice for lunch and cocktails by the pool with live music all afternoon. The beach is really nice too. We're not into the boardwalk stuff and amusement park so we stayed most of the time at the hotel - except for dinner at Harrison's and an afternoon at the Assateague Island National Seashore. We stayed 3 nights which was just right. But we are definitely looking forward to another stay next summer.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Miki90
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fabulous for a family with young children (3.5 & 6.5). The best parts were that it was right on the beach, so we'd do that in the morning, and then play in the kids pool in the afternoon. It has a kids activity planned for every day (although you have to be 5 years old in order to participate) and a movie each night. Once again, this is for 5 on up...so we weren't able to partake. We loved the fact that they had fresh fruit in a bowl in the lobby. It was a great healthy snack in the middle of the afternoon. Towards the end of the week...they had live musicians playing music by the adult pool. It definitely felt like we were living in the lap of luxury! The palm restaurant was fantastic too. After having several mediocre meals at places designed to feed the masses, The Palm was a real treat. The food and service were delicious, and well worth the money we spent! If we ever go back to Ocean City...I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Also...it was close to a McDonalds, amusement park, water park and go-cart track. Great entertainment for the kids! The only not-so-great things I will say are that the jacuzzi tubs in the rooms are not designed well for washing kids hair. The water to fill the tub comes out of the jets, so there is no faucet. If you want clean water to rinse your kid's hair, you have to get it from the sink and bring it over to the tub. Also...it says there is a Starbucks in the lobby....but it isn't really Starbucks. It is a hotel run concession place that brews Starbucks coffee. Not a big deal, but I was looking forward to getting some of the food options that Starbucks offers, and they didn't have any of them. Overall though, we LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel not worth the money.. Price...”
Reviews.Author: tedkenny
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel not worth the money.. Price is way too high... Rii s are nice with full kitchen, pull out sofa, table 4 chairs, bathroom has a nice jetted tub 2 flat screen tv one in living room one in bedroom.. Unlike other Hilton properties that Include breakfast for Hilton honors members this one only includes continental breakfast or the option of 9.00 off the purchase of anything on the menu. For the price you pay this should be included.. Great property for kids pool is great outdoors. The one inside is was not up to par. Sand all over the bottom and smelly.. General manager Sarah was unhelpful in early departure, she said they have a 72 hr cancellation policy or pay the $249 cancellation fee.. I had to take 2 cars but they only allow 1 parking pass.. If you have 3 people staying with u they only give you 2 vouchers per day per room for the breakfast. Nice rooms, nice location, but all in all too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Service - Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: BMBG
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this place for folks with families. Our stay was extremely pleasant and the staff was extremely helpful. There are 2 pools onsite, an adult pool and a kids pool. Only drawback is the kids end up in the adult pool and the swim up bar, which can be very annoying. Also, request a room on a higher floor to avoid the daytime noise. Both pools close at 7 or 8 PM which allows for quiet evenings on the oceanfront balcony watching folks fly kites on the beach :)

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware...Very expensive and very average overall"”
Reviews.Author: DJohn12402
Reviews.Content: We have two small children and thought that the O.C. Hilton would be a nice place to do a quick three day beach trip without having to rent a home for an entire week. With what amounts to $600 per day, you would think that you would get 4-star service all the way around. There were a few bright spots, but after only two days here I must say that I am very disappointed and sorry we didn't travel to the Outer Banks and take a partial week vacation.
