We booked a Corner Suite online. When we arrived at our room, we found out we were just one floor above the bar area complete with bar noise and view of the bar's roof. After having to wait until right at 3 PM to get our room (which happened to be the actual check in time, but isn't it nice when your room is ready for early check-in?....not in our case!) we were reluctant to move, but knew we had to. The problem is, there are only 5 double queen corner suites and I believe that many kings on the other side of the hotel. That fact greatly limits your ability to move into a like room on a different floor. We transferred to a "regular" queen suite which actually saved us $50 per night. Without going into needless detail, I think what you will find here is a lovely hotel for the most part, but simply not worth the money. It was peak season when we stayed, which makes everything crowded, almost laughably so at times. The beaches at Ocean City are so packed and noisy, at it is not relaxing for one liek myself looking for a "quiet vacation". The children seem to love it though and that's really the only reason to come here. Both doors in our room rubbed on the upper side which seemed to result from poor installation. The jacuzzi in our bathroom was difficult to start, and I found it wasn't blowing bubbles because the adjustment knob was broken. When I told them about it, the desk said they would tell maintenance. I have yet to see anyone come up. Very surprising given the service and quality you pay for here. It rained for about two hours this morning so seemingly everyone piled into the indoor pool. It was surprisingly chilly, more suited for exercise swimming than playing with your children in it. The outdoor bar never reopened despite the pool reopening after it stopped raining. We used the fold-out bed in the "living room", but found it not to have any sheets. There were none in the closet either. After we asked the desk to bring some up, they replied, "Check again." None magically appeared. After quite some time, a staff member brought some up. Somehow like we were asking for a big favor or something. In general the clientele are more upscale than you typically see in OC. They are also sometimes rude. Men striding through the lobby in nothing but skimpy bathing suits is not uncommon here. I will say the ocean views from the 7th floor (and I'm sure above) are lovely, as is the constant sound of the surf. Things actually do quiet down after about 9 PM. The boardwalk is only 4 blocks away. The cleaning girls (some Hispanic, some eastern European) were pleasant and efficient. We had a very nice breakfast at the hotel and our waiter (from Cameroon!) was very nice. My eldest daughter seemed to enjoy the arts and crafts which I believe runs for a few hours evey afternoon. A couple of hints: if renting bikes, try the place on 20th street, not 27th. As the boardwalk ends on 27th, every Tom, Dick, and Harry north of there hits up the place on 27th. They had surprisingly fewer bikes when we fell into the same trap. The concierge seemed very nice and knowledgeable. If thinking of dining in, try the 32 Palm restaurant but order directly from the hostess and have her call your room when it is ready. You'll save a bundle on room service charges, have a better selection, and tipping would be optional not expected. If you must go to OC, this is probably one of the places to check out, but don't expect tons of bang for your hard-earned bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Debra429
Reviews.Content: We booked this place back in March, on a recommendation. When we got there, they said we had an upgrade to a corner suite. We had originally booked a Two Queen suite. I was traveling with two teenagers, and figured one would have pull out bed, and the other the queen bed. When they upgraded us, they gave us a King size bed(A California King, not your standard King Size), Thank God we brought air beds. I'm not sure if they really gave us an upgrade or they needed a room for a bigger party. When we calledx, to ask for extra bedding, because the ones in the bags that were left in closet were used and rolled up and not cleaned. The Manager said he could only get us one. I yelled and finally my husband got onthe phone to explain that we will not use the dirty ones in the bag and needed two new ones, since they changed ouyr request from two queens to one king. He was at point to tell us to go elsewhere. Finally he understood, and everything was fixed . He apologized. I was glad with that. The Fridge had a fish odor in it. It looked cleaned but the smell was gross. The Rug was stained, it and the pull out bed was very uncomfortable. You spend alot for this hotel, the rooms need updating. I felt that the pool water was too cold, should have been heated a little. The indoor pool was cold also. Don't get me wrong. it is one of the nicer hotels in the area. The views are beautiful. They have washers and dryers that are complimentery on every floor. Just minor updates need to be done. otherwise it was a really nice hotel with great staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: ejsantiago
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at the Ocean City Hilton on a family vacation. This is a great property for families who want easy access to the beach. We have 2 teenage daughters and a younger daughter. Its 5 blocks from the end of the boardwalk, so theres no noise at night. We stayed in a corner suite which was large, clean, and comfortable. There is a living area with a dining table and a big fold out couch. Full kitchen and large bathroom were both very adequate for our needs. Bedroom has the large whirlpool tub and the balcony overlooking the ocean, also another sink and set of cabinets. The door between the bedroom and the rest of the suite is nice and solid, so the room is quiet. The balcony doors are very good, you cant hear the ocean when they are closed. The hotel has complimentary laundry facilities, including soap, that was a nice touch. It also has a small business center with computers and printers. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom and kitchen were clean. It's not spotless like a business hotel in a downtown area, but its very clean for a hotel filled with kids coming and going to the beach. This property is very much geared towards families who want easy access to the beach. That's what we wanted so it worked out very well for us.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN "OCEAN CITY"”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler46550
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay .We stayed here two years ago in the summer and had a blast , we just had to come back .The rooms are very clean and big with a full kitchen . the bathroom has a huge jacuzzi. The balcony has an amazing veiw of the ocen . The service was very prompt , we had a difficult time putting on the ac so we called the front desk and a guy came within the minute to show us how to work it .

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting stay in $549 suite felt like a cheap motel!”
Reviews.Author: TRX44
Reviews.Content: Sofabed was broken, mattress covering soiled, & blanket torn/stained. Staff refused us better bedding; just gave another torn blanket. Floor lamp had huge hole in center & a crack at top; chair had stains; closet doors were off-track; shower had mold; shower drain had mold/crud; doors inside room wouldn’t close. Maid re-hung dirty towels, left dirty shower/tub, didn’t vacuum/dust. When I asked her to dust she told me that she doesn’t dust. Staff was rude, uncaring, never apologized! (see photos)

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation for family with a 2 year old and 2 month old.”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Travelor_2007
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! This is our second year at the property and its a great hotel. We look forward to coming back. As mentioned in the title we were traveling with a 2 year old and 2 month old so keep that in mind when reading my review. The Pro's Suites Hotel - you have a kitchen, living room, and bedroom. The kitchen is fully stocked with microwave, blender, full size refrigerator, wine glasses, toaster, etc. The hotel provides diswasher detergent and dish detergent. There are also laundry areas on every floor which are free. Location - you are located right on the beach. Its about 5 blocks from the boardwalk but its the quiet end of the boardwalk which is 3 miles long. We drove to the end where there is more action in terms of amusements and restaurants. Pools - hotel has an indoor pool, kiddie pool with lifeguard and slides, family pool with swim up bar. It was open until 8 pm daily. Around 7 pm the hotel shades the pool and the beach. This was a great time to bring our 2 month old out to see everything. Room Service - Great! We ordered a lot. Ask about the specials. View - all rooms have an ocean view. Starbucks - is located in the lobby in season. They also sell popsicles. Parking - We parked right at the hotel. There is also an overflow lot down the street which is a block away. Con's - Very minor Trash Cans - the size of the bathroom trashcan is super small and the kitchen can is also small. We brought extra trash bags/ziploc bags for all the diapers. Remote Controls - the tv remote controls need replacing. The up down buttoms are worn out and need to be pushed hard to work the tv. No Spa - It would be nice if it had a spa onsite. Key cards - We both deactived our key cards. In one instance I had to go to the front desk twice in order to get into the room. We have both traveled a lot for work and have never had this issue before. Can be Pricey - We were using points but the hotel can be pricey in season. We had talked about next year renting a house but we feel the Hilton offers a lot that houses can't (pools, arcade, room service, location on beach, etc). Other Items: During our stay we also ate Papa John's Pizza - 2 blocks from the hotel but they will deliver. Also Bagels n Buns for breakfest which had good bagel sandwiches and delivered if you spent over $25. Fish Tales at 22nd and bay was very casual open air restaurant. There is a shaded indoor portion. Fish tales also has a pirate ship children could play in. It seemed to be for kids 3 +. McDonalds is also located 2 blocks from the hotel. There is also a store called Anthony's which sells beer/wine but also sells milk. As we were traveling with a 2 year old and 2 month old we brought our own pack n play, outlet safety covers, extra trash bags since small trash cans, ziplocs for dirty diapers, boppy pillow, some dreft detergent for laundry. We also noticed a lot of children had swim vests on in the kiddie pool.

Reviews.Title: “This is a high quality “resort”, not a typical “shore” hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbmss
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times before at the Hilton Suites in Ocean City (MD). This review is based on my July 2010 stay which is typical of prior experiences. In short, it is the best (or perhaps one of the top few best) hotel in Ocean City. You pay for it – summer rates are $500 per night (but I paid using Hilton rewards certificates). All the rooms are ocean front (directly oceanfront, not ocean view on the side) suites: living room with pull out sofabed, small full kitchen (full size refrigerator, sink, micro, range), one full bath generous size, and bedroom (two queens or king). There are two outdoor pools: one children’s (slide, mini-lazy river, sprayers) and an adult pool in a separate area with nice swim-up pool bar. A separate bar & food service area is adjacent to the adult pool. There is also a hot tub in the children’s pool area. Inside is a nice sized indoor pool (but the water was cold), small arcade room, and gym. The lobby has small sundry store and a quick service snack bar (drinks, fruit, pastries, ice cream). A full service restaurant and bar is also inside. There is a children’s activity room with daily afternoon arts & crafts project and a movie at night. Breakfast room service was very good (food & service). You walk out directly onto the beach where rental umbrellas are readily available. Parking was adequate – I always found a spot. Overall, it is very clean, well maintained, and in great physical condition. The location is ideal: oceanfront (not on the boardwalk), but a short drive to the boardwalk and everything else in Ocean City. You are within walking distance to liquor store, a few restaurants, mini-golf, and Jolly Roger amusement park. This is a high quality “resort”, not a typical “shore” hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Relaxing & A Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: traveler4136
Reviews.Content: My mother had really wanted to plan a family vacation and we have been to Ocean City in the past... it is one of our favorite "closer-to-home" (6 & 1/2 hours) destinations, so it seemed like a good idea to return to a place we enjoy. We had never stayed at the Hilton before, but from pictures & reviews it seemed like a great place. My mother took care of the accomodations (mom's treat!), so I cannot say if the value was equivalent to what we expected and received, but I will say it was a wonderful place to stay, and my mother was very pleased! We had 5 people in our party total - varying in ages from 55 to 17 years old and stayed for 4 nights. The hotel and location was accomodating for all of us. I am 6 months pregnant, so I really wanted to "just relax" and thats exactly what I did. The pool and beach are steps away, and the views from the balcony are serene. You can rent beach chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards on the beach as well. We ate at the hotel restaurant "the palms"... it was average fare but pricey. I found it difficult to select something on the menu and ended up ordering chicken tenders from the kid's menu. Others in our party were not very satisfied with their meals. We also ate lunch at the pool grill... it was average as well. One thing I wish I had done prior to the trip was research places to eat. We ate out every night but never really had a satisfying meal. I am not very much into crab legs or rockfish so I probably should have done some homework beforehand. We tried 2x to eat at the Greene Turtle but unless you get there by 4:00pm, forget it. They have at least a 1-2 hour wait every night after 4pm. My favorite dining experience was lunch at Seacrets. What a neat place! I would suggest going to Seacrets during the day if you are not into the nightclub scene, just to see the place... it is crazy! I hear it's a lot of fun at night as well. The hotel is approx 2 blocks from the boardwalk - an easy walk. The boardwalk is fun for all ages and gets a bit more crowded at night. We walked the length of the boardwalk and would then take the trolley all the way back. I would not want to stay in a hotel on the boardwalk. The hilton is in a perfect location. Regarding the room - it was spacious, modern and luxurious... just what i was hoping/expecting. I will say that if you are traveling alone or with a spouse and are looking for a "break from your kids" or don't like to be around children, I would not stay at this hotel. It is very children-oriented. They have a children's pool (play land) and an "adult pool" (I guess you could say it's "adult" mainly because it gets deep), but children play in the "adult pool" as well. Twice during our stay the children's pool was shut down for the day for cleaning because of someone getting sick in the pool, which meant ALL of the children and their families came into the adult pool. The children were doing flips, jumps, etc into the pool, literally taking over, with no regard for the adults who were enjoying the swim-up bar, sunbathing, reading, etc. The lifeguards did not seem to care. It was not a BIG deal, but if I were there to enjoy time away from children and to have a few drinks at the swim-up bar I don't think I would have appreciated getting splashed, kicked, etc. Also many people were very territorial over reserving lounge chairs. This happens at hotels everywhere, but a few people were obnoxious about it. By 2pm there would be single wet towels all over chairs to the point where you didn't know if chairs were actually taken or not. I guess that can't be avoided. Also, by mid-afternoon the clean beach towel supply was usually out. All very minor things though. Service was excellent and staff was very warm and friendly - from the bell-hop, to the reservation desk to the maid service, they all contributed to a very positive vacation. All in all it was an excellent, enjoyable vacation. We would return to this hotel in a heartbeat, and are already planning for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley perfect”
Reviews.Author: onehappycamper52787
Reviews.Content: We can't wait to go back to this hotel. I was a bit concerned since it is still a "shore" hotel that it would not be up to standard for the price. I was wrong. It was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, only using points will I ever stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Tjmmcp
Reviews.Content: Completely over priced hotel. Being in the hotel industry for 13+ years I have not once wrote a negative review of a property since most try their best bit this place simply is not worth the money. The facts: sign by pool states "no reserving chairs" wake up early to mark your spot with towels since they do not inane way enforce this "rule", pool is over crowded with arrogant people, cleared for poop one day and vomit the next, staff at pool barely can speak English, in general staff is poorly trained, one odd exception was the housekeeping staff which was very pleasant, had room kept at a nice cool 65 all week until Sat when all of the sudden temp could not be adjusted lower then 68, front desk gave me some lame explanation about being green-lmao, dirt in our hallway all week, parking sucks, found another hotel guest using the hood of our car to help unload his car ( arrogance), don't feel like typing anything else. For half the money to stay here you can rent a house in a community with a pool and use the savings on your vacation activities. Simply: stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else in Ocean City with young children but here!”
Reviews.Author: kfitz74
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hilton in OCMD. We have been staying at this hotel for the last 3 years we have visited OCMD. The first year it had just opened and we were there with our 15 month old daughter. This year we had our daughter who is now 5 and our son who is 21 months. We had a blast. The kiddie pool and adult pool are awesome. The access to all of the wonderful amenities such as, beach access, balcony (ocean front), suite style rooms, great food from their restaurant, very clean and modern rooms, and just the comfort you would want with traveling with young children. The hotel does have some wear and tear on it since it opened, but it still in first class in our book. You definitely get your money’s worth on this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_Beach
Reviews.Content: We were down for Moters Day and were blessed with a rare 80 degree weekend. Because it was off season, the prices were somewhat lower. and they opened the outdoor kids pool and the pool was warm! The location was excellent and the accomidations were perfect. One problem. On Friday evening, the phone kept ringing every hour. Finally at 3am, I took the phone off the hook. I complained to the front desk and they took 50% off the room.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Rude Employees”
Reviews.Author: PerryTheGolfer
Reviews.Content: Please do not waste your hard earned money on this very average hotel. The food and drinks are way over priced and not that good. Your too far from the Boardwalk and parking was minimal. The staff was rude and unhelpful on many occasions. I complained to management about it and he just blew it off. I stay at alot of Hilton's and this by far was the poorest experiance I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back again”
Reviews.Author: tasutt
Reviews.Content: First time to Ocean City, June 20th. Very nice hotel. Great ocean view, we watched the dolphins each morning. Great beach access, just a few steps, and there wasn't a whole lot of people in front of the hotel which was nice. The five blocks from the north end of the boardwalk was a little hike, thank God for the $3 train ride on the boardwalk! A few minor negatives; taking a shower is like standing under a lawn sprinkler, could use better shower heads, a little noisy over the children's pool (try to get a room over the adult pool), and get in early at night to get a parking spot on property, otherwise you have to park across the street. It would have been nice to take a late swim after a night on the boardwalk, but the outside pools close at 9 (wish they stayed open longer). Other than that, beds were very comfortable, rooms were larger than expected and any staff we came across.....very friendly! Would come back to stay again in June, before the rates get a little pricey the first of July.

Reviews.Title: “no boardwalk no clean rooms-extra charges-not a family beach”
Reviews.Author: deere4020
Reviews.Content: We went to the beach to celebrate Fathers Day and we always stay at Hiltons since we are Hilton members. We reserved the corner suite which was $100 more than the regular rooms. Upon checking in we realized it was not on the boardwalk which made it unconvenient to go to the boardwalk, and public transportation was a disaster, unless you like being squeezed on a standing room only bus with people swearing and pushing to put more people on the bus when there is already 50 on the bus. Another problem was when we got to our room and the room was not cleaned very to say the least, there was some type of body fluid down the front of toilet and on the toilet seat. the room did not appear to be cleaned except the beds were made. The table and windows were smeared up with something and the vaccum wa not even run. We had called housekeeping to come reclean the entire room, while we were waiting to begin having fun. At checkout we found that we had extra charges put on our bill that we did not do. The entire beach and boardwalk was filled with teenagers swearing and smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Yellow1201
Reviews.Content: Absolutely, loved location. Great pools for adults and children. We were on ground floor so we could walk right out to pool from room. Direct access to beach. Best / largest pool in OC. Will DEFINITELY stay again. Rooms were nice. Can't complain about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing- but it would have nice”
Reviews.Author: Maggs71
Reviews.Content: For the last two years I have enjoyed relaxing weekends at the Hilton. It is comfortable, convenient, and well run. I often use Trip Advisor when mapping out a vacation or get away, so I felt I would share one thing I would have liked to know before arrival. I booked the room several months in advance. It is expensive but worth it for the quality you recieve. Upon check in, I was informed that I would be charged an extra 15% for incidentals. It came out to be an extra $150 added to the cost for three nights. I realize this is not that significant but as a traveler, I would have liked some advanced warning. I may have missed it on their website. On my visit the previous year, this charge did not exist. They informed me that this money will be put back into my account granted the room was in proper condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property with all the amenities of home!”
Reviews.Author: jatona
Reviews.Content: This is our (3 kids (7, 6, 3)) 5th time staying for a long Summer weekend at this hotel. The rooms are nicely appointed and feature a full-size kitchen. I was surprised to learn it was the top rated hotel in Ocean City but I am not surprised. The hotel continues to exceed expectations in most areas; from the rooms, pool, beach access, and customer service. The rates are on the pricey side but it would benefit you to either apply for and/use the AAA rate or if your a governmemnt worker seek out those rates. The hotel is definately kid friendly and all staff attempt to make your stay an excellent experience. My only complaint is that after five years of wear and tear, the property is beginning to show its age. This year the room we stayed in had stains on the couch and carpet. THe sofa bed needs to be refurbish since now you can feel every spring and it makes for an uncomfortable night sleep. The beds sleep well but the pillows are a TRAVESTY. They are lumpy and offer no support. I had to use 4 to get the cushion support comparable to one really nice pillow. The hallway walls needed washing/repainting. In addition, since I have stayed at this hotel in the past I have always been placed on a high floor with excellent views of the ocean. This year my room was on floor three and overlooked the pool. Since, I was so near to the kids pool the noise and proximity to guest made the balcony unusable. These are my only complaints other than that I will stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Oceanfront ~~ Clean and Relaxing, with everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: Cassy34
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is worth every penny. We stayed several days and found the staff courteous. The hotel and room is clean. We requested a down-free room, and got exactly what we wanted. The bedroom was a good size and the adjoining oceanfront private balcony has plenty of room to sit at the table for four. Of course, the ocean is the main star and sounded awesome, and the good news is that when you shut the sliding door, it was very quiet in the room. There is a nice wall-mounted TV, as well as a table and chair. Aside the bedroom was the fully-equipped kitchen, including a blender, towel and dish cloth, dishwashing lotion --- anything you might need to rinse off the plates after you enjoyed a muffin from the Starbucks in the lobby. The adjoining bath had a double sink. The room is a good size. The jacuzzi worked well, although the overhead rain showerhead was obviously on watersaver -- which is fine by us. The living had a nice sofa, chair, three tables, a dining table with 4 chairs, and another TV. There is plenty of seating around the pool, and just a walk down the wooden stairs to the beach. The kiddie pool looked like a lot of fun, with waterfalls and a slide. We ate at 32 Palm and enjoyed the meal. The ingredients were fresh. The chicken noodle soup was delicious. The chicken fajita was also very good stuffed with chicken, mushrooms and cheese. The salads and house dressing are very good. We took an interesting day trip to Furnace Town in Snow Hill, MD. This living history museum in a woodsy area has many buildings with exhibits, including a weaver and the gardener (and the garden has a little of everything in it). It's worth the trip, and the children should enjoy seeing this 1800's Museum. It was so relaxing to return to the Hotel, be greeted by the hosts, sit on the balcony with a snack, and enjoy watching the surfers, as well as the boats in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough time to describe how great this place is.”
Reviews.Author: spetron
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here during Fourth of July week in 2009. I really can't say enough about this place. We chose it based on all the great reviews and the fact that we always try to stay at Hilton Family hotels. Though it's far from inexpensive it's extremely well-appointed. The rooms are very comfortable and roomy with fantastic ocean views. We saw dolphins almost every morning. The beach is awesome--clean, huge, right there and plenty of life guards. My kids couldn't get enough of the pool. Even the activities were a lot of fun for the whole family. The location is convenient to the board walk and there are a number of good restaurants nearby...especially Phillips Seafood. The staff is excellent and extremely helpful with everything from quickly responding to requests for towels to making great recommendations for dinner or anything else. If you're there for the 4th, you can even see the fireworks from the beach. Might not be as good a view as the board walk, but much more relaxing and less crowded. My kids liked it so much, we're headed back again this year. They had their choice but couldn't stop talking about what a great time they had last year. I may have had a few nit picks here or there, but I can't recall any now so they couldn't have been that important!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again and probably will.”
Reviews.Author: PAGOESTOTHEBEACH
Reviews.Content: Staff was polite and helpful. Excellent house keeping. Quiet rooms. Parking is a possible issue. You might have to park in an adjacent lot. Food is OK, could improve in this area but it is not bad. Kiddie Pool is great for young children. Complimentary fruit and newspaper is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Natefig35
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary and couldn't have been more pleased. Very friendly staff, absolutley amazing ocean front suites. By far the best price to value I have found yet. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and amenities”
Reviews.Author: SavaSava
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is probably the premiere Hotel in Ocean City. The rooms as as nice as they get and the furniture is newer than most hotels. The pool is hands down the best in Ocean City. The location is close enough to downtown to take the tram or the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Wonderful location, staff are troubling.....”
Reviews.Author: 4girls2boys
Reviews.Content: ONe of the largest hotels in Ocean City, right on the ocean, only 5 blocks to the boardwalk. A Salt Water pool with a bar and music was nice, would have been nicer if the water wasn't FREEZING all three days. The Suite rooms were very nice, two queen beds, fold out queen, two large screen TVs, bathroom with makeup mirrors, jacuzzi tub, lovely balcony over the water. The front desk staff were troubling at check in, no bellmen to be found, 45 minutes to check in, with only two folks in front of us online. I was chastised for trying to submit the hilton honors paperwork for a free night we stayed, and threatened by a front desk agent for "losing" paperwork I had handed him....never in 40 years has someone in a hotel spoken to me as Brian did at check in...a shame....because this was otherwise a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valentine's Day at the Hilton Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Bunny84
Reviews.Content: Only negative was we didn't get our chocolate covered strawberries as promised over the phone. But it wasn't a big deal. When we arrived check in was smooth the front desk staff was very polite. We were given our bottle of champagne and a small box of chocolates. And we were also able to make our dinner reservations right there/ on the spot (which was also included in the Romance Package). Loved the suite. We ended up having to get a double queen as that was all that was left but didn't bother us much. The layout is really what I really liked. The sitting room, and then the fully stocked kitchen, the jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, and then the room and the balcony facing perfect ocean view. Flat screens in both the sitting and bedroom areas of the suite. The kitchen is fully stocked and all of the utensils, silverware, glassware, pots and pans, appliances and the like are very clean and it great condition. Dinner was one of the best parts which was also included (full/ 3 courses). I wasn't expecting much from the hotel restaurant but was pleasantly SURPRISED. We started w/ the lobster bisque it was very rich and creamy, great flavor. He had the crabcakes which were okay. And I had the stuffed rockfish which was topped w/ some type of hollandaise or imperial sauce. It was very good, baked tender but to a golden brown, fresh full of flavor and very filling. For desert my husband had the bourbon pecan pie and I had the mixed berry shortcake (both very DELICIOUS!). Our waitress was very attentive, answered questions/offered suggestions and was very attentive to our needs. Afterward we enjoyed the pool for a little while wasn't crowded at all and very clean plenty of towels. The resort/ hotel is very well kept and most if not all staff we came in contact with had very good customer service. We will definitely be back hopefully this Summer!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Hilton OC MD”
Reviews.Author: gypsymarestudios
Reviews.Content: I think people tend to only write reviews when their stay is bad so I had to write a one since our stay was so nice. First, my husband had booked this hotel for one night for my birthday but I was so sick that day, we asked to change the reservation to the next weekend. I was very grateful they did this without charging us extra. The manager even called when we arrived to make sure I was feeling better! The weather at Ocean City was perfect, the boardwalk was hopping, the skies blue and sunny. The hotel exceed my expectations. The suite was large and nicely furnished. Everything appeared to be new and barely used. The sheets were soft, feather pillows comfortable (mattresses were on the soft side, some don't like this). All full sized appliances in the kitchen including dish washer and blender. Wi fi in the rooms to surf the laptop. Two flat screen TVs in the room with lots of great channels. Corner bathtub with jauzzi big enough for 2, awesome shower. Soft towels and oversized robes. Wonderful toiletries. Indoor pool and video game rooms were neat and clean. Fresh fruit in the lobby. Starbucks coffee in the lobby too! Friendly staff where ever you go. Didn't use the restaurant but they gave us a coupon for the place, that was nice. Even though we only stayed for a night, it was wonderful. If you have the money splurge on this hotel, it's the nicest place I've stayed at in Ocean City. Thank you Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “We did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Lainy0957
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from a mini springbreak at the Hilton Suites. We stayed from the 16th-18th of March. We did not want to leave! Everyone there was really nice and accomodating. The indoor pool is very clean with unlimited towels, you can have walk up service from the window that connects to 32 Palm and bar. Just walk up to the window and ring the bell service where you can order anything you want from the 32 Palm menu and eat it poolside. The one day the pool was warmer then the other. It also stays open til midnight and I would recomend adults to go down after 6. We were very lucky and both days we had the pool to ourselves. =). The game room has a nice variety of games to keep children and inner children occupied and the fitness center is very nice and clean. They have tables outside in the hallway you can sit down and relax.They have a mini gift/toilitries shop that pretty much covers everything you may have forgotton or need. Be warned on off season the Starbucks is only open on Fridays or the weekend. We were sad we didn't get our starbucks fix, but the coffee was very good in the room. We stayed on the top floor room 1212, it is right by the elevators but far away enough to not hear much. Complimentary Laundry and vending machines on every floor. Our room was very very clean. When I travel I always use chlorox wipes to wipe everything down just incase something was missed. The living room was very nice with a table with four chairs, a couch and another chair and a flat screen tv. The lighting in that room was very nice and relaxing. The kitchen is a good size and a nice kitchen at that. It sets you up with everything you need. The bathroom was clean, the grout could of been a little cleaner looking but it was fine. The jacuzzi tub is wonderful and can accomodate two people without being cramped. The jacuzzi jets are great and the water gets really hot so it is a nice little hot tub going on. The rain shower head is very nice and big and big enough for two people to use at once. The pressure was perfect for us. There are two double sinks. Amenities include toiletries, make up mirror, hair dryer and lots of toilet paper. They also supply lots of towels which we loved and didn't have to call down to get extra! The robes were very comfy and we wore them the whole trip! Turn down service you get fresh ones with chocolates! The bedroom was very clean and comfy. The king sized bed was sooooooooooooooooo clean. The sheets clean and crisp and soft. The matress was perfect as were the pillows. We slept great!! The balcony is a great size, with a good size table and chairs. The view is amazing. The balcony was also VERY private considering we were on the top floor. You are very close to the ocean, so the ocean waves will put you to sleep. With the exception for a light lunch at Fager's Island one day (do not recomend there offseason menu, it was lacking and service as well) we had room service the whole time for our meals! I would recomend going to Superfresh and getting drinks, snacks and forgotten toilitries/meds but the food at the Hilton delivers and is very tasty! Getting room service especially for breakfast and sitting out on the balcony is a must, so relaxing!!! All of our meals we recieved were fine and delicious! All the food came very hot and fresh! You could tell they just made it! From other Hotels/Resorts that are in the same price range, I found that the Hilton O.C. really delivered in terms of you get what you pay for. The room service were very prompt and friendly! Everyone that works there is very friendly. Our only "con" would be we felt that at the front desk, they needed better training at being sociable or more friendly when greeting guest. For example when we checked in and walked toward the check in, the employees SAW us, but did not greet us with a "Hello Welcome" we actually said Hello first and after we friendly greeted them was when they friendly greeted us back. That is a pet peeve of mine. So I would say to the manager to tweak his employees greet etiquette a little better especially have it ready for the In season when the prices range from 300-500+. Other then that everyone was very friendly and helpful! As for O.C itself for this time of the season, everything is pretty much closed. So if you are bringing children, there really isn't much for them to do with the exception of indoor golf by 70th street which also has food and a little arcade. The boardwalk was dead and most the restaurants good shops and rides/games were closed. So we decided our best bet was to eat at the Hilton the whole time because we knew the food was good and fresh. If you are going for romance and privacy this is the best time to come and get holed up in your suite and go swimming and feel very vip! Pets are welcome also! All the pets there were quiet,well behaved,friendly and clean! It was very cute watching them play on the beach from our balcony! My bf and I talked about bringing our dogs down this time next year! This pretty much sums up our stay! If we could suggest anything, we would say add a spa, tennis courts and have late night dining open til midnight instead of 11! =)

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: Paulsgal916
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to OC, MD 4 times in the past 6 years. We absolutley love it there and will continue to make it part of our yearly vacation getaway. The whole trip is just about 4 1/2 hours with a nice break on the Cape May/Lewes Ferry. The first 2 times we had stayed at the Nassau (which is no longer there) 1 time at the Quality Inn (just ok) and last year at the beautiful Hilton. We will be heading back to the Hilton again for our 10 years anniversary. I look to book our vacation for the following year as soon as we return home. The beach is so relaxing, there is plenty to do and so many restaurants to choose from. Even if you are not a seafood lover, there are many other choices. I think everyone should vacation there at least once in their lives. Thanks OC for a great and relaxing vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: M3046
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this location and again we had a great stay. The room can be expensive during busy times but very clean and comfortable. Great for kids and small children. The room has full kitchen which helps when traveling with kids. Great outdoor pool and indoor pool clean and nice. Hotel restaurant is expensive but food was very good. We ordered 1 dish for kids to share (1 and 4 yrs) and they even split up food and brought out as 2 dishes. Staff was great with our children. Our hotel room floor had a lot of sand on it when we checked in so we mentioned it to our housekeeper and she mopped floors everyday after that...we never had a problem again. Rooms are quiet. Washer and dryer free for guests which is awesome when at the beach. Put the kids down for nap and enjoyed coffee from Starbucks coffee bar. Kids love the "In Theater" movies ( price is high $11-15 but such a convienence). Finally, we have stayed at tons of hotel in OC and this is def. one of the best. We went during slow and busy season and when they are busy just keep that in mind...pool can be crowded and service a little slower but this really is a great place one of best in oc. Wish prices were lower during summer but all places are like that.

Reviews.Title: “bad time with romance package”
Reviews.Author: ammandarein
Reviews.Content: okay so me and my fiance got a romance package for $259 for one night its suppose to come with champain and chocolate covered strawberries for when we got in the room.we entered to a big slap in our faces. the room had the jucuzzi tub witch we wanted but the bed was a messed up and the wet barr was locked we called down there and they said we could not have acess till the next day. then we called them up the next day and had to speak to the general manager. the general manager did get us our stuff but through all of the money we spent went down the drain we had to leave our room by 12 am our stuff got their at 11:59 so we could not enjoy any of our features from the romance package that we had planned for monday after vday day. i found the room service to be more freindlyier then the manager... the pool and hot tub were in our package but when we got here the pool and hot tub were closed i feel like the motel 8 would have been a better stay then this hotel. so if you are thinkin that this hotel would be nice for a getta way think again... they really need to pick up a few tips on how to treat their guests rather then try to impress people on their packages because our romance package their was none

Reviews.Title: “would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: docanddoc
Reviews.Content: we traveled with 3 1/2 year old with sensory processing (integration) disorder who also dev eloped a cold and was cranky. the staff could not have been nicer or more accomodating. the suites were perfectly layed out with a door separating the living room from the bedroom with a kitchenette in between. the pool was clean and lovely. unfortunately the restaurant was quite disappointing. we were stuck in the hotel and had to settle for mediocre (at best) food. i would stay away from mambo pizza which was rubbery and tasteless and go for southside grill. the owner of southside grill was totally understanding of our situation with a hyperactive child and the food was surprizingly outstanding. fresh, large portions, tasty. then there is planet maze. great sensory activity for the child. weather was awful and child was sick so we were limited but under the circumstances we fared pretty well.

Reviews.Title: “Okay.”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyMarylandgirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is amazing and just beautiful. The only problem was when we went to the restaurant(32 Palms) and that was the not so great part. First off we weren't offered any bread and saw everyone else had some. It took about 30-45 minutes and we ordered appetizers! The food wasn't even that great!

Reviews.Title: “Appearance of Luxury, experience of Misery”
Reviews.Author: NaturalMomOfFourKids
Reviews.Content: This Hilton does not have adjoining rooms. So, if parents want to be in a separate bedroom from the kids, but still in the same apartment, the horribly uncomfortable sofabed is the only available option. The bedroom's 2 queen sized beds are very soft, and jiggle a lot with every movement. The sheets and towels must be bleached with every washing, and they use scented detergent, which meant that I couldn't stand to sleep with bare skin touching the sheets, because they made my skin itch and burn. Same goes for the towels. The indoor pool chemicals made my children's skin itch and burn red, even after multiple baths. They were crying and I contemplated taking them to the ER. The hotel does not offer a reasonably priced, healthy breakfast. There was little to no sound insulation for the room, and the lights on various appliances shone, flickered, or flashed at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway with the kids”
Reviews.Author: julieb8Baltimore
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and spacious. My 5 year old son with autism was right at home and my 7 year old son and his brother loved the indoor pool. The staff and room service were friendly and accomodating. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: joeybagz312
Reviews.Content: I'm a widowed mom who lost her husband on Thanksgiving weekend 5 years ago. I started taking my two boys, ages 4 and 6, to Ocean city to get away from all the Thanksgiving Hoopla and made it our own special tradition. This year we splurged and stayed at the Hilton Suites. We loved it. The kids loved the indoor pool, although the first two days water was freezing and the last day it was warm and perfect - must've been broken in the beginning. The view from the balcony is great and it is right on the beach. Amazing views, sunrises and sunsets. The location is great. You can walk to Fractured Prune doughnuts on 28th - which is amazing, and there is a mcdonalds and burger king nearby too. You can also walk to Jolly Roger (which was closed for season) or Planet Maze which has fun activities for kids. Very conveniently located. The staff was all very friendly and nice. We did not use the restaurants as we read some reviews on tripadvisor that told us they weren't really amazing. The kitchen was stocked well enough that we could save money on a bunch of breakfasts, lunches and snacks. Our jacuzzi tub was huge however didn't work. We called maintenance the next day and they came up and fixed it for us after about 30 minutes of working on it. The boys loved playing in this tub, almost like having a pool in your room! The beds were amazingly comfortable with very high thread count sheets. The sofabed was very creaky and not at all comfortable. The room was very nicely equipped and whatever we didn't have, the front desk was happy to provide. Housekeeping and bell service and front desk service were all top notch. Not sure we could afford this place during peak of summer season, but I would stay here in a heartbeat if it was more reasonable. I got a great government rate for $134 per night, I'm told this place is about $499 a night in the summer time.

Reviews.Title: “A fun filled, relaxing weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveler5700
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable, convenient, centrally located and has plenty to keep your family busy. The kids loved the pool and the beach was great. The restaurants were good but a little pricey. I recommend trying some nearby restaurants instead (Hoopers is a favorite of ours) The kids like being across the street from the Jolly Roger. They also loved swimming in the indoor pool when they got tired of being in the sun. I loved having access to the bus so once there there was very little need to drive. The room was very nice and was equipped with everything we needed. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered like a Queen”
Reviews.Author: murka69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Suites in Ocean City Maryland for a long weekend. All the staff:: Houskeeping, maintenance, front desk, porters...were friendly and asked if my room was ok, if there was anything I needed. I was addressed as Mrs........... . not just the person in room such and such.... I will go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Motel”
Reviews.Author: RDH66
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for a weekend getaway and were very impressed. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I liked the large whirlpool tub in the bathroom and we really enjoyed the view from the spacious balcony. We did not use the indoor pool but it is large with many lounge chairs--a very nice setting. I hope to return soon. Check-in was very smooth and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This beautiful suite hotel has it all!”
Reviews.Author: DebraT70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in mid-October at the Hilton Suites Ocean City Oceanfront. We arrived late in the evening to find our room ready, check-in unbelievably speedy, and the staff very willing to help us bring all of our luggage upstairs (although we didn't take them up on it and borrowed a cart to take things upstairs ourselves). The suite was gorgeous! We went during the off-season when the rates were extremely reasonable. We had a corner suite on the fifth floor, suite 501. We left the balcony doors open every night and slept with the wonderful ocean air coming into the room, and awoke to very gorgeous sunrises. The jacuzzi tub in the bedroom was great, and the rainfall shower was awesome! We used the kitchen to make breakfast most mornings, and it had everything you could need from dishes, pots and pans and silverware to a coffee pot, microwave, toaster and blender. There was also a little coffee shop in the lobby that served Starbucks open from 6 am to 3 pm so we'd often just grab some coffee there. The staff were very ready with suggestions when we asked them for a good seafood buffet, and saved us several trips to places that were closed in the off season. The free wi-fi was a huge bonus, as we're both addicted to the internet and spent at least some time each day hanging out in the spacious and comfortable living room tapping away on our respective laptops. The living room and bedroom both had large LCD screen TVs and there was a Nintendo gaming console in the living room, athough we didn't use it. We also tried the indoor heated pool late one evening and had it all to ourselves - it is open until midnight every day. We took advantage of the free laundry facilities on our floor which made returning to the real world much easier. If you want an extremely comfortable suite experience for your Ocean City vacation, don't hesitate to make a reservation at this Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for family with kids”
Reviews.Author: Corning_NYCaseyCleo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel...expensive but worth it. Rooms are large enough for all swim gear, beach is extraordinary..Services in hotel are unsurpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: LilacLadyVA
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult son with autism, and I had never been to OC, MD before. i'm hesitant to go to East Coast beaches preferring FL beaches. However, both the Hilton and OC in general were a welcome suprise. The hotel and city were clean and neat. All of the hotel staff were very welcoming and attentive. We used the indoor pool quite a bit since we were there in off season and it was chilly outside. The pool was very clean and the towels were stocked. There is an access window to the bar for drinks which was nice. On the one day that it was warm, we laid on the beach and sat in the hot tub outside. The hot tub was okay - nothing extraordinary. We did witness a lifeguard at the outdoor pool jump in with her sweatsuit on to help a child. It wasreassuring to know the lifeguard was there and attentive. The room was clean and welcoming except for the back of the bathroom door which had fingerprints and scuffs. Otherwise the room was comfy. The oversized balcony (compared to other hotels) had a table and chairs where we had lunch. The beds had down comforters and pillows. Although other reviewers found the beds comfortable, they were too soft for me, but leaving the door open at night to hear the waves helped me to sleep and ignore the back pain. We didn't try the restaurants at the hotel so I can't comment on those. All in all, it was a great weekend get-away and we would defintely go back, but likely in off season so as not to deal with the crowds during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly - Not”
Reviews.Author: MarylandJan
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at this hotel for a long weekend with my family. I booked months in advance and said I would be bringing my toy poodle. They said fine. They accepted pets. But when I called to reconfirm about a week and a half before my stay, they said they had no record of the pet friendly request even though I had emphasized this as an absolute prerequisite during my initial call. They said to call back later in the week and they would see what they could do. When I called back they admitted there were only two pet friendly rooms and that I would not be getting one. No apology -- not even when I emailed customer service. Luckily, I was able at the last minute to book at a pet friendly hotel down the street and salvaged my long weekend. We had a blast at the Clarion.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great vacation”
Reviews.Author: b4bunch
Reviews.Content: We stayed for free 6 nights at this Hilton location courtesy of HHonors points. This was our 3rd visit to the Hilton OCMD. While the room had several issues that were not up to our expectation at check-in (cot we requested was not delivered, we got down instead of hypoallergenic bedding, tile floor was greasy, screen door was broken, safe was inoperable) a call to the front desk had several housekeeping staff to our room almost instantly to remedy all the problems. Housekeeping was substandard for the 1st half of our visit (and required a call to the front desk) and "front desk courtesy fruit" was unavailable for the first 3 days as well. Even though though these issues were satisfactorily resolved, we feel that a $500/night hotel should not have overlooked them. The remainder of the stay was hassle- and worry-free. Staff were always pleasant, even when long lines await. Our children love the outdoor waterpark; courtesy pool towels are a bonus. Poolside waitress/beverage service was prompt and courteous. We had opportunity to use the indoor pool as well. We ate breakfast at the Palm 32 and were disappointed (as in previous stays)--we just do not care for breakfast in this restuarant and feel that the quality is substandard to the rest of the hotel. This Hilton is in a great location, just a few blocks walk to the north end of the boardwalk, where you can pick up a tram car to the south end, where there are amusements and rides. And the complimentary laundry facilities were very much appreciated by this family! We hope to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE OC!”
Reviews.Author: FiveStarTraveler
Reviews.Content: Love OC. If you are looking for a place on the boardwalk look elsewhere. Thankfully we like to walk so it does work to our advantage but for those who don't it could be an issue. If this hotel was 15 blocks south it would be perfect. Rooms are beautiful, very clean, view specticular, staff.... if i hear one more time, "it's off season" i'm going to scream! Maid service is excellent. Nice having a full kitchen, if you like to cook. This is an ideal spot for people w/children. Across the street is a MacDonald's and Burger King, so how would you go wrong. Now if we had a Dunkin Donuts w/in walking distance, that would be even better! Boardwalk is fun and there is plenty to do for kids/adults, once again, if you aren't here "off season". We are here 10/2-7 and have to say the general area is very nice. Coming from Cape Cod i'd actually say this is one of my top 10 beach destinations on the east coast. Although like home, so out of our our price range for a "second home" destination. Some very quaint areas and I do have to say the locals are more than charming and helpful when you inquire on things to do and where to go. Would I return to the Hilton, most definately.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Angie518
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything the description details and more! The front desk staff was friendly and helpful as other reviewers had mentioned and the room were beyond our expectations. We stayed in one of the corner suites which had a large living room, perfectly appointed kitchen and spacious bathroom and bedroom. The balcony attached to our bedroom provided a private oasis to enjoy the beautiful ocean views. The bathroom shower and the bed had to be my absolute favorites! The shower featured multiple shower heads, including a rain shower head which was heavenly. The hotel's description of the ultra comfortable bed was right on. I wanted to take this bed home with me! I slept better on this mattress than on my own at home! My only regret is that we didn't stay longer! We definitely plan to come back to this hotel, we're even considering booking a stay for my parents as a Christmas present. Pick this hotel, you won't regret it! :)

Reviews.Title: “Seeing more than the hotel's surface”
Reviews.Author: ExHospitalityPro
Reviews.Content: This was my family's 4th year at Hilton Ocean City - in our first year there, our weekend stay was during a hurricane where the wind would not allow a 265 pound built father walk his family accross the street for a BKs late night quick meal. It turned out to be a memory pleaser as we found 6 inches of sand on the boardwalk the next day. So memorable, that we thought this hotel was going to be an annual tradition as many make Ocean City an annual tradition. As a preface to place this hotel in perspective of my following opinion... a) In all my stays at Hilton OC, I used Hilton Honors reward points for a free multi-night stay. I was their first member to hit a million points as they shut my account down for 3 months when I hit this point because their systems stopped b) I have travelled the world and I stay at some of the better to best hotels c) My previous career included studies, apprenticeships, and management of hotels for an exisiting hotel chain. The Hilton Ocean City stays were easier with a Diamond membership and more difficult with a Gold membership, but possible if you book early. In the 3 of the 4 years, most requests were handled for a high floor, non-smoking suite. This brings up another point. If someone smokes on a balcony below or next to you, be aware that smoke will get inside your suite. This has happened everytime we were above the 1st floor. Every year, we have had to ask at least once during our stay to get our room cleaned. This last stay, we came back from the pool for a few minutes at around 4pm, and the maid was entering our room. We placed the turndown service card for after 6 pm service - the day maid removed it and we missed the service as we returned at 9pm. I have seen other complaints about the late day or lack of cleaning, and the hotel has NO excuse. The Executive Housekeeper knows they are full for most of the entire summer - this is no surprise as they can plan accordingly with their staffing levels, their linen supply, etc. Again, there is no excuse! In addition, MAKE SURE TO PLACE THE CARD FOR SHEETS TO BE CHANGED on the pillow as advised on the card. If you place it only on the bed, and NOT on the pillow, the maid will not change the sheets. I know this because I suspected they really do not change the sheets in this hotel. So, the first night, I placed the card on the sheets. They were not changed because I made a 'L' mark with a pen on the inside corner of the sheet. When we returned to the room, I found the sheets to be clean. However, the maid did not change the sheets because the one sheet still had the pen mark. I did not complain to the hotel. The next day, I placed it the card on the pillow, and the sheets were changed. I am also not sure why the maids do NOT place their carts to block the suite door. This is not only for thier safety, but also for the safety of any items you leave in the front part of the suite. Without the cart blocking, one can easily walk intot he front part of the suite and grab anything without the maid's knowledge. also, ALWAYS make sure to pull the door shut on the way out. After the 1st year, the hotel has seemed to settle or the expansion from the heat in the summer prevents the door to close and lock properly. Pool area.... I give a lot of credit for the design of the pool for the kids - this is a great hit! It was also a wise management decision to not allow those under 16 in the outdoor jacuzzi - this adult area is usually ruined by kids in other hotels. I would advice them to make the sign about this bigger. In the last 2 years, I suspect the hotel is cutting back in pool cleanliness. in 2008, both of my daughters came down with swimmer's ear immediately after their stay. This year, my brother-in-laws 3 kids at the end ofg July, my wife's friend's family two children who stayed at the hotel in the beginning of August, and my 2 daughters and myself all came down with swimmer's ear immediately after our stays. All of the above were in the kids pool at one point. My wife was only in the adult pool and ocean water. My one older daughter and all the other kids in the two other families never went into the ocean water as they were all scared. This year, I did not go to the indoor pool. The conclusion is that swimmer's ear comes from the childrens outdoor pool. The above 2 families were recommended this hotel, and this swimmer's ear made it a disappointment. The indoor pool is great for those rainy days. The gym was satisfactory for my wife. The game room as well as the business center sufficed. The hotel does offer activities from children aged 11 and under. Not so much for those 12 and older. the hotel really does not have a great location other than the nice beach in front and a short walk to McD, BKs, the liquor store, a small breakfast place. It is away from the hustle and bustle at the south end of the boardwalk. Lots of things require some sort of vehicle. The hotel does offer free fruit at the front desk, but they should also send someone out to the beach to pick up the green guest towels which end up in the dump bins of the nightly beach cleaning crew via city owned tractors. More waste.... For a free suite, I would not complain as much, but I do expect to be treated the same way as a paying guest because HHonors does pay $380 for the suite. So, if you are a Diamond/Gold member, remind the hotel manager that they are still getting paid a good dollar for the suite. However, if I paid the exhorbitant rates of $450+ per night, I KNOW I am better off saving up and going to Hawaii or the Carribean. This hotel is owned by a local parent company who owns several other high end hotels. I learned in hotel school that a hotelier can make a property exceed on a pricing category. This parent company has truly succeeded at using this pricing strategy to make the Hilton successful. The value by each reviewer here makes their own jusgement. As stated, this year was our last stay at this hotel. The most basic question I ask for former employers about an employee applicant is, "Would you re-hire this employee?" The same basic question applies to this hotel - Would you re-hire them after getting past the hotel's surface?

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: 3frombklyn
Reviews.Content: We brought our 7 month old along and had a great time. The Hilton is close enough to the boardwalk and all stores are with in a few blocks. You have a choice of an indoor and outdoor heated pools so we enjoyed the water rain or shine. The beach is clean and steps from the lobby. The food at the hotel is just ok and convenient. We just asked for take out and had dinner in our suite when the baby got fussy. There's a deli/wine shop, McDonald and Burger King across the street if you need a quick meal. Starbuck's coffee in the lobby definitely was a plus. Nice location, great staff and clean suites will have us coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly OC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: me_travelsometime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and the room was great. It's an all suites hotel so you get a bedroom,living room and big galley kitchen. Great for families with young ones. The pools were great. They have an adult only pool, a kid's adventure pool which was a blast ( Pirate ship slide, big slide, jetted whirlie circle, shooting geysers ) and a nice indoor pool. The outside pools are heated. All the staff were very nice. BUT>>>>> do not eat at 32 PALM, yucky and overpriced. The concierge messed up our arrival package, which included a fresh fruit tray and bottle water. I had to ask for two days to have it finally brought to our room. when we did get it it was nicer than I had thought, the fruit was fresh and they gave us a large selection. All and all a nice clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fish Hook in Carpet”
Reviews.Author: mlf149
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th and final stay at this hotel. Our Hilton Honors preferences state that I prefer a high floor, away from the elevators. Upon check in we went to our room on the 10th floor which satisfies the first preference. The problem was our room was right in front of the elevators. I immediately called the front desk and they apologized and said that they see our preferences and they don’t know why we were issued that room. A manager come up and immediately moved us to room 1113 which was high and away from the elevators. No big deal just a minor inconvenience. What happened next is inexcusable. We started to unpack and my wife and kids removed their shoes while in the room. About 30 minutes later my wife yelled that something cut her foot. I got on my hands and knees and saw a small rusted fish hook in the carpet. I put the hook in a plastic bag and took it to the front desk. I handed it to a host at the front desk. He said, yes, it happens sometimes and that’s why “we” recommend wearing shoes in the hotel rooms? Really? I have to wear shoes in a $500/night hotel room for fear of fish hooks? I returned to the room and told my wife of Hilton’s response. My wife called the front desk and asked to speak to a manager. The manager a apologized and came to room and took a formal report, offered some bandages and the location of a medical center and left. We contacted our family doctor and he instructed my wife to get a tentus shot. We contacted the medical center the manager referenced and unfortunately they didn’t take our insurance. I went to the front desk and asked in Hilton would cover the $120 tenus shot; they did. At no point during our stay did Hilton contact my wife to see how she was doing. She was offered NOTHING but a ridiculous excuse and a “sorry” for getting a rusty fish hook in her foot from the hotel room. I expected a lot more from Hilton especially at $500/night. The hook was bad, the way Hilton handled is was far worse. I can’t believe Hilton offered her nothing! It’s not like we are looking for a handout, but a free drink or meal would have been a nice gesture. I'm a Hilton Honors Gold member (2nd from top). I can't imagine the kind of service we would have recieved if I wasn't a gold.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel4
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hilton Ocean Suites.Really gorgeous suite and fabulous bathroom. Our kids loved the water slides in the pool.Were tired after a long drive ,so did not eat in restaurant but ordered room service.One of the best meals we have ever had from room service ! Only downside we had to leave after just 2 nights...but we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: cardtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this place. Each room is a suite with an oceanfront terrace also overlooking the pool area. Great location! Wonderful pools: a family pool with a waterslide, lazy river and whirlpool plus a regular pool with a swim up bar. Bath in the suite contains a large multi person jacuzzi bath. Large galley kitchen- fully equipped. Starbucks is right in the lobby. Did I forget the enormous indoor pool? Also walking distance to the boardwalk. Stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Just as great as everyone says....”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover077
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over a weekend in mid-August with my husband and 2 sons (a 2 1/2 year old and a 3 month old). I agree with all of the great reviews about the hotel that i read on this website. My 2 year old LOVED the kids pool - the waterslides are great and appropriate for kids from age 2 to adults! This hotel is super kid-friendly. I think that we saw kids come out of every room on our floor - even the "adult pool" had tons of kids in it - even sitting at the swim up bar! This was fine wtih me given our situation and the type of vacation we were aiming for, but just a warning to couples who may be looking for a romantic getaway. The music at the adult pool was nice too. The balcony and ocean views were awesome. We ordered room service one night and ate on the balcony - not sure if you would find a view like that at any restaurant in OC- and the food from the hotel restaurant (32 Palm) was excellent as well. The beaches were very clean and it was convenient to walk onto the beach from the hotel. If you have never been to OC, Maryland, don't expect much from the town. We did some exploring but if we went back, would not leave the hotel. Most of the other hotels we saw were very old and run down and the boardwalk was nothing special. Same to be said of the Jolly Rodger Amusement park across the street - rides were old and kind of gross. I would go back and just enjoy the hotel and the beach and save the amusement parks for somewhere else. The only thing negative I can say is that I wish the pool bar/restaurant was open later. They closed at 5pm and it would have been nice to have that as an option for dinner (and not have to leave the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Finally a respectable hotel in Ocean City, MD...”
Reviews.Author: Sirisly
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting OC for 20 years and have struggled in recent years to find decent accomodations. We've stayed at the Carousel, but finally lost patience with the old, musty, worn interior that is the standard in this resort town. We were about to abandon OC all together for the DE or VA beaches until the Hilton opened. We wanted an experience sort of like a resort where we really didn't have to leave the hotel. We wanted the room to be as fun and relaxing as any other part of our get away. Overall, the Hilton delivered. We stayed for 3 nights and paid an obscene $600/night including taxes for a corner king room. We arrived 3 hours before check in and were given immediate access to the parking garage and the pool areas. They took our cell phone numbers to call us when the room was ready. We were physically in our room 2 hours before check in. Love that! The room was very spacious, clean and well maintained, decorated in predictably modern hues of aqua with dark woods with free wi-fi. The view was great, but not an L-shaped balcony as I had expected. In fact, it was a bit on the small side. For a spectacular balcony view with a hot tub, book a Terrace Suite. The regular rooms are laid out exactly like our room, but they are smaller and you don't have the bay views. The bedroom area was large with a comfortable and clean king bed (with good sheets!), flat screen TV with plenty of channels and movie options, a sink and a jacuzzi (with pretty weak jets) with a window southern view of OC. There was a door you could shut and lock to keep out the kiddies. Next to that was a full size galley kitchen with the basics. From a decor perspective I do not understand why the appliances were white. They didn't look like they belonged at all. At this price point, the lack of attention to that detail was curious. Still, I appreciated having a full kitchen in a hotel that is clearly geared towards families. The bathroom is off the kitchen. It's a dark room, but nice, clean and modern with two sinks and a large shower with 3 shower heads. Personally, I'd rather have one good shower head than three with relatively weak pressure like this one. On the other end of the kitchen is a living space with a table, desk, flat screen TV and pull out couch. This room had a view of south OC and the bay. The pull out was very uncomfortable but our exhausted 9 year old did not notice. The pools in the hotel were fabulous and a big reason why we splurged. The kids pool in particular is a lot of fun with a shallow beachy looking area for smaller kids and a deeper, more aggressive area that featured a slide, a lazy river and whirlpool for older kids. WARNING: if you have younger kids who are not fully independent swimmers, don't expect this pool to be relaxing, even if it is fun. We opted to be in the water in shifts with our 3 year old. The lazy river and the whirlpool are fine if you're tall enough to stand or a decent swimmer, but a lot of smaller children were left by unknowing parents to fend for themselves in this area only to be plucked out by one of two VERY OBSERVANT lifeguards. Unlike many pool guards these guys were on their game, and in my opion they were the most conscientious employees at this hotel. I also appreciated the restaurant service in the pool area. The wait staff was very attentive if you indicated you wanted something and they even threw in a free cup of fruit garnish from the bar for our tired and cranky toddler. In the adult area, the bar is swim-up. The indoor pool looked big and nice, though we had no need for it on this trip. We didn't eat at the hotel, though I would have liked to try their lunch menu. Their dinner menu is ridiculously priced (though you do get a 20% off coupon as a guest) and nothing really even caught my attention. They should offer their lunch sandwiches as dinner options if you ask me. The bottom line is that there is nothing bad to say about this hotel except that I expected more for my money. There was an UMPH missing. I'm heading to St Lucia in February and my $600/night room there comes with my own butler! How about free beach-chair and umbrella rental, for example? How about offering masseuses at a discount to patrons? Something, anything, to make me feel like I'm not just throwing money into the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel-- but seeing it go down in just 1 year”
Reviews.Author: omalley115
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong, this hotel is very nice--perhaps one of the nicest of all the hiltons------I am a diamond member and stayed here on points for three nights with other friends who had a room next to ours. ..We stayed here last year too....however, the hotel housekeeping staff has gone down in their service.....Both days, we had to wait til 5:30 to have our rooms cleaned and laundry changed..when I approached the housekeeping staff--they said , "your not on my list"...when I called the front desk, they say that technically they have until 6pm to clean it---thats true, but you would think they would have a little extra courtesy for a Diamond traveler and someone who is asking for room to be cleaned, but I am starting to think they are more apt to clean the "Paying customers" first rather than those on Points--(it is 500/night )so beware if you are using points!! When I asked the assistant mgr about this, she said the staff told her we had a "Do Not Disturb " sign on the door--a blantant lie!!--and of course, they did not believe us...So, all in all, it was very nice but I must admit, the help is going down hill since our last summer stay...

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a Near-Perfect Hotel in Ocean City!”
Reviews.Author: ThisAmericanTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stopped by the Hilton on our way out of town *last* summer to see if it was all we might've hoped, and it looked fantastic, made us wish we'd spent our vacation here. So when we finally had a chance to get to the O.C. this summer, we splurged, plunked down the $550 a night (with taxes) this weekend, and have absolutely no regrets. I've been to Ocean City literally every summer of my life, and this is hands-down the best hotel ever to grace this town, by far—the quite nice Coconut Mallory included. The view down to the pool and out to the beach from the balcony was exquisite, the suite comfortable for five, clean and tastefully decorated (such an exception for a beach town!), with those wonderful Hilton beds and linens with fluffy down pillows. There's a wonderful restaurant, room service, an indoor pool that's open until midnight, a nice (NICE!) gym you'll actually want to use that's open 24 hours. The outdoor pools are great, including the one with the swim-up bar. Oh, and did I mention the private changing rooms with showers and sinks, so come Sunday or whenever you must depart, you can enjoy a full day at the beach, then shower and change for the drive home, feeling like a new person? I can't say enough good things about the Hilton—worth every penny, cut your vacation short if you must to stay here over wherever else you're considing in Ocean City. My only criticicm's almost trifling, but real: The lifeguards chase kids under 16 out of the large and alluring hot tub that sits at one end of the family pool. Sure bummed my kids out—one even got reprimanded for dangling his feet in the water while he talked to me. HelLO, that's what we came for!!! This kid-unfriendly policy is as needless as it is annoying: Disney, the Great Wolf Lodge, and other massively popular family destinations welcome kids in their hot tubs, and set aside another just for grown-ups. No need to have kids with blue lips and chattering teeth from hours of cold-water swimming disappointed for nothing, particularly at a hotel that's easily two-thirds booked by families and that costs more per night on average than any property at Walt Disney World. Straighten that out, Hilton, and this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Pleasure Staying at the Hilton, pricey but worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: thinkbigger
Reviews.Content: The old saying is true: You get what you pay for. And here the high price tag is worth the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Suites. Very attentive staff, well appointed and spacious rooms make staying here a real treat for our family and a highlight of our OC stay. We stayed in late April just before the prices went up and we enjoyed every minute. Parking was roomy and not a hassle at all, check in to the hotel was also a breeze. Our room was a large long suite with both City and Ocean views and was separated nicely to allow multi family sleeping and activities. The bathroom centrally located was beautiful with a walk in 4 head shower that felt amazing. The kitchen area was also very nice with kitchen utensils and pots and pans for those cooking. We also liked the Jacuzzi in the main room and the girls got in it together with their bathing suits on while watching a movie at night. The 2 flat screens on the wall in both main living areas were great to watch and added a real high end feel to the rooms.
