The balcony was large and we spent a good deal of time listening to the ocean and relaxing. At sunset we went to the other window and watched it set over the bay, another great treat. The location was great and we walked and biked and enjoyed the convenience of being situated so near to the action. The beds were very large and comfortable and it could easily sleep 6 people in the large 2 rooms and pull out couch. The high speed internet and corner wood desk was great for checking email and web surfing for OC events and activities. The fitness center and indoor pool were great, we spent a good amount of time at each. We found the indoor pool area to be very large and clean and enough seating for everyone without feeling tight on space. The outdoor pool was very nice as well with views of the ocean, it was also very spacious. We did not have little kids with us and the kiddy pool area was still closed i guess for the season but it appeared HUGE. It was a grand area for children to play in and it looked like a great time for parents and the children. We had dinner one night at the Hiltons restaurant 32palm and we were not happy with the food or service. It was a very dim lit atmosphere that was oddly enough playing what sounded like spooky western music and our food was terrible and young waitress was rude and very detached. Our meat was chewy and the portions were tiny and very pricey. The first time I complained about my steak being hard to cut and chew the waitress brought me out a 'sharper knife' and plopped in front of me. She walked away so fast we didn't have a chance to tell her we have been waiting for refills for 5 minutes. We ended up sending 2 of our 5 plates back and the manager took 1 plate off the bill completely. We are not a family to complain but the food was just not good at all. We chose this over the Ruths Chris in Berlin due to convenience, we wouldn't recommend 32Palm. I recall us paying in the high $200 range for this room and it was worth every penny. I just recently looked it up now that is dead of summer and it is $499 (and fully booked) so we will wait until late spring again to revisit this little jem. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious stay with great staff and warm and welcoming feeling. You really cannot go wrong with choosing this hotel and its the best I have stayed at in OC so far.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-questionable management”
Reviews.Author: busymomPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but a few issues which were bothersome for a hotel at that price point. The service staff(cleaning, lifeguards, bartenders, waitresses/waiters, doorman etc) were all exceedingly nice and helpful-really impressive. However, the male manager on duty the week I was there-awful. Here's the short of it. We had a few minor issues which we tried to quietly address with the manager; he did nothing more than cross his arms and get defensive, give excuses and roll his eyes at us. He offered no solutions and gave us the impression that it's the end of the summer; I'm sick of dealing with people and we're sold out; and I really don't care what your issues are. A few examples; they closed an entire pool for several hours because a child went to the bathroom in it. My sister simply asked him if they ever checked for swim diapers or rubber pants. He responded, "No we don't, the parents who come to this hotel are irresponsible." We were standing there with 5 kids-brilliant response. I then asked him where we could find some ice cream-the entire hotel was sold out-kind of bizarre. The manager informed us they would not be refilling the carts(this was 2 in the afternoon) and directed us to the on premise restaurant-not a pleasant experience to be standing in the middle of this fancy restaurant in our bathing suits-I'm not sure why there's an ice cream shortage in a hotel this size in the middle of the summer. I also was peeved that we were on a wait list since 10am to check into the hotel. We didn't get a room until 4pm(this was on a Tuesday). I asked the manager why the room wasn't available at 3pm(check in time) and he told me that 3pm is not check in time-it's the beginning of check in time-not a guarantee. I mentioned to him that we were priority members and I thought that meant something(earlier check in?) but it really doesn't-he just kept rolling his eyes at me. Uggh. Next year we'll go to the Holiday Inn-it's the exact same layout(pools and rooms); a little cheaper and on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: MauiloverBayarea
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Ocean City for more than 25 years staying in both hotels and condos but we have never stayed at a better place than this Hilton. From the bell staff, to check in, to maid service they are at the top of their game. The hotel has 3 pool options and I would have to say that their kids pool is one of the best in the country. The option of a large indoor pool for the one rainy day we had was perfect. The hotel is located right on the beach with easy access right from the back of the hotel. Beach towels are provided by the hotel and chairs can be rented on the beach. The set-up of the room is perfect for a family - a large bedroom with either a king or two queens. There is also a pullout queen size sleeper sofa in the living room. The living room has a comfortable chair as well as the sofa and a small round table with four chairs. If your not eating breakfast on the great ocean front deck than this is a good place to eat. The really nice part of this hotel suite is the kitchen with full size fridge, stove, sink and dishwasher. Unusual for most suite hotels. Although we ate all our dinners out we were able to have a quick breakfast and pack a lunch to take down to the beach. We have stayed at some of the finest hotels in Hawaii and I would easily say this Hilton is on an equal par. We would return to this hotel in a blink.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Satisfied!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathyngregg
Reviews.Content: Great location. We had a fantastic time. The hotel was clean and the service was excellent. Our first time in Ocean City. The pool area was great and so was the beach. Friendly staff who were very helpful. Whatever we asked for it was brought to us immediately. The children as well as the adults had a great time. So what they didn't have a potato masher or peeler, I had a knife and a fork. Pricey, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Ocean City Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: joan3boys
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this hotel where we stayed over July 4th weekend and we loved it. The staff was excellent from the front desk to the bartenders at the pool anything we needed was gotten. We are diamond hh members and our perks were given to us at check in and waiting in the room. They are on top of it here. The rooms are beautiful, I won't repeat what others have writtem, but we were thrilled. The pools were excellent, grap a chair in the pool area facing the ocean. With the server bringing you a drink, it is wonderful. Usually you have to go much farther away for this type of beach/pool experience. They gave you wristbands when checking in. there was a couple who tried to sit on the deck and they were asked what room they were in and the employee had a list to confirm they were not guests. They quietly left. Overall pricey, but worth every cent to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: cawllins
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best run hotels that I've ever stayed in. I'll try to keep this short and to the point. I've been traveling for 4 years for my company, in and out of hotels literally 300+ days a year and this hotel takes the cake for most accomodating, best managed hotel. We stayed there 7 days this June and everything about the trip was fabulous. These were the cleanest rooms that I've ever seen. Our kitchen floor was scrubbed everyday, dishwasher loaded and run for us, tub scrubbed and new sheets several times during the week. Ivette was our housekeeper and she was amazing. The kitchen in these units is a full size kitchen with a full size oven, fridge, microwave and dishwasher. We used this for breakfast and lunch everyday. I want to keept his short so I'll just say that I don't really have any complaints for this hotel. We are so smitten by this hotel that we signed up for the Hilton Credit Card to get Hilton Honors points faster so that we can return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkieFR
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a five day stay at the Hilton. Unfortunately, it turned out to be rainy the majority of the time we were there. Had we been anywhere else but the Hilton, the entire trip would have been miserable. Instead, we had a lovely time and the kids had a blast. Rain doesn't deter the kids from the water and they loved going to both pools (the adult pool also had live entertainment and a great swim up bar for the rest of us) and going to the beach. The hotel has arts & crafts activities and movies every day. A life-saver on rainy days. Our 8 yr. old went Clown School, decorated t-shirts, made frisbees, and watched a few movies. While the hotel is expensive, the fact that every room is a suite makes up for it. We had our privacy in our own room and the kids got to do their thing in the living room. Having the kitchenette was nice for breakfasts and lunches. We looked at less expensive options in Rehoboth and other locations, but this] ended up being the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good vacation”
Reviews.Author: mangomolly
Reviews.Content: We just came home after a week at the Hilton. Fred the bellhop was very cordial and goofed around with my son while unloading our luggage. I was dissapointed to have to wait very long for a room when I thought we were guaranteed a 3pm checkout. It was worth the wait. Very nice and clean except our backs needed realignments after the beds. I'm so glad to be home on my mattress after their's. Great fruit in lobby every day. The best oranges, bananas, apples and even kiwi. The front desk addressed me by name every day. Big turnoff was kids craft activity. I saw a note at desk that said 2pm the kids can make pinwheels. My son really wanted to stay and make one so we changed our plans around that day to wait for 2pm. When we went down Joann who was working the desk in the craft room said it was booked. We never saw a signup sheet or a note on calender that said it was full. She told us we had to wait at least another half hour to come back and see if he can get it. Very UNaccomadating for a Hilton. She was very rude and uncaring and really should not be employed in doing crafts with children. Another parent told me a little girl was crying in the bathroom because she got turned away. Not very nice to upset the kids! I as well as other parents complained and Nicole did accomadate us and even noticed that the room could easily fit more children to take 15 minutes to make a pinwheel. We did not eat at the restaurant since we prefer the all u can eat buffet and crab legs at the Bonfire and the fabulous crab bisque at Captain's Gallery off of 50th street. The weather was not that nice but it didn't matter in this hotel. Heated outdoor pools and indoor pool that was open until midnight and big comfortable rooms with balconies to read a book on. Been to Ocean City Md for 20 years and this was by far the best hotel we stayed in, esp. if you have small children who would enjoy the pools and slides and whirlpools. Our last day we usually check out and head home but they have great changing rooms with showers and shampoo so we stayed on beach until after dinner and was able to shower and ride home fresh and clean. That gave us a whole extra day that we don't ever get at other hotels. One thing to note was I thought I heard fire alarms in distance but didn't really know what it was. As we went down hall to go to town, I smelled smoke and looked out back window to see throngs of firetrucks and people in streets looking up at our building. Other people on our floor were panicked and could not get an elevator. I realized that our building was on fire. We ran down the steps to lobby thinking the alarms did not operate on our floor. The firemen told us the fire was on second floor and contained so they only evacuated first and third floors but this had us shaken up since we did not know this was the policy. I later could not find that listed on emergency information in room so good to know for future. Overall very nice stay but pricey but seems that all the older places we stayed at are getting pricey too and the Hilton was very comfortable and nice to stay even in inclement weather.

Reviews.Title: “A place sure to please - look no further”
Reviews.Author: clarkjj
Reviews.Content: We just got back from wonderful family vacation and it was because of this hotel that we will have such a memorable experience! Our trip started off by arriving three hours earlier than planned and we called the hotel and they told us that early check-in would not be a problem. We had a room ready for us on arrival. Fred greeted us at the car and brought all the baggage to the room for us. What a pleasant man! I know it is his job, but he went above and beyond expectations. The suite was spacious and elegantly decorated. The hotel is situated off the boardwalk, but within walking distance. The Jolly Roger amusement park across the street was a huge disappointment. Three major rides were not working (flume log, ferris wheel and gravitron). Seems like they were all cable and mechanical issues. Not worth the money at 33rd street, but if you want to experience the amusements I would advise to go to the one located at the Pier. The hotel kiddie pool was AWESOME. The pics on here do not do it justice. Very warm and relaxing! Well supervised by lifeguards too. My kids (5 and 2) must have done the slides 70 times! I even did it a few times. Rooms were very quiet and did not hear neighbors in rooms next to us. The hotel was clean, beach was beautiful and stay was lovely. The beds were amazingly comfortable. We cooked in the kitchen for all meals which kept costs down. Also, i would highly recommend going to Fishtales for dinner. It is located at 21st street on the bay. Fun for all ages and the sunset was great to watch. THey have a pirate boat that the kids can play on and it kept my kids busy while we relaxed and enjoyed our meals and drinks. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here- if you have to stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: kate612
Reviews.Content: My family and I normally fly far away to stay next to a really great pool somewhere. This year we decided to save the airfare- and give the Hilton OC a try since it's only 4 hours from home. The hotel is very nice. I won't say I was completely WOW'ed by anything specifically- but you won't have any complaints- and there are definitely some nice touches. In early June- the prices haven't yet gone completely through the roof- and the pools are generously heated. My boys ( 8, 11, 13) all had fun in the kiddie pool. There are no tubes for the lazy river. The area would really be too congested for that. We all cut our feet at one time or another in the lazy river area. The water circulates quickly and can knock you around-although there are plenty of areas in the pool that are not rough- and easy for little ones navigating around. The adult pool has a swim-up bar and had outdoor entertainment the one day that we were there. My tip would be to bring along a sleeve of plastic cups. You may bring your own drinks to the pool as long as you don't bring in glass. And there's a blender in the room. This pool is open until 8pm. The indoor pool is open until midnight. The rooms were VERY clean. Comments about it being a little dark...yes- in the living area. But they do provide you with lighting options galore, so you could get it really bright if you wanted too. The sacrifice in natural light comes with the bonus of knowing that EVERY single room is ocean front. We were there during Senior Week, but you would never know it while you are at the hotel. It's expensive and doesn't attract kids coming to party. Another guest did tell me that she was heckled on the boardwalk for wearing her blue band while walking around. I personally wouldn't wear the band outside of the hotel area- just in case. But if you do- sure you'll be fine. Other nice touches....Crabtree & Evelyn products, fresh fruit in the lobby every day, laundry services free to guests. We were even surprised when we got a soda from the vending machine( which is one of the newer ones and entertaining all on it's own - if you've not seen it yet!!) Coke was $1.00 a bottle- or .40 a can. I had expected to pay $3.00 a bottle in this place. My family liked the jacuzzi tub in the bathroom , but the reviews were mixed on the rainfall shower head. Looking for some complaints???? The toilet paper is a far stretch from the toilet. My 8 year old couldn't reach it and needed help. That's about it. This hotel is very service oriented. By the 3rd day, I was kind of annoyed that our room wasn't getting made up until 4:30 pm- but I'm positive this would've been addressed if we had complained. We had a beautiful morning and saw dolphins galore around 6:00am. If you don't see dolphins, I'm convinced it means a storm is on the way. That certainly held true for us- at least. You are about a ten minute walk from the Boardwalk, but there aren't a lot of restaurants at the end- so be sure you aren't too hungry when you get there- because there's a walk ahead of you to hit the bulk of the restaurants. We didn't eat there but heard that Peppers is a 5 star Mexican dive and well worth it. You are right across the street from Andrew's Subs, Burger King, McDonalds- and Jolly Roger Amusements. Additionally, it's a short walk to Fractured Prune (yummy!) doughnuts and Happy Jack's Pancake House. Nothing fancy, but the pancakes were good. There is a Starbucks kiosk in the hotel, but they aren't full functioning and can't make frappucinos there. As for Ocean City dining....Our boys were excited for seafood buffets- which they'd never experienced. The Bonfire was rated high. Not impressed. It's fine. Some things were better than others. Nothing will blow you away. The $19.99 special with a drink doesn't advertise that the drink is going to cost you $3.00 . Not a big deal- but a surprise. Phillilps food - by and large- was better. HOWEVER, I left feeling we'd been completely had. The experience starts when you walk up and must decide on the street if you are doing the buffet or traditional, which has separate entrances. The buffet people are hustled up the stairs - where you are forced to remain smashed up against the wall like a herd of cattle. It's expensive- so obviously you want to eat. The food was SOOOOO salty. I appreciate good food but am not picky by any stretech. There is no doubt in my mind that they oversalt the food to keep you from eating as much. It worked!!! And the ultimate kicker - causing the steam to rise to my ears.....your plate is a salad plate- not a dinner plate. The crab legs are "handed " to you. Portion control??? There is almost no room left on your plate. And the absolute best part????? It's EXTREMELY tight in there. There are lines with no beginning or ending...and they ( STRATEGICALLY???ABSOLUTELY!!!!!) place the plates in the middle of the buffet areas. Let me tell you , you have to REALLY want your food to be willing to wait in line to get to a plate...then back track along- injecting yourself in lines- making people mad. Then ..just try to get your crowded plate back thru the lines to your table!! Good luck!!This had the feel of being in a crowded bar- trying desperately to fight the crowds to get to a rest room. I gave up. It wasn't worth it. I would NEVER EVER let myself be had like this at Phillips again. We met friends at Fish Tales. The kids will love the pirate ship and the sand. We weren't impressed with the $6.99 hot dog kid's meal- and should probably have just ordered our son a cheesesteak. The food was ok. The atmosphere is great to sit and talk- drink by the bay. I can see that they try to get you out of there quickly- since it would be easy to spend an entire night there taking up a table that they could be turning. My husband liked Piezano's Pizza on the Boardwalk. I thought bang for buck Wrappers was good. Yummy pretzel stuffed with real crabmeat....$6.00. The Polish Water Ice was watery. We liked Dip N Dots. Th Candy Kitchen no longer carries chocolate covered gummy bears but they have great sales bins on their Webkinz!!! All in all-if you're going to be in Ocean City, MD for some reason....by all means stay at the Hilton. The hotel is fine. It's just a shame that Ocean City is such a rat hole. With fond memories of this place in quiet Septembers, this family is officially done with this town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TampaTraveler2007
Reviews.Content: First, I would NOT recommend the rooms with the Hot Tubs - the hot tubs are really just overgrown bathtubs - the hot tub doesn't heat the water and it doesn't have any air bubbles - the water barely moves around. The maintenance engineers said NONE of their hot tubs worked. So don't waste the extra money for those Terrace/Hot Tub rooms. If you get away from that part - the rooms are nice and clean, the views are spectacular. The cost of the rooms was over the top - but you do get a really nice view of the Atlantic ocean - there's nothing between you and the sand except for the pool area downstairs. A great plus here was NO HIDDEN CHARGES for parking, wireless internet - no hidden charges at all. Another thing to watch out for is the lack of security at this hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but wouldn't get the Terrace Rooms with the Hot tubs again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at OC!”
Reviews.Author: Eugene K
Reviews.Content: We were totally amazed by this hotel. It was wonderful. The location is superb. The beach is clean and not overcrowded. The rooms look on to the ocean. Each room has a balcony. Every thing was clean, the service was excellent. We would definitely come back to this hotel the next time in OC.

Reviews.Title: “great stay but not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: peonyflower
Reviews.Content: ok i guess i will sound like a hotel snob but.....heres the cons first! i found the living area very dark....gloomy...i like bright rooms at the beach....even the bathroom lighting was dim. shower rainfall is cool but doesnt clean u well! staff was pompous except for vince the concierge...very nice man! the heated pools are cold! no lobby entertainment-no outdoor sitting areas/bar..but your balcony. there is an indoor bar workout room was a joke for the hilton no spa or anything special for a hilton hotel(not that thats what i was looking for) we were told kids activities but werent any....(may 25-31) pros? secure area,clean comfy beds....roomy but geez if people pay the 425-525 in july thats crazy....sorry. we found a nice place to stay for next time thats also nice and half the price..also makes u feel your at the beach and not a so called luxury hotel....sorry guys i just was not impressed but i guess i am picky. i think it wouldve been ok if i was in a city but just isnt a beachy atmoshere.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to be!”
Reviews.Author: Traveladi
Reviews.Content: I am very particular about where I stay, so trust me when I say this hotel is a good one. I came with family and friends and we all felt the rooms were perfect. The suite was very clean, spacious bathroom, nice kitchen area, and the beds were comfortable. The patio connected to the bedroom to view the ocean was perfect! The staff was friendly/ customer service was good. I came right before peak time so the prices were still in a good range. The hotel is not too far from the boardwalk... overall good location. This is good place for families to stay. Anyone who wants a very nice and clean place to stay...this is where you want to be!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: psujack2007
Reviews.Content: Look no further for the best hotel in Ocean City, MD. I have stayed in dozens of hotels in OC and this is by far the best. Great restaurant, rooms, amenities, location, etc. etc. etc. Rates are steep for OC but worth every penny. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was a nice surprise for OC. The suites all have a kitchenette, cookie cutter style living room area and a decent sized bedroom with nautical colors. The bathroom is large with a jacuzzi tub and rainfall shower. The shower itself had poor water pressure. The bedding is good and the TV's are LCD so everything is quite comfortable. Overall, the rooms and hotel have a fresh/new appearance. Service ranges from good (room service was prompt every day) to bad (some staff just seem angry to be at work). I did have a few issues. The complimentary wireless is incredibly slow. (Try the business center instead) The living room area can feel and be dark. Not enough lighting or natural light for my tastes. Beyond that if you are visiting OC this is the place the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing down OC can compare to this place!”
Reviews.Author: pamelamaria
Reviews.Content: Feel like royalty when I stay here. We have been here before and its absolutely divine. We always stay in the corner suites because the view is fabulous. You watch the sun rise over the ocean in the morning and set on the bay side at night because the corner rooms have wrap around windows. Its the first time my children stopped in to see us (both in their twenties) and they had no idea that OC had such a beautiful hotel. I can't wait to go back. Be careful , if you do stay there, you will be spoiled and not want to stay anywhere else , and it is definitely pricey but definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Just An Excellent Hotel...Period”
Reviews.Author: SimplerFamily
Reviews.Content: We have been frequent guests of Ocean City for MANY years now. Almost every year, in the off season, we try different hotels to see which have updated and which hotels can accomodate our family in the summer months. Sometimes we just sample to "get away". During our summer stay in Aug 2008, we stayed at one of our usual hangouts with the family and noticed a new hotel in town, The Hilton. It was beautiful! On our budget, we knew that we could not afford a five star hotel in the summer months, so we booked a room in January- just my husband and I. The experience was amazing. The staff immediately greeted us on the way in and again at the top of the steps. The rooms were very, very plush with flat screens, a king size bed with topper, high quality furniture, a full kitchen and a very modern bathroom w/ sunken tub. The balcony view was just awesome and although it was winter time, the grounds were kept up. So, I could only imagine that the swim up bar and the outdoor waterpark in the summer would just be a kids and parent's paridise. The pool was very nice and it was a REAL heated pool (unlike some of the others in the area that are just luke warm and you freeze when you get out) and it was open until 11pm. The bartender at the hotel bar was very friendly and accomodating and helpful in telling us what other entertainment we could find around town. Quick checkout made it very easy in the morning and a late breakfast at the restaraunt downstairs (eggs benedict) was very, very good. Although pricey in the summer months, I would highly reccommend this hotel for anyone who wants to impress or is just used to being pampered. What a breathe of fresh air for OC!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best hotel in OC!”
Reviews.Author: JOHNF1968
Reviews.Content: First off, I consider myself to be somewhat of a hotel snob. For you weary travellers... fear not the OC Hilton. Look, this isn't Miami beach. Its OC. Its the boardwalk with Thrashers and rides all week long. For Ocean City this is a great luxury resort. Great amenities,great rooms and decent food. Although I must say I ventured across the street to Anthony's everyday for their killer cold cut subs.Kids pool is a god send and the adult pool has a swim up bar with good burgers and live music to boot. My family always goes in the begining of June....right smack dabb in the middle of Beach Week for the high schoolers. Heres where the snob part fits in. THEY CANT AFFORD TO STAY AT THE HILTON! So your good!!!! My only complaint is that there are not enough umbrellas around the pools. I had to get up at 8am every monring and go down to the pool and reserve it with my towel and flip flops on the surrounding chairs.The only other issue I had was about the OC Air show and the hotel coulnd't do anything about that. I love that kinda of stuff but my kids are young and it scared the crap out of them for 2 days. We wound up in the room from 12p-3p everyday which kinda sucked. Oh well....live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “The Class of Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly1
Reviews.Content: With over 25 plus years of frequent trips to Ocean City, this is the "class" of anywhere we've stayed. This includes various condos, hotels, motels, both oceanside and bayside. A short midweek overnight getaway in February was a most pleasant surprise. Not only were rates rock bottom, but the service was exceptional and the hotel a beauty. Upon checkin, being elite HHilton Rewards members, we asked if we could be upgraded to a corner room. At the front desk, Joe checked and was able to accommodate our request. In fact, he was extremely helpful and friendly. The corner room was fantastic - with a large living room with windows toward the bay and the south, a huge oceanfront bedroom with balcony and an inroom jacuzzi. The bathroom was also big with a 3 headed walk-in shower. The kitchen featured full-scale appliances, not the usual micro fridges, etc., we were used to. Our room was very clean and included flat screen TVs in the living room and bedroom. The minibar was pricey, but we didn't partake and didn't try out the restaurant or room service either. Parking was free and plentiful in February. The outdoor pools were closed in February and we didn't try the indoor pool, but it looked inviting. We slept in the next morning and asked if we could have a late checkout. Regular checkout is at 11 am. However, Gale, who was also very helpful, arranged a later checkout for us at 12:30. All in all, this is a great hotel. We will stay here again on any future trips. I would recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great all-suites hotel; Amazing off-season value”
Reviews.Author: DennisNJ
Reviews.Content: Updated, clean, ocean-front property. Rooms are enormous, with great balconies. Fitness center is subpar, but otherwise a first-rate facility. At least in the off season, the hotel is an amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best that OC has to offer”
Reviews.Author: jjsmom6867
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between Christmas and New Years this past holiday. Absolutely wonderful. I am a total hotel snob although my wallet does not necessarily support this distinction. We live within an hour or two from OC and have stayed at many establishments; condos, homes, motels, and hotels. This is, by far, the most luxurious. This year, Hubby and I decided not to exchange gifts. Instead, we opted for a night in OC at "nicer" establishment that we could not afford during the peak summer season. A relative insisted that we "HAVE" to stay at Hilton. He had stayed there during the fall. He is a seasoned business exec who has traveled all over the country. His exact words were "one of the best hotels I've ever stayed". He was right. We arrived Sunday at 2:30. Parking was convenient, very close to the main entrance (it is the off season). We only had one over night bag a piece along with a small bag with snacks and wine so we did not require bell services. Check in was quick and smooth. We headed up to our 7th floor room. The elevator and halls were very clean. Upon room entry, we were immediately taken back by the breath taking view of the ocean, the room decor and ammenaties. It was almost a sensory overload. We entered a sitting area that contained a pull out sofa, flat screen TV, 4 seat dining table, and coffee and end table, and chair. We then entered the kitchen area that was absolutely immaculate with no grease or food stains. Pots/utelsils/ dinnerware/ appliances all in perfect condition. The bathroom was a dream, containing a jacuzzi tub and Crabtree and Evelynn ammenaties. The sleep area was extremely comfortable with 2 queen beds, another flat screen TV, closet, and chair. The closet contained 2 terry robes. Our oceanfront balcony was well appointed with a patio style table and 2 chairs. We had not had lunch so we ordered room service. Very fast service, and delicious. Not extremely outrageous at $34. Very generous portions. We couldn't eat it all. We stayed in and watched the game. At 8:30 we decided to have a snack in the pub. Our cheeseburgers were very good. Morning and the 11 am checkout came too soon! We stayed until the very last minute to take it all in. As soon as we are able , we will return. Our only regret about the Hilton was that we didn't book another night. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “No wonder this place is number one!”
Reviews.Author: MikeM2
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is as good as it gets in Ocean City. First, the rooms- they are small apartments, not suites. Very functional, the beds are as good as it gets. We had to switch rooms for the second night(from no error of the hotels) and both units were clean as a whistle. They lacked any flaws whatsoever, you know, stuff you usually find like a loose doorknob or peeled wallpaper. Well ok, one of the jets in one of the tubs didn't work. That's all i could find! Next, the pool. We visited the day after Xmas and the indoor pool was large, warm, and pretty much empty. Great little bar next door with attentive tender. The hotel restaurant was nice but not our type of food so we skipped it. They have a Starbucks in the lobby which was nice. In all, it's about as good as it gets. Very resonable price for winter too. If i do ever make it back to OC i will be staying here...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: arubasteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Ocean Front Suites 21-23 November for my wife's birthday and the hotel was wonderful. It was much too short a period and we would have liked to have stayed longer just to relax and enjoy the amenities. The staff was very pleasant and eager to please. The rooms were well appointed and comfortable. Only criticism is that some of the furniture was a bit abused, e.g., coffee tables were delaminating. Bathroom was super with the waterfall ceiling shower head. Would defintinely stay here again, but not in the high season as rates soar. Off season is certainly more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “WOW need I say more !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bernie35
Reviews.Content: After a short hike across the street we stayed the rest of our days in luxury this place was incredible ...right from the start it was first class service...The room was amazing the marble, bathroom with the three shower heads one from the ceiling ,the plush robes they provided and you could buy later and big plushy towels ,I felt like a queen while soaking in the in room jacuzzi ....The beds were only fulls in our room a little small for our taste but they were comfortable,the kitchen and living room area were spacious we also had a corner suite so maybe the rooms were more spacious but they were still nice ....each room had plasma tv's the indoor pool was so nice , the outdoor pool is heated which totally shocked me when we got in , the outdoor jacuzzi was open til 6 pm everynight which was nice ....the kids pool is so neat I think they should make something like it for the adults, we didn't really eat at the resturants there but we liked having a starbucks in the lobby everyday , our only complaint would have to be our view we were on the 2nd floor and our view was somewhat obstructed by the outside bar area they said the hotel was full but if something opened they would move us ,we just stayed in the room I didn't feel like packing everything up again so next time we will mention this so we can get a higher room overall it was a very nice stay .

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nlc129
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice, the first time being the week after they opened. The only thing better the 2nd time around was that the Starbucks was open in the lobby! It's a great place to stay - clean, friendly, right by the beach, wonderful atmosphere. The kids pool is wonderful, the people are helpful, and the rooms are reasonable for what you get. We'll definitely stay here again. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: 4kidstolove
Reviews.Content: Amazing. That is all I can say. We had an amazing time in OC thanks to this hotel. It was beautiful, clean, staff were all so friendly. We'd spend the morning on the beach, wander up to the kiddie pool at lunch time...order lunch POOLSIDE! The lobster tacos are...to die for. Play and swim and then head to our room around 3:00 to clean up and hit the town for the evening. There are even activities for the kids, crafts in the afternoon and movies in the evening. We were too busy and the weather was too beautiful so we didn't participate in those, but would have been nice for icky weather. Hotel is in a great location. Would love to go back someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Suites is Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: va2pa2001
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time staying at the Hilton Suites. The suite was just as described - incredible ocean view, very clean, and nicely kept up. It was also soundproof - I didn't hear anything from our neighbors. The pools were nice and we really enjoyed the live music each afternoon and the swim up bar. Being right on the ocean was very convenient. And 33rd St. is a great location because it's central to almost everything. Parking was no problem. All hotel staff was very nice and accomodating at all times. The Hilton Suites is definitely the best place to stay in Ocean City!!!

Reviews.Title: “Has to best the best place to stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: jeffpags
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, as we stayed here two years ago when we came to OC. Same great place, with every room being a suite, you can't go wrong. It was a great benefit to have a full kitchen in the room to make some lunches and store food/drinks during our stay. We probably saved $100 a day with this added benefit, as everything is more expensive in OC then back home. Can't beat the hotel property with two pools, and steps to the beach, we didnt have any issues finding parking when we returned at various times of the day. Only downside would be the variety of food choices at the on-site casual restuarant, which had limited food choices for families. I'd also like to mention that there's a great deli sandwich shop/liquor store at the corner of the street, next door to the Hilton. We ended up visiting Trimpers one afternoon, $22.00 for a wristband for the kids for unlimited rides from 12-6 was money well-spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Services. The only high end hotel in O.C”
Reviews.Author: thetripplanner5
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights in this hotel in August. Walked in and they have a very nice lobby. Room was ready 2 hours prior to the official check in time. Staff was very friendly and they have a greeat guy on Concierge Vince who gives you all the information on the hotel and surroundiing area. Did not eat at the restaurants except pool bar and service was ok. Kids pool is really nice with the waterslides and a type of whirpool which is really fun and a lazy river. Unfortuantely they only had one hot tub even thought they have a kids pool and adult pool. Both pools are very nice but generally you have to get there early to get a good seat. Pool is mostly in the shade after 3. All staff from the maids to check in were very friendly. The room was nice and spacious. They have down comforters and fluffy white robes which they change regularly. They also give you as many towels as you like which is nice as some hotels can be kind of chintzy with towels. Also had nice hot pool towels. Some days the pool was warm where as other days it was not as hot as it should have been. I did not find the lifeguards that nice. Room had nice flatscreen tvs and the maids were very nice and did a good job of cleaning and always came back if you were not ready to leave the room. Did not love the CrabTree and Evelyn products like Aveda or a similar lesser fragrance brand than Crabtrree which is too fragrant for a mass tyoe of place. Starbucks coffee was always good. For some reason they do not call them grande but small medium and large. Never saw that at a Strabucks before but in any case it was nice to have good coffee in the morning and and ice coffee as the day went on. Great location. Right on the Ocean and Ocean area totally clean. only had one hose to wash feet for the whole hotel after coming back from Ocean which made for long line ups!!!! In reality this is by far the nicest hotel with nothing come close as a second. Expensive but you do get what you pay for and the other hotels in the area are not even have as nice and not that much cheaper. I would def stay here again if I go to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip for families”
Reviews.Author: KCandCC
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect trip for anyone with children. We have two young children, and this was the first vacation that actually had appropriate activities for both kids. The suite offered all of the important ammenities for a successful trip with picky eaters and children who still nap. There are 3 pools which include an adult pool, kiddie pool with slides, and an indoor pool. Jacuzzi as well! The area also offers many options for young and older people including mini golf, amusement parks, casual restauants, fine dining, night clubs, shopping, and more. This hotel accepts rewards points so, while it is expensive, it is possible to stay for free. Price drops significantly outside of June-August, and I'll bet Fall and Spring are great times to travel to Ocean City for such a reduced price. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it 2X's”
Reviews.Author: mar0210
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay, last year we stayed for 4 nights. The hotel was great! I can't say one bad thing about it. It is very clean the staff is so friendly and helpful. We stayed in a reg. room it was very spacious.We had breakfast downstairs and it was very good. During the afternoon from 2-4 children from ages 5-11 can do crafts, they also have a movie in the evening. The children's pool was great my kids loved it. The adult pool has a swim up bar and there is waitress service at both pools. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in as far as shore hotels, I am extremely fussy. This is a great family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rchs20
Reviews.Content: My family arrived on 7/21/08 and stayed for six nights. My wife and I have four children who are six, three and one year old twins. Rooms are big enough for this size family, but with two cribs the bedroom was a little cramped. We stayed on the twelfth floor and enjoyed our beautiful views. The kid’s pool was perfect for children of all ages. The two older children rode the slides continuously, while the twins played in the shallow end with us. As other travelers reviewed, get to the pool early to stake a claim on a seat. This was not too bad during the weekdays, but on weekends, it is a must. All of the staff was extremely friendly. Some reviewers have stated problems with friendliness of the staff, but there may be some language barriers with anyone who has problems. We ate at the restaurant, 32 Palm and had a nice dinner one night. We also ate breakfast there several times and enjoyed them. There are also good restaurants that are close. There are activities and movies for children every day and my older children really seemed to enjoy them. Also, sign up for these in the morning, because they fill up fast. We have stayed at beach resorts in many cities. They are very difficult to maintain, but the Hilton does a wonderful job of it. None of them come close to the cleanliness of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK this time!!”
Reviews.Author: momtothreeohmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton at the end of July. We have stayed here before and had a wonderful experience. This time has been a little disappointing. Let me first say that I am impressed that being right on the beach, the hotel has remained in good shape. Upon arrival, our room was not ready and we were told to return in 15 minutes. I returned twice more and was told to return in 15 minutes. On the fourth try we got our room. It was almost 4:30 PM which is after check in. They are so busy, that I honestly do not think they have the staff to support the visitors. Our room was not cleaned until we came back from dinner. We were out of the room from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, which in my mind is plenty of time for them to come in and clean. The rooms are great because you have a small but very useful kitchen fully stocked with anything you would need while on vacation. We eat breakfast and lunch in the room and dinner out most nights. This really saves since the room are about $500 a night during the summer months. I am not sure how they remain so busy since the price is so high. We turn in points so we can stay for free. I am not sure if we will return again. It just was not the same experience as the last time we were here.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money! Great vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: gtvs1616
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at the Ocean City Hilton. I have absolutely no complaints. The hotel was pricey, but overall worth the money! The pools were beautiful, the hotel was well taken care of. I had no problems during our stay, the staff and housekeeping were great! We were there with a 3 year old and a 4 year old and the childrens pool was a tremendous hit for the kids (and not bad for adults either). I would definately reccomend this hotel above and beyond the others in OC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Awesome Family Pool”
Reviews.Author: fligster
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3-year-old son, and I stayed at the Hilton from July 5 to July 7. When we arrived at 2pm, there was no line at check-in and I was helped right away. I was given a choice of a room on the 3rd, 5th or 10th floor. I chose the 5th floor and was given my keys and information, which included coupons for free continental breakfast or $9 off (each) our breakfast bill instead. They also gave us wristbands to be worn at the pools. ROOM – In the living room area, there was a sofa, chair and small table with chairs. There was a large flat screen television and DVD player. The kitchen was between the living room and bedroom and had a full size refrigerator, stove, dishwasher, microwave, toaster and blender. The bathroom was a good size, with double sink and a large tub with a “rain” showerhead. The toiletries were Crabtree & Evelyn and consisted of shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, mouthwash, soap and shower caps. The bedroom was a good size and also had a flat screen television and DVD player. We had two queen beds that were very comfortable. There was a fairly large balcony that overlooked the pools and beach. The balcony had a small table and four chairs. There was a safe in the closet. DINING – There was a Starbucks coffee stand in the lobby that also sells muffins, yogurt, cookies, etc. The cookies are very large and expensive but were good. We used our coupons to eat in the restaurant for breakfast. The food was good but expensive. They had a kid’s menu for breakfast, but the prices were also high. There is a grill by the adult pool that is open at lunch, but we didn’t eat there. RECREATION – There is an adult pool, indoor pool, and a family pool. The family pool is great. It is heated, has a zero entry area, two slides (one big enough for adults), a small lazy river, and splash areas. We spent most of our time in this pool. It got crowded by late morning but never felt too crowded. Lifeguards were on duty whenever we were there. Towels were available at the pool, and there was a bathroom right off the pool area. The adult pool seemed empty most of the time. There were people sunning by the adult pool, but I never saw more than two people in it at a time. The hotel is right on the beach. The beach was fairly wide, not too crowded, and there was a lifeguard stand right near the hotel. There is also an exercise room and a small arcade in the hotel. OTHER – Parking was free and plentiful. There are free washer and dryers on each floor. There is a very small gift shop area next to the front desk. The boardwalk is about 3 miles long and ends at 27th street. It is a short walk from the hotel at 32nd street, but the more commercial part of the boardwalk is approximately 1 mile or so from the end near the hotel. There is an open-air tram/shuttle that runs from one end of the boardwalk to the other and costs $3 each way. The cost is the same even if you don’t take the entire trip but get on/off in between. There are ticket counters at each end, but if you want to get on in between, you need to have exact change. In the hotel arcade, there are many free local tourist magazines and newspapers available with coupons for local shops, activities and restaurants. Jolly Roger Amusement Park was within walking distance, as were several restaurants and fast food places.

Reviews.Title: “Service is top notch”
Reviews.Author: Roman5
Reviews.Content: I recently noticed the poor customer service ratings and wanted to post my personal experience with the hilton staff. Concerned about my 1st family stay in Ocean City, I contacted the front desk to make my September reservation directly on the phone. The individual was EXTREMELY helpful and took a 2nd call from me the same evening to answer my additional question. My family and I are looking forward to our visit and will update you on our stay. Thanks Hilton Staff! C. Roman

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: islands2
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best "hotels" in Ocean City. I have never been to Ocean City but thank goodness we stayed at the Hilton Suites. I am an avid New Jersey Beach person for 25 years and wanted to go somewhere different. This hotel was very clean and met all our expectations. Friendly, room ready when we got there, bell boys to help you, beautiful ocean views. I recommend asking for a room away from the kiddie pool. Nice areas to sit out on actually very large. Comfy beds, large bathrooms and 2 flat rather large flat screen TV's. We had a wonderful time. Starbucks in the hotel. Swim up bar in adult pool. Rumba's restaurant very good. And try the cinnamon bun explosion for breakfast. This was a great little getaway for 3 -days for us. The boardwalk they can keep, way to busy for us.

Reviews.Title: “Parade of problems”
Reviews.Author: BusAndPleasure
Reviews.Content: Despite gold elite status and confirmed non-smoking room, it took 15 minutes to check in because our reservation had been reassigned a smoking room (and we have a small baby). They tried to give me someone else's check-in packet. We arrived in our room, which was right next to the elevator, despite our stated preferences (and status) and very loud. Upon entering, we discovered the toilet to be covered in excrement. When we called down, a maid was sent up to clean it. The internet did not function, so my intention of having a working holiday was dashed. I requested our room be cleaned the next day at a specific time so that our baby could nap, but returned several hours later to find the room still dirty. I spoke with a manager, who promised to send a maid right up, but I had to call again half an hour later before anyone came. Breakfast in the restaurant: Waited several minutes to be acknowledged, several more to be seated, and quite a bit more when trying to pay. Food was okay. Room service pre-ordered the next morning arrived within the stated window but was not hot. Brought up all of the problems (except the food) with aforementioned manager and nothing was done except to offer to send someone to clean. Was refused late check-out (though truthfully was glad to be rid of the place, even though had to wait around for wife before leaving town).

Reviews.Title: “Resort style stay without the airfare”
Reviews.Author: TickledPinkMom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here- top honors in Ocean City absolutely. Bed was wonderful complete with down filled pillows and comforter. Service was prompt , polite, and efficient from the poolside drinks to the chamber maids. Our room, corner king suite, had an amazing view. with an extended balcony (for view all the way down the beach) and windows at all sides of the room except interior hotel side of course. The shower, with one rain style ceiling head and two fine spray side heads, quickly became my favorite room ammenity! Great water pressure too! Little touches like the granite counter tops, big screen tvs and Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries were nice toppers. Okay, so even though we loved the place, here's the cons(but keep in mind it's the OC, MD beach.) The carpet was not as clean as I would like. The kids feet were gross at the end of the night, but we did night-time baths anyway. The pool was really crowded and you had to stake your claim on a chair by 8:15 or you would probably be out of luck. The adult pool, which we did not use given that we had our children with us, seemed to have alot of children in it- despite the awesome family pool on site. We just think it's rude to bend the rules. Overall, an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with amenities and view”
Reviews.Author: jetland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our week stay at the Hilton Suites in OC with the family (3 kids ranging in ages 6-11). The hotel is right on the beach with only a few steps separating you from the two outdoor pools and the sand. The kids pool is an amazing amenity which kept our kids playing for hours. The "adult" pool has a nice swim-up bar but we saw more than a few intoxicated folks making the pool less desirable to swim laps or just hang. A nice indoor pool completes your water options. If you're still eager for more water, there's a large water park across the street. Go in the afternoon for discounted rates. My only con comment is that around 3pm the sun falls behind the hotel and none of the pools get any sun, also cooling the temperature significantly. They have an awesome (free) kids activity program where they do arts & crafts, cooking classes in the afternoon and movies almost every night. Food is a little overrated and costly but as long as you use the kitchen in the suite, you can save some $$$ there. The rooms were very spacious, clean and up-to-date. Room service every morning along with a newspaper by your door. Amazing ocean view from virtually every room balcony. The service was mostly great with plenty of smiles and helpful hands like always getting you an elevator as you approach the door. The only negative we experienced was during checkout and we asked for a late checkout. The lady at the front desk was adamant that they do not allow this with no if, and, but or any exceptions. The policy would've been easier to accept had she taken the time to explain the rule but instead she was very short, and stern. Suggestions: If you're driving, bring a sun umbrella and chairs to sit at the beach. You can also rent from EDs beach service. Park your car underneath the hotel by the entrance to the beach. You can leave your gear in the car instead of carrying it up to the room. The Hilton is one the best hotels in Ocean City. It's in a convenient location near 33rd street with easy access to other activities & restaurants. The rack rate is expensive but if you can get over the cost (or get a deal), you'll have a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, kind of pricey”
Reviews.Author: janearle
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, it was a great site. It sits right on the beach, is nicely decorated and looks clean. There are three pools. 2 outdoor--one for aults and children and one mainly for children. They were both heated. There is also an indoor pool which is heated. Plenty of towels are provided. We booked at bed and breakfast rate, but at check in, we were told that the breakfast buffet was unavailable. Had we known that, we would have booked the regular rate. We were, however, compensated with $18 vouchers for food from the restaurant. Not quite the same as the buffet though. The front desk staff was helpful and fixed all the problems we had. The housekeeping staff attempted to be helpful, but most were russian and had a language barrier. A plus is that the laundry here is complementary as well as the laundry soap. This is a big deal when you are traveling with 5 kids as we were. They also have complementary fruit at the front desk and a starbucks across from the front desk. There are some convenience stores and restaurants within walking distance. I expected the BEST service from a Hilton Hotel and feel it could have been better for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurip13
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we ever stayed in at Ocean City! The room was extremely clean. The beds were very comfortable. Location was excellent. Our kids loved the pool. We were surprised how quiet the rooms were. We only ever heard noise from the next room once during our 5 night stay. I can't say enough nice things about our stay. Also, I forgot my camcorder charger in the room after we returned home and they mailed it to my home for me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the family”
Reviews.Author: hank1105
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and twins 2 1/2 years old) just got back from a great stay at the Hilton Ocean City. This is the perfect place for a family, room was great, kiddie pool was great. This was my first time in OC and there is so much to do. PROS on the Hilton: Room: Great view of the ocean - really setup nicely for families, kitchen was great - although we only utilized the dishwasher and frig. Pools: Kiddle pool was great for our kids. The adult pool "looked" great as well, although all of our time was in the kiddie pool. The slides and everything was perfect. Location: I really enjoyed that this hotel was not on the boardwalk. Don't get me wrong, we liked the boardwalk, but having our room on the 9th floor away from the noice was very nice. Beds: The beds were very comfortable, the kids slept in cribs, which was no problem at all. Beach: Great location, although I wish the Hilton provided beach service as in drinks and lounge setup. CONS of the Hilton: Room service - typically good, although they missed a turndown service, not a huge deal, but still. Restaurants - we ate at 32 Palms, not the greatest, although not the worst. The service was good, but the food was somewhat of a miss. We also ate poolside, which was ok, nothing great. Pool Staff: They only had two girls working both pools, which was tough to order drinks, etc. They did a great job for the area they covered, just would have been nice if they had more people. Overall a great hotel and one that I will stay at with my family in the future. My wife and I have stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui, and many Hyatts along with Ritz Carltons. The Hilton in Ocean City doesn't match up to those, but honestly, this hotel is great for families and people that just want the very best out of Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: vduggan1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely beautiful and worth the cost (about $300 a night when I stayed); especially since you can stay at a very bad hotel/motel on the boardwalk with none of the amenities of the hilton for maybe $50 less. The living room was very cozy. The kitchen had everything that you could possibly need to make a meal. The bathroom was absolutely the best part. The jacuzzi whirlpool tub was fantastic and hit the spot after a day at the beach or walking the boardwalk. Even the shower was nice. The bedroom was cozy and linked to the balcony. If I had to find fault anywhere....the beds are advertised as queen beds, but they are really full size beds. The view from the balcony looked right over at the adult pool and the beach. Beautiful! We got room service twice and it came promptly and filled us up. A nice mild mannered man brought the food to our room both times. The bellmen and the front desk attendants were corteous and helpful. All in all, it was a good trip! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, fabulous!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: debbie1511
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Suites Oceanfront was fantastic. Everything about it was wonderful. I am very picky when it comes to hotels and I can not come up with a single complaint about the Hilton. I stayed here with my husband and 4 children. We were very comfortable in the large suite and the fully equiped kitchen made meal time so easy. I would stay here over and over again!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton gets a thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: mookiep
Reviews.Content: Memorial Day Wknd Hotel Staff very attentive from the moment I checked in. Immediate help with bags while we only had a few for the weekend. Room looked like a top notch villa you see in Disney world. Plazma tv's, jet whirpool tub, over head shower head , dual sinks (granite to boot !). Pricey yes but I was very comfortable...Only Con is the housekeeping wasn't consistent 1st night great, 2nd nite so so, 3rd nite almost a joke . Luckily we were not total slobs so we lived through it. Other than that superb stay and will definitely book again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: lilac7272
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really lovely - the views are amazing and the suites are clean and modern. The hotel dining leaves something to be desired but there are lots of options if you head off the strip. This is one of those places where the bellboy is forced on you so be prepared if you're not interested in his services. The pool was amazing and warm and the ocean was just steps away. I would stay here again in a minute. Based on the prices I have seen, it is definitely better to visit in the off-season when things are much more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Relaxing Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: kimberleeke
Reviews.Content: I want to thank everyone who submitted their reviews on Tripadvisor. Your comments were definitely helpful and truthful! My husband and I experienced a lovely and relaxing weekend getaway at the Hilton for his birthday and ate at the #1 and #2 rated restaurants in OC per your advice. I was typing and typing and typing about all the wonderful details and realized this was too long for anyone to care so I’m going to summarize what we enjoyed. Good: Hotel is VERY clean. Room service that offers great variety and alcohol Friendly helpful staff Great movie selection Bar onsite Business center (for quick online needs) Starbucks onsite Beautiful views of ocean Hotel looks exactly like pictures La Source products (by Crabtree & Evelyn) Walking distance to boardwalk Free parking Sand is clear of uncomfortable debris when walking to the beech from hotel *There are many more amenities, but we hadn’t used them, so I left them out. Bad: Pricey, but worth it for a worry free getaway…at least this time of year

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: BEACYKEEN
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I stayed for our anniversary, and we were very pleased. We had a corner suite on the 5th floor. The living room had a sectional sofa, dining table & chairs, and a 40" flat screen TV. The bathroom was really nice, with dark granite countertops, double vanity, and huge walk-in shower with 3 shower heads. Lots of towels provided. The kitchen was galley type, but the only things we used were the fridge and coffeemaker. I think that it would be much better if they avoided the plastic wrapped condiments, an upscale hotel could provide small containers of real creamer or 1/2 & 1/2. The bedroom had a small jacuzzi, 2 queen beds, and a balcony that overlooked the beach and sea. The beds were very comfortable, with down comforters and feather pillows. (I plan on buying some!) The check in staff was very pleasant. I think this hotel is gorgeous, but way too overpriced, almost $500 per night in season. Outrageous, but for us, 1 night was enough in the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Off Season Getaway at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MomTravels
Reviews.Content: My family stayed 4 nights in March (St Patrick's Day Weekend and a few days before Easter) at this hotel. We booked the accommodations through the hotel website using AAA rates. You enter the suite through the living room, complete with small table for 4, sofa bed, dressers, flat screen tv and dvd player. Some sort of game system is also available. You next pass through the kitchen area (standard oven, microwave, refrigerator and some dishes/cookware) BYO bottle opener. Off the kitchen is the large bathroom area, with two sinks, large-size hairdryer and whirlpool tub. Passing through the kitchen is the bedroom, with 2 double beds (note: not queen beds), flatscreen tv, small chair and closet. A balcony with table seating for 4 is off the bedroom. This is a great hotel. Nice, modern common spaces, including an indoor pool (which my daughter loved on the cold March days) and poolside bar service which her parents enjoyed. Small game room and exercise room as well. Starbucks served in the lobby. Fresh, complimentary fruit available daily. Complimentary parking. Obviously the outdoor pools were not functioning, though the child's pool area looked like it would be a lot of fun. Several restaurants are available within walking distance. The boardwalk is a short 3 blocks from the hotel. Jolly Roger amusement park is just across the street. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: This review is for a winter/early spring stay. Didn't see many kids so I'm not sure what summer brings. Hotel was extremely clean, pretty, ideally located. Ocean front room was so nice and bright. Suite is roomy, beds were very comfortable. Jacuzzi tub was clean and inviting. Fitness room was adequate, indoor pool was nice. Sunday breakfast buffet was very good and a reasonable price. The hotel was a surprise, it was that nice. A great weekend getaway for two!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: RLPM
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Every room is a suite with full kitchen and every suite faces the beach. I love this hotel in the off season. Ocean City is less hectic and the hotel’s off -season rates are very very reasonable. Great staff right down to the maintenance crew. The hotel restaurants are good but over-priced. Great family spot with one indoor pool and 2 pools outdoors. Great hotel for a night or a week!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Unexpectedly nice!”
Reviews.Author: zvezdan
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, suite accommodations are very nice and well appointed. Flat panel televisions and a full kitchen are a nice touch. Large suites, nicely furnished. A great deal in the middle of January for $98 a night (AAA).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for the family”
Reviews.Author: usanewfie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 10 days last summer, and it was fantastic. The kids pools, the swim up bar, the indoor pool, and the rooms and service were a perfect mix with the beach. The staff was very attentive (albeit sometimes very busy). As an example, a cable was broke on the exercise machine in the workout room, and I mentioned it to the front desk. It was fixed a day later. Having the eggs benedict with lump crab on the balcony overlooking the beach is hard to beat. If you are looking for a nice place in Ocean City, this place sets the bar the highest.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest regret was that we didn't book a second night”
Reviews.Author: polarlady
Reviews.Content: The start was not too good, entrance below hotel and no personel in sight. We ended up finding our own way and got a friendly greeting at the front desk. The bellmen must have had a night off, we never saw anyone, but still found our suite and what a suite it was. We were very pleased by a large living room, a fully equiped kitchen area, bath with jacuzzi tub and a large bedroom with another tv, a chaise longue and a great bed. The ocean view from the balcony was stunning and it all was such a relaxing place. We had a long drive before we arrived, so we just enjoyed the suite and ordered in some dinner with a few glasses of wine we had brought with us. We had planned to go on the next day, but tried to ask if it was possible to keep the room another day. Even on a weekday early November it was not possible, so we left with regrets. (They had other rooms, but no ocean view suites and if we had to move from the room, with might as well move on.) The winter price was a steal for what we got, about 100$ with taxes. If we get to be in the area again, we will try to book this place for a few nights and take the trip up to the tax free shopping in Delawere as daytrips. It would be a perfect base.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: sueinmaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get away for a few days and decided on a trip to Ocean City. Based upon postive reviews we chose the Hilton Suites. It was fabulous. The room was large and very well appointed. We arrived on NY Eve and found a small bottle of champagne and two plastic champagne glasses with chocolates, blowers, and kazoos in them. A nice touch. We had taken our own NY Eve goodies to eat and drink, so we appreciated the full kitchen. Each day we had a drink at the bar and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We did not eat in the restaurant, but did order room service breakfasts on 2 days and it was prompt, hot, and delicious. The only downside was that the indoor pool was rather small, but that was OK as we found many other thing to do while in town. I agree with others that this hotel is a great bargain in the off season and we enjoyed ourselves so much that we have already planned to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: ImprezaGirl
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the stay. The check-in was FAST! The checkout was very convenient with the Zip Check out... you don't even have to go to the front desk to check out. Just press a button, leave your cards in the room and you're all ready to go. The oceanfront view is beautiful~! The rooms were very spacious and very clean. It's felt like a mini apartment/condo. There was also 2 HDTV's!!! So, no need to share channels, when you can have your own tv! I can't imagine how much it would cost during the summer, but it sure was great to experience it in the winter for a great price. I would definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation place for the family”
Reviews.Author: johnnyf0614
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days with my family this past September. The Hotel is beautiful, and the staff was fantastic. A Great hotel for families and kids. They have an adult pool with swimup bar, and a kiddie pool with lots of fun stuff for the little ones. The hotel was spaceous with all of the ameneties you can ask for. I highly reccoomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2007
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, ocean front, large clean indoor pool. Hotel suite was very clean, modern, two flat screen t.v.s, spacious rooms, and kitchen with large balcony that had table and chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: ChloeElias
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend and had an excellent experience. The rooms are very large with full kitchens (electric range, full-size refrigerator, microwave, and dishwasher) and ocean views. It was great to have the flexibility to stay in for meals or go out. Our room had a king-size bed and there was still plenty of space to move around. This was definitely the largest room we've ever stayed in. The bathroom was great - huge whirlpool tub and double sinks. And, a ventilation fan! It worked well to clear the mirror. There was also a separate makeup mirror which was a nice touch. They give you tons of towels and kept us well supplied with everything. Housekeeping was the best we've ever experienced. Absolutely excellent. The balcony was roomy with a table and four chairs. It was great to have breakfast out there and watch the waves! They have three pools (two outdoor and one indoor) that are clean and well-tended. The fitness room has the usual selection of machines, all in good condition. Towels are supplied for the pools and the fitness room. They also have a game room - we had fun playing pinball! We also tried the restaurant for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Every meal was very well-prepared. We thoroughly enjoyed each meal - absolutely no complaints. On our last morning, we tried the breakfast buffet. The selection is wonderful. My husband was thrilled to find salmon, and the French toast is fantastic! Every staff member that we came in contact with was friendly, courteous, and helpful. Service in the restaurant was excellent. And, if you need your mocha/latte/frappacino hit, there's even a Starbuck's in the lobby. Overall, this is a truly wonderful place to stay. We recommend it highly and will always stay there on our future trips to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zite7
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that this was one of our best vacations ever and a lot of it was due to the great staff at the Hilton. My husband has special needs due to dementia and I mentioned the need for a quiet room when booking with Hilton on the 800 number and quiet it was. We were on the 10th floor in a corner room and the view is just awsome. From the living room you could see the bay and the town and on the bedroom end was the great balcony and the ocean view. We were also there the week before Sunfest and into the first few days of it. Even as crowded as it was the hotel was very quiet and clean. We did not use the pools since as a previous poster said it was quite cool most days and the balcoy was a godsend being able to sit out of the wind and still enjoy the view. We ate daily at the breakfast buffett and found the staff very efficent in taking away dishes and keeping beverages filled. One diner was in the bar since we felt the prices were higher than we wanted to pay for diner since my husband is a poor eater but we found that to be wrong. We ended up eating two diners there and found that they have early bird specials from 5-6 and the prices were more than reasonable and the food at all meals was very good. The only negative about the main dining room is if they are busy the service can be very slow. We can't wait to go back since being home we miss the nightly jucuzzie and the wonderful walk-in-shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great 20th anniversary experience”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaItalia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary at the Hilton, a far cry from where we stayed 20 years ago. We came back to the place we started....O.C! The facility is everything expected of a high end hotel. Very excited to have our own Starbucks right inside! Forget the coffee maker in the room! We stayed in one of the terrace suites on the end of the hotel, and it was worth every penny. It was very private and very roomy. The only complaint is that the jets in the tub didn't function properly. But it was a nice added touch to our vacation. The pool was perfect, however as another person said in their review, the adult pool needs to be for adults only. Why do parents feel the need to be at the adult pool when the children's pool has anything and everything a child could ever need? The prices of the mixed drinks were too expensive at the pool bar, we felt we were ripped off. Oh well.....lesson learned. The staff was helpful and courteous every minute of every day, which was extremely nice. You expect that type of service when paying those prices. Overall, the Hilton was the best stay for us and I would highly recommend it to anyone asking.

Reviews.Title: “Classiest Place in OC”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveOurLife
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon the Hilton OC's website by accident and was surprised to see something apparently this sophisticaed in OC. The suites are really fabulous. Great big jacuzzi and granite vanity, full kitchen, comfortable king-size bed, nice balcony, great flat-screen TVs. OK, it was a little dark in the living room but what are you going to do? Only complaint is that there are way too many kids in the adult pool considering there is a wonderful kiddie pool with water slides. At one point there were so many kids in the adult pool that hubby and I considered going to the kiddie pool! It is the fault of the parents, we saw. It would be nice if there were a lifeguard or the like directing small children away from the adult pool. Of course the food and drinks were expensive so we quickly learned to limit our pool-side intake to wine & beer and snacks. But honestly, this is a great place and if we got back to OC we'd stay here. For more info and to see our photos go to http://www.weloveourlife.com/vacation/oceancity2.html

Reviews.Title: “Definitely consider staying here in OC”
Reviews.Author: sarah9540
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights just prior to SunFest. It was definitely worth the money! (We paid approx $180/nite.) Awesome is all I have to say. The room was perfect. There's a sitting area with an attached full kitchen and bathroom and a seperate sleeping area. The living room area has a flat screen TV and a couch which I think is a pull out. Theres also a table w/ 4 chairs. The kitchen has full sized appliances and was extremely clean. The bathroom is great. Double sinks w/ granite countertop and we had a jacuzzi tub which I"m not sure if its standard in all rooms or not. It easily fit 2. Only downfall was it was a little difficult getting in and out just because it was deep. The shower was "rain" style with the showerhead coming out of the middle of the ceiling if that makes sense. I'm not a huge fan of those but it was nice. My only complaint with that was the shower water didn't seem really hot, but it may just seem like cooler because of the standing room in the tub/shower. The jacuzzi was definitely hot enough. On to the bedroom---a king sized bed that was very comfy, an additional flat screen TV and a balcony overlooking the pools and ocean. The pools looked great---especially the kids pool. However, it was very cool and windy so we didn't get to hang out out there. The service was great overall.
