We stopped by the lounge for a drink and the bartender was very friendly. Drinks were a little on the pricey side, but we kinda expected that. There was a restaurant, however we didn't eat there---that was pricey---$38 for filet mignon. Overall, this place is awesome. Granted we went in the off season, so prices were affordable. I hear its close to $500/nite in the peak season. I'm not sure I'm willing to spend that much money, but it is nice. This is a definite place to stay with kids, but even more so for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites”
Reviews.Author: NeedSomeSunNow
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights August 26-September 1, we found it extremely enjoyable. We had 5 people in the room and had adequate space. The room floor plan has the same footprint, as many Embassy Suites- other than the bathroom is larger with upgraded fixtures and a Jacuzzi tub, the kitchenette is complete with a regular stove, full size refrigerator, dishwasher and plates, silverware etc. The balcony is sizeable, 4 chairs and a table and plenty of space. We traveled with 2 vehicles, the one parking pass per room is firm, however we never had to park the 2nd vehicle on the street any further away than the block that surrounds the hotel. The 1st floor rooms open directly to a patio balcony that opens directly to the pool deck- so there is no daytime privacy from the pool, the ocean view must be quite obstructed. Something important we did not get from previous reviews- those staying on the lower floors (we were on 5) over the kiddie pool- it can be quite loud with the sounds associated with children playing. We requested a room change to the other end over the ‘adult’ pool, they accommodated the change and it made a world of difference. Perhaps it was the week we were there but there was a strong majority of families with pre school age children with healthy lungs. The little things that made it nice- free laundry on each floor, free fruit at the front desk, free parking, a small business center to keep track of Emails, towels for poolside, the newness of the hotel, the Serenity beds are awesome, two flat screen TV’s each room and a newspaper each morning. The rooms are kept very clean; the hotel staff is over all very friendly. The 32 Palm restaurant generally has very good food (I sent back a cold steak, but had 5 excellent breakfasts); service is good, but a little soft during the morning rush for breakfast (they get a bit overwhelmed assigning tables and getting people seated- we learned to go early). We had never been to Ocean City before and were pleasantly surprised by its cleanliness and ‘tame’ crowd. The boardwalk ends at 27th; the hotel occupies the entire block between 32 and 33rd. There are lifeguards at the ocean most days. We stayed on Hilton Points so it is hard to comment on value. The poolside restaurant, Manana Mode, is convenient with prices one might expect being served food poolside/ ocean side. The majority of the guests were from NJ, NY, MD and some VA. We had a great week and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton OC is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: deltagrl
Reviews.Content: Can I just say I loved the HILTON; I don't think I will be able to stay anywhere else in Ocean City. Although, I do have one gripe, it is too darn expensive. I mean $400+ a night that is just ridiculous but if you are going with 3 paying adults the price doesn't seem too bad. This hotel is only a year old and it had all the amenties as if you were on vacation in the islands. They have three pools: 1 kiddie (very kiddie, 2 ft) which is usually crowded. The hot tub on the kiddie side. The adult pool across the walk way with the swim up bar. There is also a grill (food delicious, but pricey) I bought a burger fries and a mud slide and paid almost $20. There is also an indoor pool which has bar access too. This pool closes at midnight. There is always something for the kids to do. The hotel was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The beds were comfortable. All the rooms are suites, so they had a kitchen area. Which is great if you are on a budget and with children. So, now that I have been here I can't stay anywhere else. I heard a lot of the hotels in OC aren't updated and that is problem for me. OC is suppose to be a nice fun weekend get away trip but staying at the Hilton will cost you like a 7 day vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Fun Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NJ_J0HNNY
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay at the Hilton Suites. The hotel is just beautiful and the staff couldn't be more friendly, professional and accomodating! The check in process went smoothly and our request for rooms near other family members was honored. Both rooms were immaculate and loaded with amenities! The bellmen took great care in bringing up 2 car loads of luggage, baby equipment and various beach items. You can find fresh fruit at the front desk all day long and a newspaper is at your door every morning. At your request, turn down service is provided in the evening including a complete change of bath towels. You will also find candy or cookies on your pillow. The "childrens" pool is fun for all ages! The adult pool had live music every afternoon which wasn't annoyingly loud as I have read in another post. It was relaxing and very enjoyable! Waitress service is available for lunch and drinks. The adult pool has a swim up bar. We did not use the large indoor pool as the weather was sunny everyday. A game room is available for the kids also. We tried the breakfast buffet and it was well worth the $16. Eggs made to order and various other breakfast items too many to list here. It was SUPERB and Very Delicious!!! The beach is just a few feet from the hotel and is best accessible from the ground level parking garage. The beach is not as deep as some of those in NJ. Since it was after Labor Day, there were no life guards on duty. Parking was never a problem in their garage. The boardwalk is 5 short blocks away. Checking out was just as easy as checking in but not as enjoyable as we hated to leave. All in All it was one of the best vacations we've experienced!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bunbop
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by this Hilton. It is new and in a great location. I loved that all the rooms were oceanfront suites. There is a great children's pool for those of you with kids. It will keep them busy all day while you relax. There is also an adult pool with a swim up bar for those who don't have kids and are seeking some down time. And for those rainy days, there is even a heated indoor pool. The 2 outdoor pools are heated as well. The bell hops were ever so helpful. Always ready to push the elevator button, help with that extra grocery bag, etc. A shout out to Fred! Our room was very clean and the decor was excellent. I would even do my own house in these colors. We were definitely not disappointed. Anyone who stays here will love it.

Reviews.Title: “truly awesome resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Desi_traveler_77
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. From the cleaning staff to the front desk staff everyone was spectacular. From the moment we checked in, there were numerous staff available to help with baggage, find your room, find stuff to do. The pools were spectacular. Even on a holiday weekend with with the number of people there it was still a lot of fun with plenty of room to play and lounge. One more comment about the room service. We are vegitarian and called the roomservice at 10pm at night for food. We couldn't find anything on the menu so they made up a vegitarian sandwich. By far one the best sandwiches i have ever had. The hotel is very expensive, especially during the peak season. But now that we have stayed there, there is NO way we are going to be able to stay ANY where else in ocean city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: NYMash
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is brand new and thus is very clean and shows no signs of wear and tear. The rooms are very big, easily fit a family of four into one of them. Plenty of towels, very quiet, great views and great location on the beach and a few blocks from the Boardwalk. We had a plumbing problem which was taken care within 5 minutes of telling the front desk. Compared to the other hotels in the area this is by far the nicest ... but its expensive. The negatives are that when we arrived the front desk woman was rude and suddenly walked away in the middle of our check in which was great because the woman who replaced her was very friendly. The rest of the staff was more than friendly and helpful during our stay. The shower is a bit difficult to get into as it is about 3 feet high from the floor and the placement of the drain cut my wife's foot. For a hotel of this size, the pool areas were nice but they are too small, the chairs are too close together and there are no seats left by late morning. Overall I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “It really is #1 in ocean city”
Reviews.Author: taznwulf
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Pros: This is a very pretty hotel with oceanfront views. very clean. great location and amenities. very close to boardwalk and amusement parks, and number of restaurants within a block. children's pool area was fabulous and direct walk out to the sand was so convenient. Indoor pool is impressive and hardly used. Children's activities with drop off for age 5 and up. Kids really enjoyed kids' movie night at childrens' activity center and wanted to go back the next day but children's activities stop after 8/30. which is a shame since we are here for the labor day weekend. Cons: Not too impressed with staff though, bell hop person was friendly but front desk staff and pool staff appeared rather aloof and lacking smiles or helpful demeanor. are they not happy to be working here? housekeeping did very little to clean other than change towels and add more toiletries. It's a good thing I made the bed before we went out for the day. nothing else seem to have been tidied up. kitchen utensils need to be replenished. we seem to be missing plates. My husband was baffled that there was no bottle opener. Overall, the hotel was great and we plan to return again. perhaps this feedback and our survey card will improve their service level.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msbart
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our two sons ages 13 & 15 stayed here for the third week in August 2007. What a wonderful experience...It is a beautiful hotel, with a top rate staff. From the bellman, to the front desk staff, housekeeping to mangement, they were all excellant. Our room was very clean and comfortable, and when we asked for additional towels, pillows, and blankets they were brought to us immediately. Guest Services phoned us shortly after our arrival to see if we needed anything. Food service was a bit slow at the pool, but it was vacation so the wait was acceptable. The adult pool had a huge amount of kids age 12 and up with boogie boards which was a bit annoying, but there is no guard or supervison at that pool at all. This is maybe something to be corrected by management, and yes, its pricey for Ocean City, but you get what you pay for. Parking can be tough at times, as is usual during the height of the summer season in Ocean City. The Hilton is a welcome addition to Ocean City, and I hope to return there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: ctorre0606
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hilton Suites in Ocean City, MD for a long weekend with my friends. We booked the terrace suite with the jacuzzi on the terrace. Checkin was fine-we got there early so we figured it wouldn't be ready. Finally ready at 3 which was a bummer, but happens. Had a major problem with parking. The room sleeps 6 and that is how many we had. We even had to pay extra for those 2 people despite the fact the room was already 1200. Hilton only gives you one parking pass per room...no matter how many it sleeps. We could not possible have driven with 6 people and all our bags, beach chairs, etc so we took 2 cars. This was a major problem as there was no parking spots to be found down the entire strip. We drove up and down for over an hour. The hotel would not help us out at all and they were unfortunately very rude about it. Having stayed at a different hotel the previous year for less money and getting 2 spots per room, I was aggravated. I complained to the manager who could care less. We finally found a parking spot and left that car there for the entire weekend. Suite was really nice and in great condition however we had to stalk the front desk to get our room cleaned, get extra towels, even toilet paper throughout the weekend. One morning we found we were out of toilet paper and called down. After 4 more calls (it was 9am and with 6 people-it was urgent), we actually had to go find one of those housekeeping carts and get it ourselves. This was often the case with towels as well. Remember there were 6 of us. Pool bar and pool dining was great-what nice people working there! However, we would get there at 8-9am and most of the chairs were covered in towels. After 2 hours of no one sitting there, we would take them off and sit where we wanted to. Beach was great-can't beat the location! Restaurant for breakfast was good but service was so slow. We saw atleast 8 tables ready to go and yet had to stand with other people waiting outside the restaurant for 15 minutes. Once seated, it took an eternity to get a coffee refill or a straw for my juice. Food was good! Overall, nice hotel. But the staff at the front desk, including management are not concerned with making your stay a positive one. We really felt like they had our money (and a lot of it for 2 nights) so they really didn't care what our stay was like. This was very frustrating and for that we would NOT stay here again which is a shame b/c the hotel was beautiful. The management and staff are not concerned with you once you have paid. Pros: Nice beach Nice room Cons: Overpriced Slow service at restaurant and housekeeping Terrible Service at front desk Management not concerned with solving issues Pool Packed and never enough chairs Parking very hard-only one pass per room

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cfgbanker
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay at Hilton Suites in Ocean City. We've been to Ocean City several times but this time was different. This hotel made all the difference. I first looked at the reviews listed before making any decisions on where to stay. We decided that the Hilton made the most sense for our family and based on the majority of the reviews, I didn't think we could go wrong. I was so right. The layout of the hotel was perfect for us. Th ocean front pool was a big hit. We were able to use the swim up bar while the kids were in the pool. There were two pools and a hot tub ocean front. Both pools were opened early in the morning and closed at dusk. There was an indoor pool which stayed open until midnight. I applaud them for the extended hours because I've found a lot of hotels close pools early. When we're on vacation, we like to stay up later than usual and the game room was great. The room itself was extremely clean and large. It was unlike any oceanfront beach hotel I've stayed in. The service was outstanding too. My daughter dropped her sandal over the balcony and sure enough, an employee went to several rooms until he located it. As you can tell, we really had a great time here. We hope to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but $500???”
Reviews.Author: DCConnor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August, right at the height of the tourist season, which is also, of course, the height of the gouging season. There's no question this hotel is a head above anything else on the beach - but folks, this is Ocean City, not Dubai. For $500 clams they should be throwing flower petals on the floor in front of us on the way to the room - that didn't happen. Truth be told, we had a perfectly fine stay; making the reservation was problem free, check-in was quick and efficient, the room (actually two rooms, with an additional kitchenette) was large and clean, and the amenities are also nice (pools, fitness center). Couple of minor gripes: for $500, one should not have to request turndown service - it should be automatic, also, our one request of Room Service was for a late-night ice cream, at which time we discovered there are no desserts on the Room Service menu (ummmm, what??). On the kudos side, this hotel thankfully handles the habits of the annoying, "towel-nazi's", these are the ones who throw towels down on pool lounges at 6am but go back to sleep until noon. All-in-all, a nice and pleasant hotel - but $500 is just way too much to ask for in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Close to Home”
Reviews.Author: Readington
Reviews.Content: Sitting on your private balcony outside your suite, if you didn't know you were in Ocean City, Maryland, you'd swear you were in the Carribean. The Hilton Suite Ocean City is that nice! The all-suites hotel is expensive ($400+ per night), but if you're looking for luxury close to home, this is it. Restaurants are excellent. The hotel has two outdoor pools with poolside service, one indoor pool that is open to 12 midnight and an adequate workout facility. My family and I stayed for 4 nights and we had a wonderful time. I highly recommend the hotel for a great getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for families!”
Reviews.Author: kfitz74
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place for families. This is the second year we have stayed here and love it! Large rooms - VERY clean place. Excellent location for the beach and kids pool and adult pool. This hotel is worth every penny. Ample parking and wonderful hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WDWDolphinFan
Reviews.Content: The notel is brand new and sparkles. The full kitchen is very convenient for people who want to have meals in their room. Our room set-up was a bit different than some that have been described here - the living room/tv area is at the entrance (no windows) with kitchen and bath in the middle, and then the bedroom leading onto the balcony. The balcony was large enough for four adults to sit, with a large table and room to spare, and offered great views over the ocean and the pools below. The hotel had a wheelchair available for one of our party to use during the stay, and even had a big wheelchair that would work on the sand (we didn't try that). While the in-season price is quite high, it is still a good value if you would otherwise need two rooms, or if your family would be crowded in one room - the sofa in the living room folds out into a comfortable bed quite large enough for two adults. The bathroom is quite large, but the shower/jacuzzi can be difficult to get in and out of - the top of the tub came several inches above my knee, and was difficult for our elderly guests to step over. The only negative is the live music by the pool during the day, which was horribly loud one day. Forget reading or conversation - the music was played at dance hall volume. It was painfully loud, and was quite bothersome even down on the beach. This may not be an everday problem - the steel drum band they had another day was much nicer, and not as loud. Hopefully with enough complaints the hotel staff willl do more to monitor the noise volume.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: dcirino
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel _ the rooms are quite soundproof and comfortable. The beach is right down a short bank of stairs. The only drawback for me _ the restaurant is quite small for a large hotel and there was a short wait at breakfast. But that's it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families. It is very kid friendly, with a nice children's pool and a game room.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN OCEAN CITY”
Reviews.Author: EDSALLKIDS
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in Ocean City. The view, the accomodations, the pool, and service were all top notch. Please be aware though, that you will have to pay for it, especially in season. The only negative was parking is at a premium when you get back later at night. There was an overflow lot across the street though. If you need any ideas for dining, the concierge was more than helpful. It will be interesting to see if the property will be able to stay this way, since most beachfront type properties with efficiencies get beat up after a while. I actually did some checking up on other hotels, and most of them were getting on the worn side, and were still charging big dollars. As crazy as it sounds, you could say at $500 a night this hotel is actually a value for what you are getting in comparison to the alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kelybeans
Reviews.Content: I absolutely can not believe the negative reviews I have read about the Hilton Suites in Ocean City,MD, it is what prompted me to write this review. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, 6/23 - 6/26, and had one of the best mini vacations ever. I can't think of one negative thing to say about this place. The room was beautiful, the pool was great, the restaurant was good, the staff was courteous, friendly and extremely helpful. We can not wait to go back. You can not beat the location, on the beach and a few blocks from the beginning of the boardwalk. It is also only 2 blocks away from an amusement park, a water park, mini golf and several restaurants. Our kids, 2 and 3, would have played in the pool for 8 straight hours if we would have let them. If you have a opportunity to stay here you should!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service Not worth the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: AlexBayside
Reviews.Content: Checked into this Hotel on Friday 7/6/07:Day 1: (My wife & 2 little girls) Check in no tuntil 3:00pm Left our # at the hotel (10am) they called at 2 pm and allowed us to check in. Bathroom door did not close at all wa soff the hinges. The screen door was broken, would not slide and the DVd player was not working I called downstairs and was told a request would be put into maintenance. Day 2: aT 900AM As I leave the hotel I leave a comment card with the girl at the fron desk detailing my complaints.All of the above problems still exsisted no resolve no contact. We go to the beach come back at 4pm and room was not made up we called housekeeping & were told that the hotel was at full capacity & housekeeping skipped our room and we would have to wait. When I inquired about the broken items I was told the request was in. When i asked to speak with a mgr. I was told I would be contacted ina few minutes: Housekeeping finally came at 4:30pm and made the room up and left at 5:00pm. Day 3: Returned to the room at 3:45 pm Room still not made up and Broken items not fixed and still no contact from the mgr. I called downstairs and asked why my room had not been made up was told again hotel was a full capacity a request would be put in to clean my room. I said I have to put a request to clean my room? I haver to beg to have a bathroom door that closes? a screen that works? (ok I can do without the DVD player) for $ 500.00 a night I expect everything especially a Hilton that is 1 yr old to be in good working condition or at least have a mgr contact me. I asked to speak with a Mgr and again I was told that I can come downstairs and wait at the fron desk (Line is like 20 ppl deep). I said forget this I called Corporate in California who then put me thru to Tennessee (Corp) I finally got some 1 to listen to me! I said I am here at the hotel and cannot get any 1 from hosuekeeping, maintanence, customer svc or most importantly the manager to help me. Well Once I was on the phone with Corp. things started to get done. I recieved a call from Sarah the mgr. who finally called and I explained to her that it took me 3 days a call to cali & Tenesse to have my room cleaned and a working bathroom door for 500.00 a night? I got better service at The Sleep Inn!. My room finally got cleaned, bathrrom door fixed and screen fixed after 3 days of begging and pleading. I have stayed at Hilton beverly Hills , Hilton NYC, etc. The service has always been the best there should be no reason why service should be this shoddy at Ocean City MD. Pros: On the Beach Huge Rooms (Bathroom, 2 flatscreens, living room kit, etc) All beachfront Balcony Great Location to everything Cons: Way overpriced Food was not that goood (go across the street to Italian place much better) No Service Pool Packed (Always) Parking very hard

Reviews.Title: “Ritz quality. Best from NJ to VA shore”
Reviews.Author: Frank3373
Reviews.Content: Hilton Hotels are a step down from Sheraton, which are a step down from Westin, which are a step down from the Ritz Carlton. Not this Hilton. This is a first class hotel in every respect from service at the front desk, the opulence of the hallways, the soft, cotton bedding and down comforters, the two 32” flat-screen HD TVs and the Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries in a decent size bathroom. The rooms are Ritz Carlton quality, one-bedroom mini-apartments that have granite-counter kitchens with stove, full refrigerator and freezer and a deep bathtub-Jacuzzi that comfortably fits two with a center, overhead shower. The location is a few blocks north of the boardwalk. Easy walking distance is a water park, a younger child amusement park and miniature golf. I have stayed in a luxury suite with butler in Atlantic City, and this Hilton was by far the better room and experience. Using NJ, DE, MD and VA shore standards, the two outdoor pools are fabulous, certainly better than you will find in Atlantic City. (There is a good-sized indoor pool that I did not use). The water is perfectly heated, “ahhh” as soon as you step in, and it allows your kids to play comfortably in shallow water or on cooler days. There is an adult pool, large by shore standards, plain vanilla, four-feet deep. The other is a sizable children’s pool and, perhaps more than any other feature, the reason this hotel is worth the premium price. The kids’ pool has two water slides. One is small for the little ones dropping into one foot deep water. The kids climb up a pirate-looking boat that squirts water near the top. Water pours down the slide giving it just the right speed. My three year old was grinning non-stop the first hour. The other slide is long and not too fast, perfect for kids four and up as it drops them in three feet of water. Features for toddlers include a zero depth entry with ten water jets squirting up from the ground and a side pool area with a rubber whale that is six-inches deep. The hotel advertises a “lazy river,” but this isn’t really accurate. This lazy river is small, and it goes only half-way around, 180, not 360 degrees, so your float is short and then you’re back in the main pool where you must swim over to the other side. There is nothing lazy about it. The river channel is too small for an adult tube and the Hilton doesn’t provide the small $1 tubes that would allow your kids to float. Bring your own. Same with chairs for the beach. Ocean City does not permit the Hilton to provide them. You can rent on the beach from a vendor. In the middle of the lazy river area is something I’ve never seen in any pool. There is a walled off whirlpool of water perhaps 12 feet across that spins the kids around in a circle, the water moving very fast. Kids seemed to enjoy it. The Hilton was sold out when we were there, and the pool was crowded during periods of high sun, but not overly so. There was little wait for the slides. There were two lifeguards sitting high up on chairs. There were lounge chairs available any time of day, and you can from the Hilton pool deck sit and watch the ocean. There is a high-end game room and fitness center. Our housekeeping experiences were very good (ignoring the half-eaten candy from a prior guest left on our refrigerator for two days). With a three-month season, your room is cleaned by college kids from eastern Europe. The negative (least you think I’m a shill for the Hilton): Our air conditioning wasn’t functioning properly. The room at night was 75 degrees, not uncomfortable, but we wanted 72. We complained on a Monday afternoon, but nobody showed up to repair it until 11 am Tuesday morning about an hour before we left. (Checkout is 11am, they gave us until noon). Three degrees may not seem like much, but at $400 per night you should be able to put ice on the walls. The swim-up bar was unattended. There was waitress service at the pools, but they didn’t have ice tea, lemonade or bottled water. I had to walk to the Starbucks in the lobby. We didn’t eat on-site, but I can tell you to avoid the Restaurante Antipasta across the street: bad news, and I paid $24 for a plate of mediocre spaghetti. Comment on the price: Online the price was $429 (Sunday) and $409 (Monday); after June 28 that jumps to $459. Knowing the NJ to VA shore does not sell out Sun-Thurs nights in June and early July, we just showed up. No reservation, and while my kids watched “Finding Nemo,” they have a kids movie at 6:00 each night, we got rates of $349 (Sunday) and $329 (Monday), no minimum stay. Not sure this trick will work in August.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome For Family”
Reviews.Author: Campie
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews are on the money when it comes to this hotel. When booking ask for the corner suite. The corner suites have larger living areas and bathrooms. Well worth the upgrade if traveling with the family. The plasma TVs and DVDs were a hit with my two kids. We did not spent that much time in the room, but at least when we did, there was enough space for the 4 of us to be comfortable. One thing to remember as another reviewer pointed out. By late afternoon both the adult and kiddie pools are shaded due to the size of the buidling. Not too worry, since the beach is right there for you to soak up more sun. The service at the hotel was outstanding and everyone was very curtious. The bellhops were on the ball with the luggae and valet parking. We were checked in and at the pool with 20 minutes of arriving. The Hilton hotel in OC is by far the best looking on the beach. All of the others have that dated look to them. You are about 2.5 miles away from the boardwalk, but only a 5 minute drive to ge there. By all means if traveling with kids the kiddie pool was an absolute hit with mine. We spent the better part of the morning there and when it got to crowded we headed over to the adult pool with a swim-up-to bar!

Reviews.Title: “A blessing in more ways than one”
Reviews.Author: candiedsweets
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a long weekend at this hotel. We found the rooms to be spacious and well maintained and the view was awesome!!! The hotel staff was more than accommodating. In particular a wonderful manager named Sarah guided me through a selection of accommodations because of some specific needs in our family. The pools were relaxing for the adults and the children's pool was a fun outlet for our kids' boundless energy. In addition to the "traditional" ways hotel show hospitality to their guests, we were also able to see how hospitable they are to people who are not guests. An unfortunate situation happened at the beach near the hotel and the manager on duty quickly responded to the people involved with housing and food. That's what I mean when I say that it was a blessing in more ways than one. The hotel exceeded our expectations and surprised us with their genuine hospitality for those that were not even guests. Keep up the good work OC Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: tkf24
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Ocean City, MD every summer since I was little, so I've stayed in many different hotels in the area. The Hilton is by far the nicest hotel in Ocean City. Although its pretty much a newer version of the Holiday Inn Suites on 17th Street, the Hilton is very clean and elegant. Since it opened last year, it seems brand new. The rooms are some of the best hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. First of all they are huge! When you walk through the door, there is a living room with a flat screen TV, couch with a pull out bed, and a dining table and chairs. The next room is the kitchen, stocked with silverware, dishes, pots, etc. It has a stove, oven, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, coffeemaker, etc. The bedroom is also large, with two queen beds or one king. It has a decent sized closet, a small safe to keep valuables, a flat screen TV, and a dresser. All rooms overlook the ocean. Rooms on higher floors have excellent views of the beach and ocean. We stayed on the 10th floor this time. The bathroom is huge compared to your average hotel bathroom. It has a jacuzzi tub and shower, two sinks, and plenty of counter space. The hotel itself is amazing. There are three pools- an indoor pool, a kids pool outside on the deck overlooking the ocean, and an outdoor pool with a swim up bar on the same deck by the ocean. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, where we went for breakfast a few mornings during our stay. There is always fresh fruit in the lobby. The hotel also has a small gym, a business center, and a game room. I've never been to the hotel restaurant 32 Palm, so I can't comment on that. The service at the hotel was excellent. The moment we arrived, around 10:00 pm on a Wednesday night, a bellman came to our car and put all of our belongings on a car. He waited with us in the garage as my mom went upstairs to check in, and then took us to our room. When we were ready to check out, on a Sunday right before 11:00 check out, we called downstairs and got a bellman with a cart immediately. Throughout our stay, there was always someone downstairs to greet you and get you an elevator. All staff members I met were very friendly and helpful. The only downside for me, which could actually be considered a plus for others, is the hotel's location. I prefer to stay on the boardwalk, and this hotel is quite a few blocks north of the boardwalk. I like the boardwalk because you can go to a variety of stores, restaurants, and attractions without a car. There is not much within walking distance to the Hilton. But to families with small children, the location is great because you're away from the noise and excitement found in downtown OC. I love Ocean City, and I love the Hilton. But next time I'm in Ocean City, I'll probably be staying at the Holiday Inn on 17th St. because of the location. But for families and people who are looking for a quiet and relaxing time in OC, the Hilton is absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again!”
Reviews.Author: Brianaerin
Reviews.Content: We just came back for our second stay at The Hilton. I love everthing that the hotel has to offer. I could not ask for anything more. I would rather stay for a few days off season if I could not afford the prime time summer rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctbarr
Reviews.Content: I found this new hotel to be excellent. It is way above the standard for Ocean City. The hotel is on the beach, all rooms oceanfront, and are above-average-sized suites. The bedrooms are average sized, the kitchen is large and very well equipped, and the other room is also a good size with a couch and table. The rooms were in excellent condition (I think the hotel opened in 2006). The beds, listed as kings or queens, were a little smaller than expected but comfortable. The views of the ocean were great, although you'll want to be on the 3rd floor or higher - if you're lower your view will be of a pool. Staff was friendly and helpful but we didn't have any occasion to see how they would handle a problem. Everything was very clean and we found the hotel to be quiet. We liked the location as well. The only minor drawbacks were: a lack of outdoor showers to clean sand off when coming back from the beach; the Starbucks in the lobby; and the lack of a children's menu for room service. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for families”
Reviews.Author: ElaineR
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Suites Oceanfront in Ocean City. We arrived in OC around noon and were allowed an early check-in without any wait whatsoever. The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, as was the concierge staff. The hotel still has a brand new feel to it. The lobby is a vast open space with a gift shop and Starbucks Coffee stand, and has the doors that allow access to the pools and beach. Our suite was on the 10th floor, right above the children’s pool, and had amazing views of the beach. The suite was very comfortable. There was a living room with a LCD TV in it, a kitchen, complete with dishes, pots & pans, dishwasher, etc., a huge bathroom with twin Kohler sinks and a giant whirlpool tub, and a bedroom with a big closet, bureau, another big LCD TV, and the sliding glass door to the balcony. It was the kind of room that you could stay in forever, I think. We ordered room service from the Hilton’s restaurant, 32 Palm, and the food was great. I would think dining in the restaurant would have been better, however we weren’t ready for dinner until the kids were about to go to bed, so room service just made better sense. We visited the hotel’s game room, which consisted of about 10 video games (some of them pinball machines). We were unimpressed so we didn’t stay for too long. We spent most of our time at the children’s pool, which the kids (4 and 5) absolutely loved. The beach was also very nice and well kept. We had a great time staying at the Hilton, and we highly recommend it to anyone traveling with young children. It’s away from the boardwalk, so it’s very quiet. We felt very safe here and definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “THE ONLY PLACE....”
Reviews.Author: melsuebee
Reviews.Content: The only place to stay in Ocean City or anywhere for that matter!! We stayed the week before Memorial Day weekend and were able to get quite a deal on our room! It was beautiful. I am very picky and yet I could not find one fault with the hotel. Immaculate, great pools... you name it. The staff was very nice (except for the bartender at the lounge) and helpful! Can't wait to go back! Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: VALLEYGIRLVirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in Aug. of 2006, the year that it was first opened. We just came back from our second stay this weekend(May 2007) and over the course of the year they have kept everything exceptionally clean!! Totally worth the extra couple bucks to stay!!! The service was exceptional as well as our stay. This is a very well kept hotel with beautiful rooms to enjoy while you stay. WONDERFUL and booked a stay already for later in the summer!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Finaly something upmarket near the boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly_happy
Reviews.Content: Family of 3 stayed for 5 nights. Gorgeous room - all in working order. Had a room next to lift area, yet very quiet. Super clean - every day. Large size suites, good floorplan. Great location - walk to the boardwalk, yet quiet, clean beach. Staff were on the ball, friendly and could answer all questions. Gym room, pool, game room, business room etc super clean. Only problem would be enough parking during full season? Would definately stay here again - well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Price Offseason”
Reviews.Author: scott'sgirl
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with this hotel. It is only about a year old, and everything is new and beautiful. The staff was very nice, helpful, quick to respond to requests like dishwashing detergent. The rooms are spacious, kitchen was fabulous. The balcony was a nice size, with a table and four chairs. We have four children, and never felt crowded in the suite. The bathroom was huge, too. While we were there, the kids' pool was closed for resurfacing, which was a huge disappointment; the kids' pool had been the deciding factor on choosing this hotel. We spoke to the management, and they were very nice and reimbursed us a night's stay and compensated us with a free breakfast in their restaurant. (The food there was great and the restaurant beautiful.) The indoor pool was great, with plenty of chairs and tables. We even ate lunch there one day. We wouldn't be able to afford the summer's cost of $400 a night, but at $135 off season (first weekend in May), it was the wonderfu- the nicest hotel we've stayed in. The beds were comfy, flat screen tvs a nice treat. The beach is very clean. We drove down to the boardwalk a couple times and enjoyed Thrasher's fries! Just in front of the hotel is Higgins restaurant. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: 4loudans
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for our anniversary in March 2006. You are certainly treated with royalty as soon as you enter the hotel. The room was like no other hotel we have stayed at before.I give this a five star because of the apperance and the customer satisfaction!!!! We will be back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great offseason hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voltai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton on 4/23 for one night. It's a great hotel, the staff is courteous and efficient. I didn't have to wait very long during the check in or checkout process. The housekeepers were all polite and were happy to give me any extra amenities I asked for. Towels, soap etc. The rooms were very clean, which in Ocean city is a rarity. The price was a bit higher than I would have liked, and I shudder at the rates during the summer. But for March and April, September and November this will be my hotel of choice for the rest of my stays in OC. For the price in the summer though I think you'd be better off staying at one of the less expensive hotels in town. Like the Commander (157$) or Park Place (184$) Both have excellent reviews

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastDriver
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Ocean City for the first time on Spring vacation and this was definitely the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in. I went with 2 teenagers and my 7 year-old. They used the pool and game room. The hotel was very clean and modern and had the absolute most comfortable beds and pillows (good pillows, not the foam kind). The Starbucks coffee in the lobby was very convenient. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Loved the view from the balconey of the ocean and beach. However, as noted in other reviews, the summer rates are too high for a week's family vacation. I would definitely come back on a future spring break in hopes that the weather is warmer. Since it was the off-season and also due to the unseasonably cold weather, the city was deserted for the most part. Many restaurants, motels and all boardwalk rides are still closed for the winter. Some vendors were open on the boardwalk, such as food, games and t-shirt booths, as well as the "Ripley's Believe It or Not Museum". However, we did the usual vacation activities: mini-golf, go cart racing and also went to Assateague to see the ponies. We loved JR's Restaurant, The Place for Ribs - it was great family casual dining, which was hard to find at this time of year. We will definitely go back and can't wait to visit in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in OC”
Reviews.Author: SunnyBob
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend getaway there. This was our first stay at this hotel, in the past we stayed at the Princess Royale which is a trailer park compared to the hilton. The staff was wonderfull. Everything was spotless, I have never seen a cleaner hotel. It seems they srucb everything down. We stayed on a high floor and the views were to die for. Wow!!! Spent a little more money, not much compared to other hotels ($10 more than other area hotels) and enjoy this property. Good job hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are Small!”
Reviews.Author: flafan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton spring break. Although nice, we prefer the Holiday Inn suites since they are actually on the boardwalk. The hotels are nearly identical in all other ways. Although nice, we would never pay summer rates for either.. It's hard to believe that Ocean City can get these kind of prices. We were very surprised at the size of the beds. King size beds are not standard king dimensions. When I contacted front desk about this, I was told it was a "small king". Management explained that Hilton has a hospitality size. The king size is really more like a queen. And I was told that their queens are not standard queens either. I didn't care for their Serenity bed for comfort ,as well. It just felt sort of lumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel and Suites, I loved it I will go no where else.”
Reviews.Author: PRECIOUS0827
Reviews.Content: I visit this location on March 27th and 28th it was wonderful. The rooms where very clean, the beds slept like you where on pillows. All the rooms are Oceanfront, and the staff was excellent and very friendly. I was shocked and surprised by the service. This hotel make you not want to go home. I recommend this hotel to anyone that want to get there moneys worth. I will stay here everytime I visit ocean city. I refuse to stay any where else..

Reviews.Title: “It's hard to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: letsgotothebeach
Reviews.Content: After three stays this winter at the Hilton, I figured it was time I share my experiences! We stayed there with our 2 children in December, without kids in January, and I just returned from a weekend with the girls all at the Hilton. This is by far the greatest hotel I have ever been to. The rooms are spacious and lovely. We had five women in our last suite, and it was not crowded at all. We called guest services several times to get extra supplies, and each time they were at our door in under five minutes....no exaggeration. One night we had seafood in our suite, and I called to find out where I could take the smelly trash. Someone came to the room withour being asked and disposed of it for us. The staff is friendly and polite and will bend over backwards for you. After three stays, I really felt as if I was visiting old friends. MaryAnne is one of the managers and is just wonderful. We even felt like the bell hops were our friends. They will meet you at your car as soon as you park to help with your luggage. The only dowfall is it's way too expensive to visit in the summer months at over $400 a night. What a great off season getaway, though!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Conway733
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Hilton. Having stayed at many hotels in OCM, we agree this has been the best yet! The room was very spacious and had a full size kitchen, and all rooms had a nice ocean view. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and would do anything to make your stay enjoyable! We will definitely return to the Hilton Suites!

Reviews.Title: “a real resort”
Reviews.Author: wavelets
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hilton on February 16th. What a nice hotel! The rooms were spacious and beautifully furnished. Our room (on the ninth floor) had a wonderful view of the ocean. The hotel, itself, was very pretty and the restaurant and lounge were good. We had dinnner and breakfast there. The staff were all very pleasant. I don't know if I'd spend $400 a night (in season), but it is a great off season getaway!

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of time!”
Reviews.Author: NjBeachmom
Reviews.Content: Well I should have written this some time ago, but I just didn't have the time. We were supposed to stay the last week in August of '06. I had requested a high floor when I made the reservation. We were given pool side. I wasn't paying $300+ a night to look at hairy backs & big butts, AND we had NO OCEAN VIEW! We were told to call them in the morning to see if they had any cancelations, and we told them that it wasn't our mistake so they needed to call us. Of course we didn't get a call, but we started to look elseware to spend the end of our summer. We ended up leaving the next day & traveling through Maryland & up inro PA to go to the Hershey Hotel (now that is a place that's worth the money!). We stopped in Chesapeak City, MD for luch and had a great meal on the waterfront. I guess we were lucky in the end... we missed the hurricane that came through that week. The hotel rooms at the Hilton were much smaller than they appear on the website. The resturant was slow and overpriced. The free continnental breakfast was a joke. You couldn't get a seat because the resturant is so small. A two hour wait doesn't work when you have small children. The other thing I thought to be cheesey was that they had plastic plants throughout the hotel. It is a nice building, so why the fake plants? I realize that is being very nit-picky, but it just added to the whole bad experience. I guess for Ocean City, MD the Hilton is the best place, but we had never been to Ocean City before. I was happy we only stayed one night. It was seedy. We have a 6 & 9 year old, so we went to the Jolly Roger amusement park that one night. That was small and nice. If you are looking for a beachy town near a boardwalk on the East coast there are better places to go! I'm from NJ and the beaches there clean & very nice. Try VRBO.com and look up homes in Lavallette, Manasquan, Seaside Park (not Seaside Heights!), Spring Lake, Sea Girt, Normandy Beach, Bay Head, Mantaloking & Ocean Beach (unit III is the nicest family section). All of these towns have lovely family beaches and have a 5-10 minute drive to an amusement boardwalk. If you go a trip to Island Beach State Park is a must. It's a beautiful beach with two main beach areas with lifegaurds. The reat of the area is in its natural state. It's magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say?”
Reviews.Author: 1BJ1987
Reviews.Content: I don't know what more I could add the these other reviews. My family had a great stay in this hotel. It's beautiful! The view is amazing! The staff - very accomodating. There's even a Starbucks in the lobby! What more could we want? ; )

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - Ocean City's BEST Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg_C_Thompson
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip to the Hilton in Ocean City, MD. Having traveled to Ocean City for business over the last 7+ years, this is by far the best hotel I have stayed at. The Hilton is a beautiful building with friendly staff. I will definitely return on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: TAmember10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Christmas eve and christmas day, right on my way from all the 'elegance of New York times square'. OC Hilton is Excellent, you can't go wrong. Check in took less than a minute, everything was all ready on arrival (i'm Hilton honors, but would assume it works the same for everyone). The check in area is very well decorated, facing the ocean, just the right welcome to ocean city. Staffs are very courteous, pleasant and professional. Suites are well appointed (see photos), very clean and fresh. Elevators are quite efficient, large waiting area overlooking the bayside. Restaurant is perfect, had christmas dinner and it was very well presented and delicious. Very well trained wait staff. Breakfast was very nice in a very relaxing atmosphere. Indoor pool was just the place to be after a long day. Rates were very reasonable, discounted for winter, but I would be willing to pay full rate any time. Check out is fully automated. I've travelled a bit and been places (see profile), I think Hilton has done a really good job with this one. Very nice property. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: nicholsp
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend a stay at the Hilton in Ocean City. The king suite room was amazing with 2 40" flat screen wall mounted TVs, king size bed, full kitchen, living room, and Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. We ordered room service for breakfast and it was outstanding and also received a follow up call asking if our breakfast was up to our standards. The hotel restaurant is not recommended. It had a very small menu and was overpriced for the quality of the food but portions were pretty big, but not so good. Even though we stayed during the off season, there were still plenty of restaurants, sports bars, and pubs open. We visited Buxy's Salty Dog Saloon and it was a great time. The locals were friendly, beer well priced, and food was ok. We also ate and drank at Seacrets. It had great Jamaican cuisine, numerous bars, a live band, and also included a night club. We don't recommend Booty's Bar & Grill, the crowd was slow and old. All in all our trip was good. We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back”
Reviews.Author: LaurenHutch
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at the desk by a very friendly woman who recommended a few restaurants in town, the service was extremely welcoming and kind. Our Room was the oceanfront King suite. It was extremely clean and comfortable. The kitchen was equipped witha dishwasher and coffee maker, we weren't expecting it to have everything from pots and pans, plates,glasses, wine glasses, and even silverware and a corkscrew. There were 2 plasma tvs in each room and a fabulous jacuzzi tub which was also very clean. Our balcony looked out to the ocean and the heat would automatically turn on if the door to the balcony was closed. We woke up to a view of the sun rising from our king size bed. It was lovely. We noticed the service was above average. An employee had seen us coming from outside and hit the elevator button for us before we even entered the hotel. There was an indoor pool and a fitness center as well as a game room. I was pleased with everything and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The very best in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: jrzj42
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the hotels/motels in Ocean City and the Hilton is by far the very best. I had a Terrace Suite with the hot tub located on the 11th floor (second from the top). The room was very clean, furnishings were in top condition and the size of the terrace, with a 4-person hot tub, was fairly large and can easily accommodate a dozen adults. The room had a well stocked kitchen – 4 person place-set with plenty of pots/pans and utensils, full size refrigerator and stove/oven. I found the staff to be friendly and quite attentive. The restaurant was a bit small and the quality of the food was slightly above average as well as the price, but that’s typical of the higher-end hotels. I only had one issue which was no heat in the room. The system had been turned-over to A/C because of the warm weather during the week (at the end of November). This was quickly resolved well within 20 minutes and at 9:30pm. The heating & A/C technician (a woman – good for her!) was apologetic for the interruption and quickly switch the unit back over to heat. I didn’t use the pool but it appeared to be very popular with families. The bar is of a good size (maybe about 30 people) and can serve from the restaurant menu. There is also a well equipped exercise room and arcade. I didn’t have a problem parking adjacent to the building and the facility has a large over-flow lot just across the street – short 2 minute walk at most. The Hilton is definitely the choice for me on future trips to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “building terrific, service OK”
Reviews.Author: WaterEnthusiasts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in November 2006 to attend a family function in the area. The building is beautifully appointed with many nice physical amenities. We were very comfortable in the room, and the breakfast was good. Ocean City's general local standards of hotel and restaurant service are low and unsophisticated, in my opinion, and Hilton staff was maybe a bit friendlier than most in OC, but service standards did not seem to reach the level that one would expect to be commensurate with such a nice facility if it were located in a more competitive travel market, such as Chicago or DC, for example. When we parked and walked up to the entrance, dragging our stuff, there were a few employees standing around the door smoking and gabbing. They looked like loiterers. One appeared to be there as uniformed bell staff, not smoking. We were not greeted, assisted with the door, or offered help with our stuff. When we opened the pull-out couch at 10 p.m. to put a child to bed, it was not made up. We called the desk and were told to make it up ourselves, using sheets in the closet. I did not see the sheets in the closet. A lady delivered a set, nicely encased in plastic. She meant to hand me the case and walk away. I asked her to make it up, and she did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Views, Ammenties & Decor”
Reviews.Author: 1Paisgirl
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful weekend at the beach. The Hilton hotel is just beautiful and rooms are georgous! I loved the contempory decor and the amount of space they have. Our room featured a large bedroom, full kichen, jacuzzi tub and spacious living/dining room. Bonus, our room had a patio off the bedroom with a gate. I am assuring if you are there during the summer you can open the gate because it leads right out to the kids pool. What a great pool they offer for the kids with slides and all. The adult pool offers a swim up bar, but both have great views. The indoor pool is spacious and heated with a window to the bar so you can get drink service while relaxing at the pool, which is open until midnight. The restaurant there is also very good but somewhat pricey for a family with kids. My kids favorite part of the hotel was turn down service in which they left chocolate cookies for them as well as the free fruit basket (in hotel lobby) which was replenished throught the day. If you have kids like us I would recommend a room on the main level because everything is very accessible and close.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel Entirely Too Good for O.C.”
Reviews.Author: EarthyBarbara
Reviews.Content: This new world-class Hilton Hotel which opened in May 2006 is entirely too good for O.C. Already, the locals (non-guests) are regularly taking advantage of the indoor pool. The majority of O.C. clientele are party-animals or lowlife who could not appreciate such fine accommodations. Case in point, already guests and large groups have trashed their rooms and destroyed such as things as busting the 32-inch LCD flat-screen TV's mounted to the walls. This and the indoor pool issue are according to hotel staff. In O.C., hotel furnishings and accessories have to be nailed down in order to prevent theft, or unworthy of being stolen. The beautifully appointed two-bedroom suites with completely furnished kitchen will be stripped down to bare bones in no time. The hotel will spend an inordinate amount of money trying to replace stolen items from the hotel rooms, not to mention damages to the rooms and premises. This fantastic Hilton Hotel is out of place in O.C., and will be unappreciated by most guests. This posh hotel belongs on an upscale exotic island and not in O.C. for the party-crowd to reek havoc. In 2 years, this new hotel will have to be completely remodeled, especially after a couple spring breaks. At least we had the opportunity to see the hotel at its finest. That will all soon change thanks to guests who could never appreciate or respect such magnificent accommodations. People who would trash such a great hotel have no respect for themselves. Such a pity.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel by the sea!”
Reviews.Author: DCmetrodogmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I saw this hotel ranked so highly on this website, so I checked Hilton.com and got a rate of just $80/night. We got a non-smoking double-queen (albeit not a king, but who cares--the sheets/comforter were heavenly like Westin's). Our room had a wonderful balcony overlooking the ocean, which soothed us to sleep each night. In the morning, we walked the 5 blocks down the beach and went to the Boardwalk. We liked the bathroom and the service, and disagree with the reviewer who bemoaned both. The bathroom was clean and spacious and stocked with tons of towels. The concierge helped us figure out what to do. Possible downsides: -The indoor pool had a strong chlorine smell, but we didn't use it. -OC in the winter is kind of empty, but we had a nice time and enjoyed Fausto's restaurant across the street. Final conclusion: We loved the Hilton and for $80/night on the Thursday and Friday of Veteran's Day weekend, we would definitely go back. We just wish we could afford to go during the summer, as the room would be a choice base from which to enjoy the beach. Also, you have to admit that this hotel has to be the nicest, most luxurious hotel in the sea of aging, ratty OC hotels/motels. Happy vacationing!

Reviews.Title: “Really Impressed”
Reviews.Author: blacksred
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in a corner suite we had booked the romance package. Check in was fast and easy, as we were taking our bags to the elevator an employee quickly offered to help us and took our bags to the room. The room was ready when we got there and was extremely nice, the champagne was chilled and the jacuzzi was freshly cleaned. After an hour the manager called our room to ask if we needed anything and was extremely nice. We ordered breakfast in our room as it came with the package and the front desk had forgotten to give us the coupons needed for this, so we had to call down and give verbal confirmation. The front desk profusely apologized and gave us free cocktails for the inconvience. The indoor pool was nice and clean we were the only ones in it. Towels were at a ready supply. We will definitely be going back. Off season of course because we could not afford to go during the summer when the room we were staying would normally cost $500/night

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamasanlrn
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just got home from spending one night at the hotel. We have never stayed at a Hilton before. We are Marriott rewards members and have always stayed in their chain hotels, but I wanted to see what the Hilton was all about. I booked a terrace suite with balcony and private hot tub. The only reason I booked this particular room was for the hot tub and for the duration of our stay.....the hot tub did NOT work. When we got to our room, we went outside to check it out and look for directions on how to use it....well, there were none to be found. I noticed pieces of rubber and plastic rings laying on the edge of the tub and had a feeling those pieces belonged to the drain stopper. My fiance decided to fill the tub up later that afternoon and could not keep the tub full, so he called the front desk and they sent a man to help us. He confirmed that the drain plug was broken on the tub and he would need to get a temporary stopper to close the hole. This would mean we would have to get all the way into the tub with it full of water to drain it. Well, we would have been able to do that, had the temperature risen above 75 degrees!! We had it set to go up to the highest temperature which was 104 degrees. After waiting for an hour and a half, it never reached a temperature above 80. So we assumed the heating element was broken as well as the drain and both of those things made it impossible for us to use it in 30 degree weather on the top floor!! The following morning I went to the front desk and complained about the hot tub situation and the lady adjusted our bill to a "regular" room rate. I thought all had been taken care of until today when I recieved my credit card statement showing an additional charge of 150.00 billed to my card. When I called and asked about the charge, the girl tells me the charge was for 2 bathrobes. Bathrobes???? There were NEVER any bathrobes IN our room...believe me, we looked all over for them when we decided to go and check out the hot tub! Now I am being charged for something I have never seen or asked for or used!!!!! When I asked to speak to a manager, the girl tells me everyone has left for the day and someone would get back with me tomorrow. I told her this was unexceptable and she went to look for the front desk manager. ( I thought no one was there?) When she got back on the phone, she tells me he is busy and will have to call me back when he gets a "chance". I am absolutely FURIOUS about my entire Hilton experience and I have called the corporate office. I am awaiting response to an email that was sent to the general manager of this property. The employee I spoke with today was rude and made no effort to help the situation. I never got an apology from ANYONE about the hot tub situation, let alone the false charges billed to my card.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Navy89
Reviews.Content: Our initial welcome to the Hilton Suites by "Mary" was less than impressive and we were worried it might set the tone for our long weekend. We were pleased to find everyone else employed there had the utmost respect for guests and were extremely friendly. Our room was superb! The beds with their goose down comforters were wonderful and listening to the ocean all night as we slept was soothing. We were able to take advantage of the beautiful indoor pool. We had read a review about foam in the pool. This is generated by the jets shooting across the pool and was not any kind of pool scum as another writer expressed. The pool and pool area was extremely clean with beautiful palm trees. Housekeeping service was spectacular. We had a fantastic family vacation with 3 kids and would definitley go back again on reduced rates. Like other reviews, we would certainly NOT be able to pay the almost $500 a night rate. Since our stay was in mid-October, we were able to take advantage of a special rate.

Reviews.Title: “Stay overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: Aljabs
Reviews.Content: Ocean City MD is certainly not a world class resort town but has nice beaches and a family-friendly atmosphere. The brand new Hilton was our choice and was a "splurge" at over $150 per night. The oceanfront location is great, the suites are beautiful. My husband and son loved the flat panel wide screen tv's (2) and the bath with whirlpool tub was a luxury, although not very well lit. Service issues included a breakfast room service tray which sat outside of our door for over 24 hours and the room service server who's personal hygiene was less than desirable - I honestly had to hold my breath when he came into our suite. Otherwise, we enjoyed the pools, Starbucks in the lobby and our ocean front balcony. We were never sent a survey from the brand, which we thought was a requirement. No one asked us how our stay was at check out, but I would say overall it was above average mostly due to the "newness" of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: nlfissel
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Hilton Suites over the Columbus Day weekend for two nights. The hotel was terrific! The suites are spacious, quiet, comfortable, very clean, and with many amenities to aid you in relaxation. The suites have LCD TVs, very comfortable beds, jacuzzis, and a large oceanfront balcony, with a nice table and four chairs, which is big enough for four people to dine at. The staff was very gracious and eager to please. We will definately return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but the Beds Wahoo!”
Reviews.Author: treki999
Reviews.Content: Rooms: 2 ceiling fans, large beds with feather pads, feather pillows, feather blanket, small kitchen round table, high speed in the main room. Need wireless throughout. Bathroom: Large tub, easy to slip getting into it. 2 sinks with 2 drawers for the extras. Large Large space to move around. Kitchen: Large Refrig. Large/Med microwave. Dishwasher. Fullly stocked utensils. Balcony: Oceanfront: You cannot see nor hear your neighbors. It's large enough to have a poker game and two people laying in chaise chairs. Pool: The pools large and warm. I wish the kids pool was bigger. Whirlpool is great along with the lazy river. Both have a STRONG current so do not let your child go alone. Hot tub on the kids pool. Waiters to take your drink and food orders by the adult pool. Also swimup bar with stools. both pools are heated.

Reviews.Title: “Room with Jacuzzi on the Balcony”
Reviews.Author: emd1
Reviews.Content: There are long reviews on here and I agree that the hotel is luxurious and very nice. I wanted to add my review because we stayed in one of the 6-7 rooms that have a private 6 person jacuzzi on the outdoor balcony. These rms. are on the right side of the hotel if you are on the beach looking at the hotel. The ooutdoor jacuzzi's are on a bump-out balcony area on the side of the rm. They are not hot tubs; they are jacuzzi tubs that you fill up every time you want to use them w/hot water from a spout, then you can set the temp to what you want and turn on the jets. No chemicals which is nice, fresh water every time, and you can wipe out the tub when it is empty. Very nice. I paid $379 by booking AAA rate soon after they opened in June; my stay was August 28-31. We were there the day of Storm Ernesto's fury and rain water came into the oceanfront patio door although it was closed tight, soaking the carpet about 5 ft. into the room. They will have a big big problem if Ocean City gets a bigger storm w/more rain than this one. Complaints: Staff was pretty clueless. We were told that there is no place to park bikes if you bring bikes w/you, that we'd have to take them into our room so we didn't take our bikes. Wrong- there is a bike rack in the underground parking area. There were no instructions for using the outdoor jacuzzi (where is the switch to turn it on, where is the plug), and no one at the service number knew either. There was hotel guide in the rm and when I called for one I was told the guests had been taking them and they were out (? taking them?). Restaurant service was bad at breakfast. I suggest going across the street to the little hotel's breakfast place, inexpensive good food and great service. Also, the indoor pool had a lot of nasty bubbly foam in it. We were reluctant to use it as it looked wrong to us. Service man told us it was fine but coudl not say what it was. We didn't believe him- it looked like dirty chemical suds all around the pool, lots of it. It is convenient to be able to walk outside the hotel to the beverage store, another hotel for inexpensive breakfast, a convenience market on the hwy., the Italian restaurant for dinner, and a few blocks to the baordwalk tram, without ever driving. I've rarely pay this much for a room. But if you are going to splurge, this is a very nice room. Just don't expect answers to your questions.

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: iluvgrits
Reviews.Content: Went the week-end after Labor Day when the rates went down by almost half. It is a new hotel and had all the latest high-tech features including 2 flat-screen TV's on the wall and a DVD player in each suite. It was very spacious with an awesome and large bathroom. The beds were heavenly as were the pillows. The view from the bedroom & balcony (9th floor) was beautiful. The amenities were fabulous. Especially loved the swim -up bar at the end of the adult pool and the outside grill where you could order lunch and have it delivered right to your pool -side lounge chair. Yes, I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and fantastic pools”
Reviews.Author: lynett
Reviews.Content: Our stay started out as a disappointment. But I must say that after talking to the assistant manager the next day all problems were addressed and handled immediately. We found most employees went out of their way to be jovial and make this a happy place to be. We found very few that needed to realize that people want a smile and to be acknowledged. The rooms are beautiful, with Jacuzzi tubs (amenities include bath salts), small kitchens, with all imaginable appliances including toasters, blenders and can openers. Each room is oceanfront with a huge balcony that holds a patio table and four chairs (very unusual), gorgeous views of the sunrise and watching the dolphins play. The pools are fantastic; I even did the slide when no kids were around. It was a blast. What no one else has said is the pools are heated to about 85 degrees and comfortable to be in at all times. The pool restaurant was great and well staffed at all times; special people included Jay, Scott, Gene, and the cooks. They always had a smile and would talk to you if you took the time to speak with them. And the swim up bar, always filled with adults. We never used the indoor pool, but it looked nice with jets shooting across it. The entrance is on the ground floor and you have to go up a floor to the lobby. It is all done in marble. Check in could have been better, but as I said that was handled the next day. We arrived the day after hurricane Ernesto and they were still cleaning the place up and I think that affected everyone’s mood. It was pretty frightening for them, but everyone was quite professional. Being there Labor day week we were inundated by parents who decided it would be a great week to take the under five crowd. Being older (50 and grown kids) we got tired of parents who did not discipline there kids at breakfast (several mornings we listened to kids scream at the top of their lungs for a full hour at breakfast) and at other times of the day allowing them in the adult pool. The only place that we saw the hotel handle this was in the outdoor Jacuzzi where it was posted no one under fifteen. I am a Hilton Honors diamond member and paid for the hotel with points. I feel that the hotel price is high however, when compared to someplace like Cape May, with mom and pop hotels that run over $250 per night with a lot less amenities it’s not that bad. Overall it is a beautiful hotel. This is very much a resort for families. We would definitely return here, just not this week.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Needs a bit more staff”
Reviews.Author: arivera
Reviews.Content: It was unfortunate that my family and I stayed in Ocean City at the same time that Tropical Storm Ernesto was visiting. Usually staying at a beachfront property during a tropical event is not the thing you want to do, but the amenties at the Hilton made the stay quite enjoyable. One of the first things that is noticeable is the luxury and amenities of the hotel. The lobby was finely appointed with tropical paintings and cozy furntiture, perfect for sipping a Starbucks that you can get right there in the Lobby. There are three pools on the property -- an indoor pool (which helped a lot as we could not go out much), an adult pool, and a kiddie pool (complete with slides, a lazy river, a whirlpool and fountains). There is also a hot tub next to the kidde pool athough it is for adults only. The water at all pools were quite warm, so we actually were able to enjoy the outdoor pool right before an after the Storm, when the temperatures were still cool. And if only the weather cooperated we could have headed down the stairs to the beach. The rooms were very nice, all offering balconies and ocean views. It had a large bath which was perfect for the wife and kids, and though we did not use it, since we were afraid to leave the room and get groceries, the efficieny kitchen with full size refrigerator, stove, microwave, and dishwasher The flat screen TV s and jacuzzi tub were icing on the cake. The seond thing you notice is the staff's eagerness to please. They all greeted you with casual smiles and it seemed that they were genuinely happy to serve their guests. The bellman were friendly and helpful, the desk staff were very nice, and even room service was cheerful when you spoke with them on the phone. I especially was impressed by the concierge service, who not only were willing to provide excellent suggestions on eating establishments and activites, they also seemed to really know what OC was about and was more than eager to chat it up with you. During the Storm, we noticed that we lost power, but the generator quickly kicked in to keep everything moving along. This was very comforting, considering that the hotel was quite booked and there were many children present. Quite a few properties in the main island lost power during the sttorm and were not as quickly able to recover. While I thought this was a great hotel, it did not come without its challenges: 1) Restaurant staff were overburdened. We felt sorry for the waitress who was helping us at the Bar restaurant, as she was the only one there and the kitchen seemed to be understaffed as well. Many patrons were waiting well over an hour and a half for their food orders. 2) We all know that hotel food is not an economical dining option. However the Hilton Suites was out of control. Two burgers, two kids meals (no dessert or coffee), and 6 drinks wound up costing me $105 (and that was with the hour wait). While the food is very good at the Hotel, it was not worth the price. I would not recommend eating at the hotel if you have a choice. 3) The Kids Activites were a nice touch (and needed especially during the Storm) however it was very disorganized and frankly a little dangerous, as it seems that the staff does not yet have the experience in doing this. Many supplies ran out quickly and there was no organization in handing out supplies or managing the activities. The dangerous part came from the fact that the Kids Activites were basically meant for that -- an activity for kids, not a babysitting session. It is unfortunate that many parents do not watch their kids as they should, and many parents simply left their kids in the large conference room alone when there was not that much supervision by hotel staff. Kids could (and did) leave the conference room unsupervised. Other kids, who were looking for their parents who skipped out on them, wound up sitting there and waiting for their parents, and come of them started crying. If your family vacation plans include dumping your kids somewhere, you may want to review the meaning of the word 'family', and not bring the kids at all if you do not want to be with them. 4) The phone for whatever reason kept ringing at random times throughout the entire stay. No one knew why this was happening, though I think there was a glitch with their telephone network. i wound up having to disconnect the phones in the room to make it stop. All in all, it was a good hotel and I would definitely go back again. The hotel simply needs to augment their staff and require a little more training to make it a truly exceptional place to stay in Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not worth the price.....”
Reviews.Author: travelswith2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with our kids in mind (5 and 3) because we expected to have breakfast and lunch in the room... We checked in on Monday and didn't have our room cleaned until late wednesday. We were on our last towels (housekeeping knocked on our door tuesday night after 9pm but the kids were asleep). Also, we woke tuesday morning and our stove wasnt working - we called at 7:30 am and they didnt send anyone until well after nine. We were offered free breakfast (in the restaurant only) and anyone with kids knows sometimes you are better off in your room. In all the hotel was clean and very nice, but for $430 a night I was expecting service to be a lot better. I don't think I will stay there again.
